story:
Imagine yourself in a photo studio, alone and completely naked with a black mask in one hand and a remote camera trigger in the other. You get one shot, and the result is up to you.
Do you dare?
Push your limits and join in on the 1000BodiesProject now!

Whether you’re an experienced nude model, or have never been naked in your life, whether you’re a policeman, real estate agent, kindergarden teacher, retired, student, lawyer, office clerk, old, young, fat, skinny, lacking an arm or leg, covered in tattoos or piercings, male or female, exhibitionist or the most shy person in the world, you can participate in this project. Everybody is wanted.

It takes 10 minutes, you take the photo yourself, it’s free of charge, and it’s fun!

The project will result in an exhibition and a photo book.

The rules of the project are:
You are alone in the studio when the picture is taken, and you take it yourself.
You can wear no clothes, but you will be given a mask to be used as you wish.
You pose however you feel like. There will be no mirror – you take the photo when you feel comfortable.
You have 1 – one – shot.

Total progress as of nov 19 2012 - 352 participants.

 

The project has been held in Oslo, Lilestrøm and Røros, Norway, London, UK, and San Francisco, CA, US.

The SF shoot attracted a lot of interest, and we reached capacity halfway throught the day. I also received a lot of emails from people all over the US that like the project and wants it to their town. 

The aim of this campaign is to raise the funds to do a multi-city tour throughout the US in 2013, bringing the project to more people.

story:
About me

My name is Corinna Del Bianco and I am researcher in architecture and urban studies and I’m Adjunct Professor of urban design at the Politecnico di Milano. My research and professional interests regard local development and I conduct documentation and analysis of the cultural identity of places with a focus on the culture of living in self-built urban environments. I am founder and board member of the Fondazione Romualdo Del Bianco, a private foundation based in Florence, Italy, dedicated to creating dialogues among cultures through heritage and travel. In 2020 I founded the Studio Corinna Del Bianco in which I conduct research, curatorship projects and educational activities on the topics of architecture and urban design.

 

The project

Since the second half of the twentieth century, the majority of the islands in the Mediterranean Sea have turned their economic activity exclusively to tourism, abandoning their history, their productive realities and subsequently their cultural identities. These islands—from the Pelagie to the Cyclades—hold rich diversity in terms of location, conformation, resources and history.

 

Born in 2018, ‘Archipelago’ is a research project that intends to document and valorize the diversity of the cultural identities of the Mediterranean islands. It considers all archipelagos and islands, particularly those which are inhabited, seeking to uncover the relationships that dwellings and architecture create with the sea and the land. The project revolves around photography, maps and a selection of recommended readings. It is a long-term project that is expected to span 50 years, of which the first goal is representing the Italian islands.

The debut exhibition of the project was asked to be shown at the Italian Cultural Institute in Hamburg, Germany in December 2021. The exhibition will showcase a combination of maps and photographs of a selection of Italian archipelagos: the Tuscan Archipelago (Arcipelago Toscano), Aegadian Islands (Isole Egadi), Aeolian Islands (Isole Eolie) and the Pelagie Islands (Isole Pelagie).

Following the visit to Hamburg, the exhibition is expected to travel to other premises around the world.

 

What I need and what you get

I need approximately € 6000 to print the 48 photographs and perks that form the core component of the exhibition. The photographs will be printed from a reputable, local printing studio in Hamburg. You can donate any amount (no matter how small!) and I will include your name on the list of acknowledgements (unless you would rather remain anonymous). Alternatively, you can claim one of the perks that I am offering. These include 5 limited-edition postcards or a copy of the exhibition book (electronic or print). If I fall short of the goal, whatever money I receive will still be used to print and frame the photographs at the highest quality.

 

The impact

The exhibition raises awareness for the protection of culture by uncovering the beauty and diversity of the islands, helping to foster the development of new economies and protecting thousands of years of history.

Archipelago contributes to the 2005 UNESCO Convention for the Protection and Promotion of Cultural Diversity with regard to forms of living on the islands of the Mediterranean Sea.

 

Other ways you can help

If you are unable to contribute financially, I would really appreciate it if you could share the project and help get the word out!

story:
Mi nombre es María José Gómez, soy Periodista y este último año me he iniciado en la fotografía documental, nací y me crié en Caracas-Venezuela, país que actualmente sufre la crisis económica y política más fuerte de su historia, y actualmente desde hace 3 meses vivo en Ciudad de México.

Por mi trabajo en Venezuela durante los meses mayo y junio sobre los protestantes que se hacen llamar “La Resistencia”, he sido seleccionada para participar en el Visionado de Portafolios ERRANTE a celebrarse en Uruguay, donde editores, curadores y fotógrafos reconocidos mundialmente revisaran mi trabajo, y así obtener oportunidades laborales a futuro e impulsar mi carrera. Cabe destacar que son solamente 80 personas quienes podrán participar de esta revisión de portafolio, y me siento muy honrada en ser una de las seleccionadas. 

Desafortunadamente, y como consecuencia de la situación económica en Venezuela, para mí todavía es muy difícil costearme el viaje a Uruguay. No cuento con los recursos necesarios para asistir al evento que se realizará durante los primeros 3 días del mes de diciembre y que tal vez sea una oportunidad única para mí. Por eso, busco alcanzar esta meta con el apoyo de todos ustedes. 

Para costear los boletos aéreos, el alojamiento, los gastos de alimentación y transporte durante mi estancia en Montevideo-Uruguay donde se desarrollará este evento en el que he sido seleccionada e invitada mi meta es conseguir $1500. 

--

My name is María José Gómez and I am a journalist. I was born and raised in Caracas, Venezuela, a country that has been suffering the strongest political and economical crisis of its history. For the last 3 months I live in Mexico City. This last year I started working on documental photography.

 

Thanks to my work on Venezuela during the months of May and June, focused on the rioters that call themselves "La Resistencia", I have been selected to participate on the ERRANTE Portfolio Viewing to be carried out in Uruguay, where globally recognized editors, curators and photographers will review my work. There, I hope to find job opportunities that will boost my career.

 

Unfortunately, as a consequence of the economical situation of my country of origin, it is still very hard for me to afford a flight to Uruguay. I don't have the monetary means to go to said event, which is to be carried out during the first 3 days of December and represents an unique opportunity for me as a photographer. That's the reason why I seek to achieve this goal with your support.

 

To afford the flight tickets, accommodations, food expenses and internal transportation fees during my stay in Montevideo, Uruguay, place where the ERRANTE Portfolio Viewing is to be held, my goal is to raise 1500$.

story:
A Book of Stars is a photographic monograph that collects work done mostly in Puerto Rico over the last couple of years. The book features more than a hundred full-color pages of astrophotography and will include basic suggestions about how and where to see stars in Puerto Rico and elsewhere.

This is the second delivery under my independent book label, Roqué Stahl Ltd., and it follows the successful crowdfunding campaign of Sounds of Watching, a photographic guide to birds in Old San Juan, published in 2016.

The simplest way to contribute is by reserving a copy of the book. Funders wanting to provide additional support can get an accompanying tabloid-sized folio of photos taken in Chile, Yukon, Connecticut and Massachusetts. Those wanting to support my work further can perk-up with prints, both framed and unframed, and with additional copies of the book.

The campaign goal has been set from a basic version of the book and the minimum time it will take me to complete it. So, the more people we are able to bring into the project, the more time I can put into the final edition and design, and the better the book we can all get for our money’s worth.

Please share A Book of Stars with friends and family, help make this real!

Thanks a bunch,

Javier A. Román-Nieves

•

Un libro de estrellas es una monografía fotográfica que colecciona trabajos hechos mayormente en Puerto Rico a través de los últimos años. El libro contiene más de cien páginas de astrofotografía a todo color e incluye consejos básicos sobre cómo y dónde ver las estrellas en Puerto Rico y en otros lugares.

Esta es la segunda entrega bajo mi sello independiente Roqué Stahl Ltd., y sigue al éxito de crowdfunding de la campaña para Sonidos del Avistamiento, una guía fotográfica a las aves del Viejo San Juan, publicada en 2016.

La manera más sencilla de contribuir es reservando una copia del libro. Cualquier donante que quiera proveer apoyo adicional puede adquirir también un folio separado tamaño tabloide que contiene fotos tomadas en Chile, Yukon, Connecticut y Massachusetts. Aquellas personas que quieran apoyar mi trabajo aún más, pueden adquirir perks adicionales, tales como impresiones fotográficas enmarcadas y sin enmarcar, así como copias extras del libro.

La meta de la campaña ha sido calculada a partir de una versión básica del libro y del tiempo mínimo que me va a tomar completarlo. De manera que mientras más personas se unan al proyecto, más tiempo le puedo dedicar a su edición y diseño final, además que podemos obtener un mejor libro a cambio de nuestro dinero.

Por favor, ¡comparte Un libro de estrellas con tus amistades y familiares, ¡ayuda a hacerlo realidad!


Gracias mil,

Javier A. Román-Nieves

story:
About the Project

The project "Northern Russian Monasteries" started several years ago by the team of the Russian photographer Oleg Yushkov. By now, a huge collection of top-quality images of major northern monasteries (particularly in Vologda region) has been gathered (in different seasons and weather conditions). Moreover, an illustrated album "Volodga" has already been published.

Now we are starting the next step of this project. Our team is planning to publish an illustrated album on Ferapontov monastery (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ferapontov_Monastery), one of the most beautiful and sophisticated monasteries in Russia, which is included in the UNESCO World Heritage List. We would like to attract attention to this great place and to rethink its history in our images.

Our team has already prepared all the images for the project (we are pleased to present some of them to you here) and also a text in Russian and English about the long and rich history of the monastery.

Now we need funds to finalize the project and publish the illustrated album "Ferapontov monastery". If we reach our funding goal, we will be able to publish it by end October 2013.

  

Our gifts to Contributors

We are eager to share with you the beauty of the astonishing cultural, architectural, religious and natural sights of our region - the Russian North!

Therefore, everybody who contributes into the future of our project will get a special gift from us. Our collection of presents includes:

  • Beautiful postcards and sets of postcards with the views of ancient Russian monasteries, churches and landscapes
  • Newly published album "Ferapontov monastery" (in October-November 2013)
  • Large printed photos of our great architectural sights (you can choose the exact photo yourself)

Every gift will be signed by the authors. In each postcard/set you will receive warm thanks from our team.

Social Impact

The ultimate goal of our project is to create unique illustrated albums that attract attention of local citizens, children, tourists from Russia and from abroad to the great architectural and cultural heritage of the Russian North.

Can the project positively influence the local community? Definitely yes!

  • We will distribute 10% of the illustrated albums to local public and school libraries (in Vologda region) in order to increase the interest of the youngest generation to the local culture and traditions
  • We will work (and are already working) in cooperation with the monasteries and will help them to attract more visitors and pilgrims
  • Our illustrated albums will indirectly impact the touristic attractiveness of the region by increasing travelers' satisfaction and curiosity

Further Activities

If this part of the project is successful, we will continue our activities further. Our collection, which is widened every year, allows us to start working on several other magnificent northern architectural sights:

  • Kirillo-Belozersky Monastery (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kirillo-Belozersky_Monastery)

  •  Totma (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Totma)

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like our project, please help us to share this information with your friends and colleagues!

Together we CAN promote traditional culture and prevent it from vanishing!

THANK YOU VERY MUCH!

story:
ENGLISH /// (En Français plus bas)

THE PROGRAM We are the Dawson College Commercial Photography Graduates of Winter 2013. The goal of this program is to give graduating students the technical, visual & business skills to perform commercial tasks typically done by self-employed or staff photographers in a manner that meets industry & professional standards. We have been instructed in various aspects of professional photography including advertising & editorial illustration, portraiture, catalogue photography, architectural photography, fashion photography, industrial photography & digital imaging. In courses designed to cover both theory & practice, we learned to use small & large format cameras, tungsten & electronic flash for studio or location lighting, & computer imaging software for output & media applications. Throughout the program, a mature & disciplined approach to commercial photography was emphasized & at the same time, we were encouraged to develop a personal creative vision of the world.

THE VERNISSAGE We have finally reached the culmination of all of our work – it is time to graduate, & exhibit our work to friends, fans, potential clients & buyers. We will be holding a Vernissage at Dawson College, & we are in need of contributions to further our potential for success as we head into the workforce. That is where you come in -- your money will be helping to fund our Vernissage in order to make it the most impressive visual presentation possible.

THE GOAL We have 1500$ granted to us by the college, but that only goes so far with nearly 20 graduates. We are hoping to raise a total of 5000$. This money will go to the matting & potential framing of portfolios, producing our promo book, refreshments for the exhibition, printing of posters & so on. Regardless of whether we reach our entire goal or not, the money will be going straight to the Vernissage – we will produce our exhibition in the most economical & visually inspiring manner with the funding we have. The more funding we have, the more effective our exhibit will be.

THE IMPORTANCE Some of us will soon be off to find employment in the field as assistants or employees, whereas others will be diving head first into opening their own studios & businesses. This is not the only portfolio we will ever produce, but for many of us this Vernissage is a golden opportunity to get a head start in the industry here in Montreal. The reason this Vernissage is so important is due to the fact that industry professionals will be viewing our work -- these guests may provide possible business ventures for us in the future, & we want to impress. We understand that not everyone can contribute a monetary value to our campaign -- however, you can still help by spreading the word or donating goods & services to our exhibition. We really appreciate your help!

----------------------------------------------------------------

TRADITIONAL CORPORATE SPONSORSHIP

If you would like information about Traditional Corporate sponsorship packages for your business.  Please contact the Program Director Ms Laurel Breidon (lbreidon@dawsoncollege.qc.ca).  Please use the subject "VERNISSAGE SPONSORSHIP"

----------------------------------------------------------------

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you can't contribute financially to the vernissage, please consider helping advertise the campaign and the events for our other fund-raising efforts by posting the link(s) to various social media and using Facebook or the Indiegogo sharing tools.

----------------------------------------------------------------

DATES TO REMEMBER

Please feel free to join us for any of our Vernissage Activities

Public Critiques, Night 1 :  Wednesday 11th December 2013.  6:30PM Dawson College at the studio, room 1G09.

Public Critiques, Night 2 :  Thursday 12th December 2013.  6:30PM, Dawson College at the studio, room 1G09.

During two nights, portfolio will be presented to jury composed by professionals from image industry.

Vernissage Evening : Tuesday 17th December 2013.  6:30PM, Dawson College at the Warren G flowers Gallery - Dawson main entrance on 4001 De Maisonneuve West.

Open Gallery Days : From Tuesday 17th December to Friday 20th December 2013, 10am-9pm, Dawson College at the Warren G flowers Gallery - Main entrance on 4001 De Maisonneuve West.

----------------------------------------------------------------

PAYPAL PAYMENTS

PayPal payments are made to a verified account. 

----------------------------------------------------------------

FRANCAIS /// 

LE PROGRAMME  Nous sommes les diplômés du Collège Dawson en Photographie Commerciale pour l'hiver 2013. L'objectif de ce programme est de donner aux étudiants diplômés, les compétences techniques, visuelles et d'affaires qui respectent les normes professionnelles de l'industrie. Nous avons été formés dans les divers aspects de la photographie professionnelle : publicité, éditorial, illustration, portrait, photographie de catalogue, photographie d'architecture, photographie de mode, photographie industrielle et imagerie numérique. Les cours étant destinés à couvrir à la fois la théorie et la pratique, nous avons appris à utiliser des caméras avec des capteurs de petits et grands format, des lumières tungstène et des flashes électroniques pour l'éclairage de studio ainsi que les principaux logiciels informatiques d'imagerie et des applications multimédia. Tout au long du programme, une approche éprouvée et disciplinée à la photographie commerciale nous a été transmise et en même temps, nous avons été encouragés à développer une vision personnelle de la création et du monde.

LE VERNISSAGE  Nous avons finalement atteint le point culminant de tout notre programme, il est temps d'obtenir nos diplômes et de présenter notre travail aux amis, fans, clients potentiels et acheteurs. Nous organisons un vernissage au Collège Dawson, et nous avons besoin de votre contribution pour assurer la réussite de cette soirée importante.  

L'OBJECTIF   1500 $ nous sont accordés par le collège, mais cela ne couvre pas toutes les dépenses pour le vernissage de 17 diplômés. Nous espérons recueillir un total de 5000 $. Cet argent ira à l'encadrement des photos, la production de notre livre promotionnel, des rafraîchissements, et bouchées lors du vernissage, la location de panneaux pour l'accrochage des photos, l'impression d'affiches et ainsi de suite. Tout l'argent récolté ira directement au vernissage. Nous allons produire notre exposition de la manière la plus économique et visuellement stimulante avec le financement que nous aurons. Le plus de financement nous aurons, la plus efficace sera notre exposition !

L'IMPORTANCE

Certains d'entre nous seront bientôt à la recherche d'un emploi dans le domaine comme assistants ou employés, alors que d'autres seront plongés tête première dans l'ouverture de leurs propres studios et/ou entreprises. Pour plusieurs d'entre nous, ce vernissage est une occasion en or pour prendre un bon départ dans l'industrie ici, à Montréal. En effet, des professionnels de l'industrie seront présents lors de cette soirée et nous souhaitons les impressionner. Nous comprenons que tout le monde ne peut apporter une aide monétaire à notre projet, cependant, vous pouvez aussi aider en diffusant le mot ou en donnant des biens et/ou services. Nous apprécions grandement votre aide. Merci pour votre contribution !

----------------------------------------------------------------

SPONSOR TRADITIONNEL POUR LES ENTREPRISES

Si vous souhaitez des informations sur les moyens traditionnels de sponsoriser notre projet, veuillez contacter la directrice du programme Mlle Laurel Breidon (lbreidon@dawsoncollege.qc.ca) en mentionnant "Sponsor vernissage" comme sujet.

----------------------------------------------------------------

AUTRES MOYENS D'AIDER

Si vous ne pouvez pas contribuer financièrement à notre vernissage, nous apprécierions que vous fassiez connaître notre levée de fond en partageant le lien de la campagne sur les média sociaux tel que facebook.

----------------------------------------------------------------

DATES IMPORTANTES

Nous vous attendons nombreux pour toutes les activités liées au vernissage:

Critiques de portfolio, Soir 1 :  Mercredi 11 Décembre 2013. 18:30 - Dawson College - Studio salle 1G09.

Critiques de portfolio, Soir 2 :  Jeudi 12 Décembre 2013. 18:30 - Dawson College - Studio salle 1G09.

Pendant deux soirs les portfolios seront présentés à un jury composé de professionnels de l'image.

Soirée Vernissage : Mardi 17 Décembre 2013.  18:30, Dawson College - Galerie Warren G flowers - Entrée principale sur 4001 De Maisonneuve Ouest.

Jours d'ouverture de la galerie : Du Mardi 17 Décembre au Vendredi 20 Décembre 2013.  10:00-21:00h, Dawson College - Galerie Warren G flowers - Entrée principale sur 4001 De Maisonneuve Ouest.

----------------------------------------------------------------

PAIEMENTS PAYPAL

Les paiements PayPal s'effectuent depuis un compte valide.
story_txt:
ENGLISH /// (En Français plus bas) 

THE PROGRAM We are the Dawson College Commercial Photography
 Graduates of Winter 2013. The goal of this program is to give 
graduating students the technical, visual & business skills to 
perform commercial tasks typically done by self-employed or staff 
photographers in a manner that meets industry & professional 
standards. We have been instructed in various aspects of professional 
photography including advertising & editorial illustration, 
portraiture, catalogue photography, architectural photography, fashion 
photography, industrial photography & digital imaging. In courses 
designed to cover both theory & practice, we learned to use small 
& large format cameras, tungsten & electronic flash for studio 
or location lighting, & computer imaging software for output & 
media applications. Throughout the program, a mature & disciplined 
approach to commercial photography was emphasized & at the same 
time, we were encouraged to develop a personal creative vision of the 
world.

THE VERNISSAGE We have finally reached the culmination 
of all of our work – it is time to graduate, & exhibit our work to 
friends, fans, potential clients & buyers. We will be holding a 
Vernissage at Dawson College, & we are in need of contributions to 
further our potential for success as we head into the workforce. That is
 where you come in -- your money will be helping to fund our Vernissage 
in order to make it the most impressive visual presentation possible.

THE GOAL We have 1500$ granted to us by the college, 
but that only goes so far with nearly 20 graduates. We are hoping to 
raise a total of 5000$. This money will go to the matting & 
potential framing of portfolios, producing our promo book, refreshments 
for the exhibition, printing of posters & so on. Regardless of 
whether we reach our entire goal or not, the money will be going 
straight to the Vernissage – we will produce our exhibition in the most 
economical & visually inspiring manner with the funding we have. The
 more funding we have, the more effective our exhibit will be.

THE IMPORTANCE Some of us will soon be off to find 
employment in the field as assistants or employees, whereas others will 
be diving head first into opening their own studios & businesses. 
This is not the only portfolio we will ever produce, but for many of us 
this Vernissage is a golden opportunity to get a head start in the 
industry here in Montreal. The reason this Vernissage is so important is
 due to the fact that industry professionals will be viewing our work --
 these guests may provide possible business ventures for us in the 
future, & we want to impress. We understand that not everyone can 
contribute a monetary value to our campaign -- however, you can still 
help by spreading the word or donating goods & services to our 
exhibition. We really appreciate your help!
----------------------------------------------------------------

TRADITIONAL CORPORATE SPONSORSHIP
If you would like information about Traditional 
Corporate sponsorship packages for your business.  Please contact the 
Program Director Ms Laurel Breidon (lbreidon@dawsoncollege.qc.ca).  Please use the subject "VERNISSAGE SPONSORSHIP"
----------------------------------------------------------------


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
If you can't contribute financially to the vernissage, please 
consider helping advertise the campaign and the events for our other fund-raising efforts by posting the link(s) to various social media and 
using Facebook or the Indiegogo sharing tools.

----------------------------------------------------------------
DATES TO REMEMBER
Please feel free to join us for any of our Vernissage Activities

Public Critiques, Night 1 :  Wednesday 11th December 2013.  6:30PM Dawson College at the studio, room 1G09.

Public Critiques, Night 2 :  Thursday 12th December 2013.  6:30PM, Dawson College at the studio, room 1G09.
During two nights, portfolio will be presented to jury composed by professionals from image industry.

Vernissage Evening : Tuesday 17th December 2013.  6:30PM, Dawson College at the Warren G flowers Gallery - Dawson main entrance on 4001 De Maisonneuve West.

Open Gallery Days : From Tuesday 17th December to Friday 20th December 2013, 10am-9pm, Dawson College at the Warren G flowers Gallery - Main entrance on 4001 De Maisonneuve West.
----------------------------------------------------------------
PAYPAL PAYMENTS
PayPal payments are made to a verified account. 

----------------------------------------------------------------
FRANCAIS /// 
LE PROGRAMME  Nous sommes les diplômés du Collège Dawson en Photographie Commerciale pour
 l'hiver 2013. L'objectif de ce programme est de donner aux 
étudiants diplômés, les compétences techniques, visuelles et d'affaires 
qui respectent les normes professionnelles de l'industrie. Nous avons 
été formés dans les divers aspects de la photographie professionnelle : 
publicité, éditorial, illustration, portrait, photographie de catalogue,
 photographie d'architecture, photographie de mode, photographie 
industrielle et imagerie numérique. Les cours étant destinés à couvrir à
 la fois la théorie et la pratique, nous avons appris à utiliser des 
caméras avec des capteurs de petits et grands format, des lumières 
tungstène et des flashes électroniques pour l'éclairage de studio ainsi 
que les principaux logiciels informatiques d'imagerie et des 
applications multimédia. Tout au long du programme, une approche 
éprouvée et disciplinée à la photographie commerciale nous a été 
transmise et en même temps, nous avons été encouragés à développer une 
vision personnelle de la création et du monde.

finalement atteint le point culminant de tout notre programme, il est

vernissage, la location de panneaux pour l'accrochage des photos,

directement au vernissage. Nous allons produire notre exposition de la 
manière la plus économique et visuellement stimulante avec le 
financement que nous aurons. Le plus de financement nous aurons, la plus
 efficace sera notre exposition !


L'IMPORTANCE
Certains

comme assistants ou employés, alors que d'autres seront plongés tête

peut apporter une aide monétaire à notre projet, cependant, vous pouvez

Nous apprécions grandement votre aide. Merci pour votre contribution !

Critiques de portfolio, Soir 2 :  Jeudi 12 Décembre 2013. 18:30 - Dawson College - Studio salle 1G09.

story:
Dear friends, I need your support to do a series of photo exhibitions about the Europe’s CLIMATE KILLER NUMBER ONE with a unique perspective of direct struggles against its chaotic influences on the local environment and climate in general. Exhibitions will firstly take place in West Germany, in towns around the largest opencast mine in Europe—the main causer of all the alarming issues explained in the further text.



The situation:

A 12.000 years old & once the biggest forest in the region, the beautiful Hambach forest is being completely destroyed because of the largest opencast mine in Europe—located in the west Germany, around 25 km west from Cologne [50.91061, 6.517956 http://goo.gl/maps/XIFoa]. The Hambach opencast mine „measures 85 sq km and contains 2.5 billion tons of lignite at a depth of up to 450m“. The responsible owner of this mine and many others in the region is the leading power company, the notorious RWE [http://www.rwe.com]. The process goes like this: They cut trees, dig out the earth couple of hundreds meters deep, then excavate the brown coal (also called lignite), transport it by trains to some of many power plants situated around the mine where they burn the brown coal to produce electric energy. So far I know, the Rhenish lignite-mining area, or it's better to say RWE is the climate killer number one in Europe—achieving all the bad highscores.

To dig out they use the world's biggest excavators which are 220m long, 96m high & weigh 13,500 tons. „Every day, they can extract 240,000 tons of coal – enough to fill up a football stadium 30m high.“

The most dirtiest & non-renewable way possible. What is left behind? A giant hole, actually the biggest on our continent & that's not all.

People are being permanently evicted because of the expansion of the mines in the surrounding area and future greedy plans of the RWE company. I've seen three former villages where the entire life has been completely dislocated and merged into, let say, one new little town—the company moved everything, stuff from the churches, cemeteries.... everything. People's lifes have been interupted as well as their former neighborhoods which will be completely destroyed as the mines around are getting bigger.

The radioactive fine/respirable dust coming out of the mine (more fine dust than all car traffic in Germany) is causing serious health problems to lots of people in the surrounding area. Because the excavators are mining 24/7 including the night time as well, the emission of loud noise is a big problem for animals in the forest and the strong light is polluting our sky (the mine at night looks like the surface of the Moon, but not that calm at all!). What also happens is subsidence and loss of aquifers which affects local farmers who have to irrigate crops more often. Of course there's also a great amount of CO2 being emitted by RWE ‒ close to 100,000,000 tonnes per year ‒ and they are planning to build even more power plants in the near future. They just built the new railway for transporting coal and in cooperation with the road construction company they built a new section of the highway between Düren & Kerpen because the Hambach opencast mine is growing [official info: http://bit.ly/1bySwJc].

With its high proportion of oak, small-leaf linden etc. the Hambach forest is an ecologically valuable habitat for a host of endangered plant & animal species (for example rare speices of bat and mice) which are in danger since the Hambach opencast mine is active and their natural territory is becoming smaller. Once upon a time the forest covered an area of 5,500 hectares. Unfortunatelly, more and more trees are being cut down every year.

I'm worried that people's relationship to the nature is being lost because RWE and such companies are irretrievably & greedily destroying everything on their way just to make more money. They calculate values in how many times per day the excavators are turning the big bucket-wheel, they calculate on how many vagons of coal they have transported each day etc. I keep asking myself: How RWE can do all this crime to the nature & people who live there, legally; and where is all this going?



About me:

My name is Danijel Šivinjski and I'm a photographer & artist passionate about documentary and experimental work. I'm coming from Istria, the north-west coast of Croatia, but I’m currently living and working in Serbia. As a documentary photographer I am mostly focused on the social & environmental issues and as an artist I desire to discover the next level & ask deeper questions. Check my website www.sivinjski.com or check some of my previous documentary work below on this page.



The story:

I was shocked last year when I've heard what's going on around the Hambach opencast mine. But, on the other hand, I was happy to see there's also a group of activists in the forest next to the mine, struggling against its bad influences [their blog http://hambachforest.blogsport.de]. I've contacted them and decided to come and do a photo reportage about their activities.

On 14th of April 2012. a group of activist squatted a part of the Hambach forest which was threatened by clear cutting. They established an occupation camp there, built treehouses, installed hanging platforms and built wooden houses on the ground as well. This whole infrastructure in the camp was a new meeting point for people to connect, debate about issues of the mining area, but also a place for growing the culture of resistance. People there were horrified about the total destruction of life & nature and said „the current politics totally failed and keep on failing in answering the pressing matter of climate change!“. The activists are not only protecting the forest, but also asking a very important question: “What do we want our economy to look like in the future, if we do not want to destroy the climate of this planet?”. Burning fossil fuels is for sure not the answer and companies like RWE shall loose their „right“ of determining the future of our planet, unscrupulously destroying the local & global fundaments of life.



My photo story is all about the struggle:

This is a story about very brave people who decided to put their lives on the line and fight against „legal“ destruction of complete life under, on and above the ground. I spent lots of time with the activists in the forest and around the mine trying to capture all more-or-less crucial moments of the struggle; struggle was my main focus. At some point I realised that I was the only photographer present in some of direct actions and that my role is becoming more important, role of documenting these historical events.

After some time direct actions became more effective and caused more damage to RWE, as on the other side RWE’s mining activities caused more damage to the nature as well. I felt like moving on a thin line between these two conflict sides and that’s actually what I summed up in a story for this unique photo exhibition.



In November it took 4 days for 500 police officers to evict the first forest occupation. That was the longest and most expensive eviction in Germany so far. During the eviction I was also arrested, unjustifiably, as the only journalist (independent photojournalist), the only who has some really important photographs of that terrible police event.

Since the eviction there exists the second occupation camp on the the meadow close to the forest. They have survived a cold winter and are still struggling. Fortunatelly, as before, they are gathering a big support from the local people.

After the whole experience, my photo story became very deep so I decided to come back again and finally exhibit.



Why this exhibition is important:

I believe my photographic documentation of this very specific activist struggles is very important as an awareness factor of delivering the truth direct to the people; as well as a celebration of past fights and inspiration for the potential future ones. I believe that the artistic language of my photographs means “change”.

The exhibition shows specific aesthetics, the beauty of “here & now”.  It shows contents and ideas about the real world, nature, human beings & life. It has ethical base, moral weight and for that a deep humanistic nature. Documentary photography is here to communicate between the viewer and reality without any drastic post-production, just pure frozen moments. Photography as a medium can touch people's emotions and awake their consciousness of the reality, which can inspire and motivate them for taking constructive actions or joining such a movement.



Why your support is important:

I kept all the photographs unpublic for a whole year now and I need your support to make them public. I need funds simply for two things: to print photographs and buy a two-way bus ticket to Germany. You can donate/buy perks (listed on the right) by Credit Card or via PayPal; if none of these options are not working for you but you still wanna donate please contact me to danijel {at} sivinjski {dot} com.

To give back I’ve prepared unique perks for you: A Photo Book with Extended Story (limited edition; larger selection of photographs with descriptions), an Exclusive Sneak-peak Catalogue (all the photographs that will be exhibited), special Thank-You letters and a big set of signed photo prints. All the perks will be high-quality printed & shipped directly to you.


Funding details:

$600 =

$390 for printing photographs on film, mounting on big plastic board & cutting into single pieces;
$168 for traveling costs (two-way bus ticket);
$42 Indiegogo Fees.

If I get more funds than asked I would give a half to the activists and a half will use to travel with the exhibition even more, to share the story with as many people as possible.



My previous documentary work:

- The first try to establish a Community centre in Novi Sad, Serbia (2012)

- No Border No Nation in Düsseldorf, Germany (2012)



Other ways you can help....

1) Help spreading a word about the campaign & the importance of this unique exhibition. Thank you very much. It means a lot.

- Share this campaign with your friends & other people that may be interested.
- Share on any social networks that you have such as Facebook, Twitter, Google+ etc. (it is also more effective when you use direct messages to people you know: use email and/or personal messages).
- You can also spread the word by Indiegogo share tools listed below the video.
- Like my Facebook Page facebook.com/sivinjski & follow me on Twitter twitter.com/sivinjski to get more fresh updates.


2) I already have some locations confirmed, but you can help me find more places where I can exhibit next ‒ contact me to danijel {at} sivinjski {dot} com.



More resources:

- Hambach Forest, the beginning of the occupation [en] http://youtu.be/BthIz6WRm78
- Hambacher Forest, summary and latest news [en] http://youtu.be/E3mllM8ImTA
- Latest Police Violence [en] http://youtu.be/Y8hIVnZuc8E
- Protests on the day of the eviction [de] http://youtu.be/Mgw8d67fwPQ
- Interview on my arrest [de] http://bit.ly/10K6qAV



Contact:

Danijel Šivinjski

danijel {at} sivinjski {dot} com
+381 (0)62 12 18 900

support to make them public. I need funds simply for two things: to print
photographs and buy a two-way bus ticket to Germany. You can donate/buy perks (listed on the right) by Credit Card or via PayPal; if none of these options are not working for you but you still wanna donate please contact me to danijel {at} sivinjski {dot} com.
To give back I’ve prepared unique perks for you: A Photo Book with Extended
Story (limited edition; larger selection of photographs with descriptions),
an Exclusive Sneak-peak Catalogue (all the photographs that will be
exhibited), special Thank-You letters and a big set of signed photo
prints. All the perks will be high-quality printed & shipped directly
to you.

Funding details:
$600 =
$390 for printing photographs on film,
mounting on big plastic board & cutting into single
pieces;
$168 for traveling costs (two-way bus
ticket);
$42 Indiegogo Fees.
If I get more funds than asked I would
give a half to the activists and a half will use to travel with the exhibition
even more, to share the story with as many people as possible.


My previous documentary work:

- The first try to establish a Community centre in Novi Sad, Serbia (2012)
- No Border No Nation in Düsseldorf, Germany (2012)



Other ways you can help....

1) Help spreading a word about the campaign & the importance of this
unique exhibition. Thank you very much. It means a lot.
- Share this campaign with your friends & other people that may be
interested.
- Share on any social networks that you have such as Facebook, Twitter,
Google+ etc. (it is also more effective when you use direct messages to people you know: use email and/or personal messages).
- You can also spread the word by Indiegogo share tools listed below the video.
- Like my Facebook Page facebook.com/sivinjski & follow me on
Twitter twitter.com/sivinjski to get more fresh updates.

2) I already have some locations confirmed, but you can help me find more
places where I can exhibit next ‒ contact me to danijel {at} sivinjski {dot}
com.



More resources:

- Hambach Forest, the beginning of the occupation [en] http://youtu.be/BthIz6WRm78
- Hambacher Forest, summary and latest news [en] http://youtu.be/E3mllM8ImTA
- Latest Police Violence [en] http://youtu.be/Y8hIVnZuc8E
- Protests on the day of the eviction [de] http://youtu.be/Mgw8d67fwPQ
- Interview on my arrest [de] http://bit.ly/10K6qAV



Contact:

Danijel Šivinjski
danijel {at} sivinjski {dot} com
+381 (0)62 12 18 900

story:
Short Summary

My name is Helena and I am an amateur astrophotographer and astronomer from Scotland. I've always had a strong interest in space from a very young age but that interest grew even further when back in 2016 I applied for a programme called 'The Dengineers'. My application was successful and they came and built a dark sky observatory in my back garden! Having the den has changed my views on astrophotography and astronomy. It has motivated me to do more with my photographs, promote my work and even create a YouTube channel! Through this Indiegogo campaign, I am aiming to fundraise for a high-quality telescope with ED (Extra Low Dispersion) glass installed to minimise chromatic aberration (when more than one colour wavelength doesn't meet up causing false colour in the final image). By using your donations I can explore galaxies, globular clusters and supernovae from my observatory and inspire other young people with a love of astronomy! It would mean the world to me if you could check out my perks to see what you get back from donating. 

What We Need & What You Get

I'm looking to raise £800 to cover the costs of the SkyWatcher 80-ED-DS PRO Telescope, The HEQ5 PRO GO TO Mount and The Skywatcher Power Tank. You'll notice that in the mount's specifications it mentions GO TO. This means that I can track an object in the sky (let's say M42 The Orion Nebula for example) without having to move the telescope. Having this system will reduce noise, camera shake, and distortion in the final image, meaning I can share sharper images with you all. 

In exchange for your donations, I have included some unique perks for supporters. If you donate £5, I will send you a personalised thank you email. If you donate £10, I will send you one of my astronomy pictures to download via email. If you donate £20, I will send you one of my astronomy photos printed and signed on glossy paper. Finally, if you go all the way to £100, I will give you a tour of My Dark Sky Den this winter! You should receive all of these perks by August 2019. 

If I don't reach my full goal by the end of the 30-day campaign, I plan to keep saving to raise the balance and will let you know as soon as I've bought the kit. 

The Impact

I've been interested in astronomy from a very young age however, it's only recently that I've got into astrophotography. 

I'm here to inspire children and young people (especially women interested in science) to take up this fantastic, educational hobby - or take it further. I recently started a YouTube channel and a Facebook page to share my interest and adventures with my followers. I’d also love to get my local community involved by having people for visits, tutorials on how to use the telescope and stargazing sessions! My goal is to learn, teach and inspire. 

Risks & Challenges

I appreciate that not everyone can afford to donate financially but hope that even if you can't, you'll help me spread the word about my campaign with your friends and family, subscribe to my YouTube channel, follow me on Flickr and give my Facebook page a like. If I don't reach my target I'll keep saving on my own and exploring other possible funding sources. I certainly won't lose my interest in the world of astrophysics and will keep sharing my adventures. Without your support, it will simply take me longer to reach my goal and to buy the equipment.

Thank you, everyone, for checking out my campaign and for all the ongoing support! : ) 

Video thumbnail photo was taken by Kim Ayres - kimayres.co.uk

story:
I am a visual artist looking to complete a long-term project for publication and exhibition. 

An overview

‘Out of the loop’ is a photography-based project which looks at waste (predominantly plastic) in our urban and rural environments. The title makes reference to waste material that has escaped ‘closed or open-loop’ recycling – waste which will neither compost or safely biodegrade into the natural environment.

This outcome of this project is both landscape photography, and temporary installation. It has the potential to re-engage viewers with a common problem in our consumer throw-away society, not just relevent in the UK but any other location on this blue planet of ours. 

About the project

The objective of this final phase of this project is to emphasis the ongoing issues of waste within a local context through 'scale'. 

To do this I plan to supersize a number of waste images – as shown in the gallery section of this pitch – onto vinyl banners and possibly billboards, and photograph them against rural and urban backdrops. These final pictures will serve to represent the so-called 'blots' on the landscape – engaging the public not through disgust, but with their surprising aesthetic nuance and ambiguous sentiment.

To conclude, this project will then be documented into a published limited edition book and available for exhibiting from Autumn 2012.

This project has the endorsement from the National Trust to shoot a temporary installation along the River Lyn in Devon, an area of outstanding beauty and variety.

Mutual benefits all round

All contributors and sponsors (unless otherwise stated), will be listed on the website and in the publication.

‘Out of the loop’ is an ideal project for those individuals and organisations that are striving for an ecological sustainable future; through changes in manufacturing process and practice, changes in policy making or simply promoting a better way of living.

Overall it has the potential to;

  • communicate a global environmental issue
  • provide a local context 
  • to encourage discussion
  • and promote positive local action. 

From a business perspective, this project has the potential to;

  • raise brand awareness
  • enhance a corporate image
  • generate positive PR
  • and engage with a new or wider audience.

Project requirements & what you recieve in return

My aim is to produce a minimum of six banners and shoot them in different locations around the UK and would include urban, coastal and rural settings. The funds received would cover the cost of:

  • vinyl banners/billboard posters
  • post-production costs
  • additional camera hire
  • photography assistant/s
  • publication

If less money than expected is raised I will work with what I've got and use the results to seek further sponsorship with the evidence of the new work. All monies will be used to finance and expand this project, including an exhibition – hopefully in partnership with a leading environmental agency in the UK. I have personally raised and saved £500 towads this project but need a greater cash injection to realise it this summer.

I believe the perks are very attractive, unique and to be treasured. All funders will recieve a personal thank you from myself. 

Please offer your suport and spread the word

The success of this project relies on those people who believe that the environment is worthy of being at the centre of a visual-arts based project and who believe that this is an originally project which deserves greater recognition. This is part photography, part art-installation. Whatever you consider it to be, I believe this is art with a purpose that can be understood by all.

Thank you for taking the time to read my pitch.

Graham Barker

story:
At the high of the Potteries industry, the Stoke on Trent skyline was once dominated by 2000 bottle kilns. Now less than 50 remain.

When I started this photography project in October 2017, I wanted show that the remaining kilns are still very much part of the Potteries landscape. To document them all in their current surroundings and the way in which they interact with Stoke on Trent's modern landscape.

The project is a historic document of Stoke’s iconic bottle kilns in 2018.

Each remaining kiln is a 'listed building'. Some of the kilns have been beautifully restored, redeveloped and given a new lease of life as museums, visitor attractions and business centres. Sadly there's a handful of them that stand derelict and unloved. I fear for their future.

I'm planning on exhibiting Kilns in the city of Stoke on Trent at the end of the year to highlight the plight of some of these historic buildings which played such a huge part in Stoke on Trent's heritage.

I'm looking for funding to cover printing and exhibiting costs.  The indiegogo crowdfunding platform allows me to offer perks in exchange for funding for the exhibition and I'm offering you the opportunity to support the exhibition, own a print from the exhibition or become a sponsor of the exhibition.

The exhibition will be not for profit.  If there are any profits made from the project, they will donated to local Stoke on Trent charities.

If you can't donate, you can still be a big help by spreading the word and telling other people about Kilns. Please share this page with your friends and family.

story:
Vincent Fugère is a Montreal based Photographer. 
He has backgrounds in design, advertising and music. 

He specializes in portraiture that run along the paths of pinup, glamour, eroticism and classical portraits. In the last few years, he has decided to go down a specific road : explore beauty in its most honest form and display female sensuality with class and respect. Post-production is used only to play with the colors; no waists are thinned out, no imperfections are rendered perfect. Sexuality has been portrayed for far too long in a dishonest way, and hopefully Vincent Fugère's portraits can even the score, 

This specific project is for the first run of a bi annual magazine / art book ( as of yet un named ) that will present a collection of portraits from different models. While the goal is to make the pages and photographs appealing and esthetic, the book will maintain its initiative of presenting unadultered photos of beautiful, soulful and interesting women. 

The costs cover the following : 

the production and print of 150 - 200 48 page magazines ( digitally printed ) 

the rental costs for locations

the hiring costs for models, stylists and wardrobe

the production of complementary advertising ( web ads, magazine ads, flyers )

Thank you for your time !

story:
Hey there, thanks for clicking!

I've been playing around and using cameras for about 5 years now from digital through to film, It's a serious love of mine its the only hobby i've been able to truely get into (despite it making me want to rip my own face off sometimes) I love landscape and architecture photography the most. I dont know what i'd do without my digital and film cameras, and so that brings me to the point of this campaign. Please look at my flickr for my pictures! http://www.flickr.com/photos/doutchy/

I'm in need of a wide angle lens, I use a nikon D90 with kit lens and it just doesn't cut it anymore! I have my heart set on a Tokina 11-16mm as from what I can read people praise it over nikons own 12-24mm

I need around $1000 to cover purchase of the lens and some high quality filters (polarizer, UV, maybe a graduated filter)

If you decide to choose a perk (http://www.flickr.com/photos/doutchy/) they will be printed on high quality harman paper and shipped in hard cardboard envelopes to ensure they arrive to you safely!

Its hard to find the words that explain how helpful this would be to me, basically you'd be helping a young fool continue pursuing his hobby and possibly helping me get into a career!

If you cant donate then please spread the word for my little cause! Its not much but you would be helping me out in more ways than you can imagine!

story:
Hi Indiegogo, my name is Callie Clark, I live and work in Rome, GA, and I need your help!

Artistic crowdfunding has completely taken over my life--the first thing I do in the mornings before emails or even making my coffee is check out the home page to see what amazing ideas and products you geniuses have put out there while I was sleeping.

Checking out and backing your mind-blowing work has been pure joy, but thanks to nerves and down right fear, I've been putting off starting my own project. But no more, because I and several other artists have been afforded the fantastic opportunity to take up residency in Brazil from December 13th to the 21st (my birthday!) to write, paint, and in my case--photograph the city of Fortelza. Our generous patron, colleague, and friend will be hosting us and taking on the burden of our quarters and food, but there are other expenses I need your help in covering, which are listed below in as transparent detail as possible so far, with more information to come as it's available.

While coming up with the perks, I tried to keep in mind the kind of incentives I like and what I'm willing to pay for them, so I hope it's a comprehensive list with something for everyone, but if you have ideas or requests, please let me know, we're completely open.

Me, my family, and my friends are SO excited about this project but we can't do it without you and would be thrilled for you to come on board. But if it isn't your cup of tea, shoot me a message anyway so I can check out your cool work--I'm always afraid I'll miss something!

Thank you so much for your time today and your potential support in the future. Talk soon and best wishes. Peace!

-

With your help and support we can all have a terrific time planning, executing, and enjoying the spoils of this photography project!

Your investments will be spent on the following necessities:

* Round trip airfare

* Rental fees for the photography equipment needed that can't be purchased while we're trying to keep overhead as low down as possible.

* Communications cost such as wi-fi cafes and international cell service

* Logistical expenses such as cab fares, tips, bus and train tokens, and the services of a local translator if needed. 

As more specific information becomes available when things start coming together, it will be provided to you immediately.


Thank you for your interest and support!

This project does not yet have social media representation, but I can be found @cleopaintra (my roller derby name) on Twitter, Instagram, and Vine.

story:
Project Summary

Short Summary-

I am excited to tell you about The How We Are Connected Photo Exploration Project, a photography portrait series of performing artists of various cultures and the similarities they share. My goal is to create a festive geographic exhibition with an interactive visual perspective on cultural identity.

My Background-

I am a visual artist with a camera working in the fields of photography and film. I have been in love with photography since the age of 7 years old. I began freelancing part-time in 2003 documenting people, culture, and the performing arts. 

My Inspiration-

As a youth growing up in the Bronx, New York City- the most ethnically diverse place in the country; I became familiar with various cultures at an early age. I would literally listen out of my living room window and hear Dominican music, then hear Haitian music from the kitchen window, Hindu music from another window and Nigerian music from down the hallway in my apartment building. By the time I was old enough to attend the parties, events, and festivals, I noticed similarities, and regardless of the music playing the performing arts and dancers shared traits of movement amongst each other.

 

 

My Research-

Many cultural dances are rooted to civilizations that maintain the pieces of their history and livelihood through these performances. The same is true at the roots of many ethnic groups, as dance is a common language that unites us all on some level. Outside of the typical images of tap performers and ballerinas, there are countless cultural dances that are just waiting to be discovered.

My Experience-

This will be my 2nd publicly featured project. My previous project was called - The Proud Poppas  Photo Project. The initially started as a portrait series to advocate proactive fathers. The project grew into a community family and fathering development initiative. I was presented with a Seal of Acclimation from the Brooklyn Borough President. The project also developed into a Proud Poppas Family Day Outing we raised over $2000 dollars and gifted over $5000 in giveaways and prizes from sponsors and local businesses. We held the official Proud Poppas Photo Exhibition in Brooklyn in Nov 2015.

 

 

  

My Vision-

I will produce portrait and motion still images highlighting the similarities in attire, movement, instruments as well as an insight into the background of the artists and performances- creating a geographic portrait trail of people, costumes, sounds and movement.

My Contribution-

I began the HWAC-PE project in 2014 while living in New York City, since then:

- I have attended 25 cultural festival and functions,

- I have worked with 7 dance schools

- I have photographed over 30 participating artists.

- I also received several invites to attend upcoming festivals.

I plan to travel to 9 cultural festival events this year and early next year around the US and a few countries. The funding will assist in studio rental, travel, and lodging, image scanning, printing, marketing, and installation, as well as personnel such as a research assistant, production assistants, a copy editor and a cartographer.

My aim in this project is to preserve and promote culture, inspire, empower and educate people all over the world, bringing us closer. I will present the images on tall vibrant metal prints. 

 

 

My Risk and Challenges-

Due to the lack of budget and resources, I have had photo sessions on rooftops, busy sidewalks and parks. I have also missed opportunities and photo sessions with willing artists and organizations due to lack of travel funding and studio space. I also have been working with outdated equipment with limited capabilities. 

Your Support-
I am aiming to raise $9,000. With your support, I plan to travel to 9 cultural festival events this year and early next year around the US and a few countries. The funding will assist in studio rental, travel and lodging, image scanning, printing, marketing and installation, as well as personnel such an a research assistant, production assistants, a copy editor and a cartographer. For our Indiegogo supporters, we have a number of perks and will be developing more. 

I have big plans for the future, including in-depth stories and enhanced coverage of festivals and performances. In the months ahead, I will be engaging with you about the development of the project and new artists I meet. Connect with us online by typing @THWACPEP on your favorite social media site. We hope you will join us on this exploration.

Please feel free to contact me at thwacpep@zirephotography.com if you need any additional information. Your interest in supporting this project is greatly appreciated.

Other Way You Can Support-

All support is welcomed support. For those who can not contribute but appreciate the project and its objective, here are some other ways to support. 

Connect with us today! @THWACPEP

  • Like and Share, Share and Share again 

         - Twitter - @THWACPEP 
         - Facebook - Facebook.com/THWACPEP

         - Instagram - @THWACPEP
  • Follow us online. Just type: THWACPEP on your favorite social media outlet.
Press Release
http://bit.ly/THWACPEPPR
 
The How We Are Connected Photo Exploration Project is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-­profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of The How We Are Connected Photo Exploration Project must be made payable to “Fractured Atlas” only. Any contribution above the value of the goods and services received by the donor is tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.
story_txt:
Project Summary

Short Summary-
I am excited to tell you about The How We Are Connected Photo Exploration Project, a photography portrait series of performing artists of various cultures and the similarities they share. My goal is to create a festive geographic exhibition with an interactive visual perspective on cultural identity.
My Background-

I am a visual artist with a camera working in the fields of photography and film. I have been in love with photography since the age of 7 years old. I began freelancing part-time in 2003 documenting people, culture, and the performing arts. 

My Inspiration-
As a youth growing up in the Bronx, New York City- the most ethnically diverse place in the country; I became familiar with various cultures at an early age. I would literally listen out of my living room window and hear Dominican music, then hear Haitian music from the kitchen window, Hindu music from another window and Nigerian music from down the hallway in my apartment building. By the time I was old enough to attend the parties, events, and festivals, I noticed similarities, and regardless of the music playing the performing arts and dancers shared traits of movement amongst each other.
 
 



My Research-
Many cultural dances are rooted to civilizations that maintain the pieces of their history and livelihood through these performances. The same is true at the roots of many ethnic groups, as dance is a common language that unites us all on some level. Outside of the typical images of tap performers and ballerinas, there are countless cultural dances that are just waiting to be discovered.

My Experience-
This will be my 2nd publicly featured project. My previous project was called - The Proud Poppas  Photo Project. The initially started as a portrait series to advocate proactive fathers. The project grew into a community family and fathering development initiative. I was presented with a Seal of Acclimation from the Brooklyn Borough President. The project also developed into a Proud Poppas Family Day Outing we raised over $2000 dollars and gifted over $5000 in giveaways and prizes from sponsors and local businesses. We held the official Proud Poppas Photo Exhibition in Brooklyn in Nov 2015.
 
 
  
My Vision-
I will produce portrait and motion still images highlighting the similarities in attire, movement, instruments as well as an insight into the background of the artists and performances- creating a geographic portrait trail of people, costumes, sounds and movement.

My Contribution-
I began the HWAC-PE project in 2014 while living in New York City, since then:
- I have attended 25 cultural festival and functions,
- I have worked with 7 dance schools
- I have photographed over 30 participating artists.
- I also received several invites to attend upcoming festivals.
I plan to travel to 9 cultural festival events this year and early next year around the US and a few countries. The funding will assist in studio rental, travel, and lodging, image scanning, printing, marketing, and installation, as well as personnel such as a research assistant, production assistants, a copy editor and a cartographer.
My aim in this project is to preserve and promote culture, inspire, empower and educate people all over the world, bringing us closer. I will present the images on tall vibrant metal prints. 
 
 
My Risk and Challenges-Due to the lack of budget and resources, I have had photo sessions on rooftops, busy sidewalks and parks. I have also missed opportunities and photo sessions with willing artists and organizations due to lack of travel funding and studio space. I also have been working with outdated equipment with limited capabilities. 

Your Support-
I am aiming to raise $9,000. With your support, I plan to travel to 9 cultural festival events this year and early next year around the US and a few countries. The funding will assist in studio rental, travel and lodging, image scanning, printing, marketing and installation, as well as personnel such an a research assistant, production assistants, a copy editor and a cartographer. For our Indiegogo supporters, we have a number of perks and will be developing more. 

I have big plans for the future, including in-depth stories and enhanced coverage of festivals and performances. In the months ahead, I will be engaging with you about the development of the project and new artists I meet. Connect with us online by typing @THWACPEP on your favorite social media site. We hope you will join us on this exploration.
Please feel free to contact me at thwacpep@zirephotography.com if you need any additional information. Your interest in supporting this project is greatly appreciated.
Other Way You Can Support-


All support is welcomed support. For those who can not contribute but appreciate the project and its objective, here are some other ways to support. 
Connect with us today! @THWACPEP
Like and Share, Share and Share again          - Twitter - @THWACPEP          - Facebook - Facebook.com/THWACPEP         - Instagram - @THWACPEP

story:
Why This Book and Campaign?

We need more books!

Thanks to many of you, we are sold out of our "Wild in Arizona: Photographing Arizona's Wildflowers" books. We continue to have requests for copies (that we don't have) and many of you sent in great suggestions for new locations and new flowers.

So, after considerable thought, Paul Gill and I (Colleen Miniuk-Sperry) are working hard to come out with the Enhanced 2nd Edition of our award-winning guidebook,   "Wild in Arizona: Photographing Arizona's Wildflowers, A Guide to When, Where, & How" (scheduled to be published in March 2015).

But we need your help! Publishing will be expensive!

To publish the Enhanced 2nd Edition will cost about $14,000, considering costs associated with printing, shipping, etc. (Most authors do not make money on books, and this is why they call us "Starving Artists!" LOL!)

Paul and I are requesting your help to raise $5,000 to help us cover less than half of these costs to publish the book.  We are so passionate about helping others grow in their own photography and helping others get outside to enjoy all that Arizona has to offer. 

As a thank you to YOU, our valued supporters, we are offering discounts on books, eBooks, and workshops with Paul and I to help raise money to produce this exciting new edition.


What's This Book About?

More Flowers! More Locations!

We thank you for your feedback!  We've listened, and the enhanced 2nd edition features: 

  • 13 new spectacular locations
  • 12 new featured flowers
  • 10 new "Making the Photo" stories
  • Over 80 new photographs
  • An updated Bloom Calendar

and much more!

Here's a sample of a two-page spread for new location #6: Robinson Crater from the new edition:

And here's a sample two-page spread of one of the 10 "Making the Photo" stories:

We've made an award-winning guidebook even better!   To view more information about the original book, visit our website at www.wildinarizona.com.


What's in It For You?

Pick your perk (click the package listing on the right side of this website to order):
  • Get discounts on the new book and eBook!
  • See your name in the book forever! 
  • Enjoy a private half-day workshop with Colleen
  • Join a one-day workshop with Paul and Colleen!
  • Polish your photography on a 3-day workshop extravaganza with Paul and Colleen!

We will not offer these discounts once this fundraising campaign concludes, so if you have interest in our guidebook, eBook, prints, and workshops, now's the time to buy!


Where Your Money Will Go:

All monies raised in this campaign will go towards the following:

  • The actual printing costs for 5,000 copies of the expanded 2nd edition of the book
  • The cost of fulfilling perks (e.g. shipping, workshop logistics)
  • Indiegogo & credit card processing fees (~8%)


Ways You Can Help

  • Buy an autographed copy of the book and/or eBook today!
  • Grab some great discounted perks like your name in the book forever and your own private workshops!
  • Share this campaign with your friends and family - please spread the word with photographers and wildflower enthusiasts!


We greatly appreciate your support!

story:
Our Story

Earlier this year I spent the most amazing ten days in Israel on a Taglit-Birthright trip.

My ten days in Israel completely changed my life, in the best way possible. I feel so much more connected to the Jewish religion, Jewish people and to G-d, than I did before I left.

Even though my trip had a lot of hiccups, like being stuck in the Newark airport overnight because our flight got cancelled, to finally getting to Israel and it rained almost every day. I can honestly say it was the best trip of my life despite everything bad that happened.

I absolutely loved being in Israel, so much so that I am getting ready to go back this coming September. I will be staying there for five months studying photography. I really hope this experience will help me jump-start my photography career, as well as becoming more connected to my people and to G-d. I also hope it will give me the ability to show how Israel really is and defend it against people who think and speak badly about Israel.

I have received a generous grant from a foundation called MASA. MASA, which means “journey” in Hebrew, is a funding agency that works mainly with getting young Jewish people to Israel.

Even with the grant they gave me I am still trying to find more funding for my trip. The reason I am reaching out to you is because I know you know where students like me are able to find grant money. I was hoping you would be able to guide me in the right direction to reach this goal of mine.


The Impact

I hope to couple the skills I will gain in photography with my love of Israel and love for animals in a way that will let me communicate the beauty of the land to a larger audience through photography and photojournalism.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise as much money as we can to offset the investment my parents are making as much as possible!


$25 investment - choose one digital image from the portfolio that I bring back from Israel, as a thank you gift.

$100 - choose one digital image and receive an 8x10 print of that image autographed and numbered.

$250 - choose three digital images and receive three 8x10 prints, one of each image, autographed and numbered.

$500 - choose ten digital images and receive a personalized photo book, autographed.

$1000 - receive all the premiums at the $500 level, plus you can arrange a photo/lecture slide show evening with Shelly describing her experience and showing her images.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please tell everyone you know who's interested in Israel and photojournalism about my campaign. I appreciate any help you can give me in this learning experience.

story:
Copa na Copa is now available on Amazon! Click here to buy!



Copacabana. This beach is blessed by the image of a saint, the Virgin of Copacabana, who came from Bolivia in the seventeenth century. The saint gave not only her name but her blessing on a place which eventually became synonymous with joy, cultural diversity and natural beauty. Today, she is known as "The Princess of the Sea," and the beach lies at the center of the city and the 2014 World Cup. Every day, tourists and locals alike come together to enjoy themselves, lie in the sun, relax and have a good time. In short, Copacabana is the copa — the cup — of the city of Rio.


But the notion of the beach has another side. Pleasure, unfortunately, often goes together with excess—too much sun, too much food, too much fun. Excessive consumption combined with a sedentary lifestyle has brought on health problems in Brazil, particularly obesity.  On average, Brazilians eat 177 pounds of meat per year and approximately 48% of the population is overweight. Despite our country's reputed love for movement (in dance and in futebol), we are slowing down.
So, "Copa na Copa," takes a look at the Copacabana in a different light. Rather than seeing it as a tourist mecca, these pictures present one of the most traditional neighborhoods of the city (its population is 30% elderly). My pictures show the beach in an ironic and amusing way, portraying its beauty in a way not usually shown on TV. But I also want to reflect on the way Brazilians are living their lives today. How long can the party go on?  


—Vitor Sá, with interpretation by Alexander Strecker


"Copa na Copa" started as a joke, a form of protest to show a different Copacabana, a side of consumption and quite typical excesses to Brazilians. But also show that the traditional neighbourhood hosts the largest number of elderly in Brazil and is considered the "oldest" neighbourhood in the country. With Copa na Copa, I wanted to show that the Brazil's most famous beach has another kind of beauty, not the one shown normally. 

The project "Copa na Copa" grew during the World Cup 2014 and has been gaining prominence in Instagram, reaching the cover of renowned LensCulture site. 

With the material done during the games, and an invitation to join the NY Art Book Fair 2014 to be held at MoMA PS1 during days 26-28 of September, I am asking for help to fund the initial print of 10 books, 50 pages, 43 pictures 7x7 inches, to be printed on the Blurb platform.  

The book will be printed on the best paper, the ProLine Pearl Photo, to enhance the colors and the joy of the photos. I choose to use a Softcover, first because I want to reduce the production costs, and second because this will give the book a look of Rio magazine of the 70s, an aesthetic that pleases me greatly.

My initial idea is to print only 10 books to be sold on the NY Art Book Fair 2014, but this number can increase if I fund more than $500. Every extra $50 will be used to print an extra book.


Copa na Copa on the web:

Vitor Sá: Copa na Copa

LensCulture: Another Side of Brazil's Most Famous Beach

TuxBoard: L’envers du décor de Copacabana

L'avenir: Un regard différent sur Copacabana

houhouhaha: Copacabana vue par Vitor Sá!


Some of the photographs included on Copa na Copa:

story:
Short Summary

  • I'm a photographer from Zagreb, Croatia, passionate about black&white photography.

 

  • More about my work at http://kresimirkopcic.zenfolio.com and kresimirkopcic.com 
  • This is my first book of photographs

What We Need

 

  • The target funds is 4.000 $ to cover all the costs of book production
  • The book will contain 128 photographs and texts in Croatian and English

  • Hard cover 22 x 21,5 cm

  • Offset print / 170 g/m² paper

  • 400 copies

  • The publisher is Kadar36, which already has experience in publishing some top Croatian photographers http://www.kadar36.hr/knjige
