story:
Note of Gratitude

Tuesday, December 2, 2014.

4:04 pm Pacific Standard Time.

Right here on Indiegogo.

On December 2, #GivingTuesday, we received an extraordinary swell of support and went from 19% to 103% funded in less than 24 hours. Dan and I were stunned, thrilled, humbled. But most of all, grateful—grateful because the promise we made to the people Dan photographed ten years ago can now be fulfilled.

Because of all of you.

THANK YOU.

Here is the project web page, enjoy!

Stretch Goals

We have set the following next-phase goals for this project to realize our long-term mission:

POSTCARDS: $750 to print a set of 5,000 5x7 postcards with inspirational captions. We'll print several different images from the book, for a total of 5,000 postcards to be distributed at presentations and workshops for all ages on survival and resilience. Postcards double as exercise tools as participants can write notes on the back.

SCREENSAVER: $250 to put together a digital package of images with inspirational quotes (and another version with captions from the book) you can upload to your desktop and use as a screensaver.

PRESENTATIONS IN SCHOOLS: $2500 to put together a first series of workshops and presentations on the subjects of strength, survival and resilience in the face of trauma and/or disaster, whether man- or nature-made, and conduct these events at local Bay Area high schools and colleges. We are working with the California Health Medical Reserve Corps on this.


The Tsunami

Sunday, December 26, 2004.

00:58:53 am Coordinated Universal Time.

160 km off the west coast of Northern Sumatra, Indonesia.

The world sleeps blissfully after the holidays. A 9.1 earthquake suddenly explodes deep beneath the Indian Ocean, setting off a series of tsunamis that swallow the shores of 11 countries and rip $9.9 billion in damages. Over quarter of a million people lose their lives; hundreds of thousands are left injured, homeless, or destitute.

That was the Indian Ocean Tsunami. 

Dan and I wanted to do something to make sure the world never forgets.

The Book

My name is Birgitte Rasine. I'm an author and producer based in Northern California. In January 2005, I approached ICLEI, a non profit working with local governments all over the world on sustainability, with the idea of a photography book to celebrate resilience, rejuvenation, and rebuilding in the aftermath of the tsunami, not death and destruction that so much of the mainstream media was focusing on. 

ICLEI loved the idea and gave us a travel grant; in March 2005 I sent photographer Dan Root to India and Thailand, the two countries where ICLEI had support personnel. He came back with hundreds of stunning photographs—images as evocative and meaningful today as they were the moment he took them. 

After Dan's trip, we ran into a few roadblocks that forced us to table the book idea.  So we built a website with what was left from the initial funds—the site is still up to this day.

But Dan and I never gave up hope that one day, this book we intended to produce, this promise we made to the people Dan encountered in the tsunami-affected areas, would become a reality.  

You can now hold that reality in your hands.  

With the sea changes taking place in the publishing sector, we no longer need a major publisher to give us the green light for this book. We have our own imprint, LUCITÀ Publishing, which has already released a number of titles.  

TSUNAMI: IMAGES OF RESILIENCE is a gorgeous full-color hardcover book of Dan's most striking and memorable images from India and Thailand. You can see some of the images from the book in the "Gallery" tab above.

We're also producing a digital version of the book—an eBook for your iPad, Kindle, Nook, or Kobo eReader.  

The print book is 112 pages, 10x8 landscape format.  The interior of the book will be printed in luscious four colors on 80lb matte paper.
The book layout is simple yet elegant:

  • Five sections of photographs: After the Wave, Water, Rebuild, Home, and Family. Poetic captions and quotes from Dan's original field notes accompany the images.
  • Personal statements by Dan and Birgitte 
  • Caption index that provides details about each image and where it was taken
  • A list of the international aid organizations active on the ground in the months following the tsunami


The Prints

What is a book without its best images printed in fine archival format, adorning the walls of your home? We have selected ten of the most powerful images from the book and are making them available as fine prints. The Gallery tab above showcases these ten prints (plus a few more images from the book).

The selected photographs will be printed with archival inks on Hahnemühle Fine Art Pearl 285gsm 40 mil paper and will be signed by the photographer, Dan Root. Available in two sizes, 8'' x 12'' and 16'' x 24''.

Here's one of our favorites, its light and texture reminiscent of Rembrandt: "Making Poori."


The Team

Dan Root is a Portland, Oregon-based photographer and former photojournalist who has shot for Nike, adidas, Manchester United, the Oregon Food Bank and many other companies and organizations. When he's color balanced too many images at a stretch he goes off fishing. See www.drootphoto.com.

Birgitte Rasine is a literary author, publisher, producer, and entrepreneur based in Silicon Valley. A former journalist for the Hollywood film industry, she is a member of various publishing organizations. Her idea of a great vacation is rubbing piranhas' bellies and swimming in ancient Mayan canals in Latin America. See www.birgitterasine.com.

Luba Ortoleva is a classically trained artist and designer originally from the Czech Republic based near New York. She's a true Renaissance woman—print, web, animation, and actual art drawn by hand, she can do it all. When threatened by a lazy Sunday, she can whip up a mean homemade crêpe.

Andrea Jiménez Guerrero is a designer based in Bogotá, Colombia. In addition to her work on this book, she’s also the head of design at a startup providing graphic, web and digital design services.  When she’s not at her desk, she loves to dance and chase new musical rhythms.

Our publishing assistant Amanda Broughton is a budding photographer in her own right; on this project she's supporting us with research and marketing & sales outreach. On top of it all she's incredible with kids.

Special thanks to Balanza (www.balanza.de), an amazing band from Germany that composed the music used in the video you've just seen, and to Chris Hornbecker, the man behind the camera. (Haven't watched it yet? Go back up to the top of the page!)


Use of Funds

Dan and I have put in countless hours of our time and resources combing through all of the images from his trip ten years ago, all over again; optimizing and color balancing them; working with the designers to lay out the book; writing the text and supplemental materials. And shooting the video you see at the top of this page.

In short, for us this is a labor of love.  What we do need your help and support on is funding the physical printed copies and the eBook version of TSUNAMI: IMAGES OF RESILIENCE.  We seek to raise an initial $9,006 in funding, which will enable us to print and store 1,000 copies and produce the eBook.

Here's how it breaks down: 

  • Four-color printing (1K copies): $7,006
  • Fulfillment, storage, and order processing fees: $500 
  • Image optimization for CMYK and RGB colorspace, digital production, conversion, & beta testing: $1,500

The funds are going not to us individually but to LUCITÀ Publishing, the publisher of TSUNAMI: IMAGES OF RESILIENCE and the publishing arm of LUCITÀ Inc., a company that has been in business since 1999.

#GivingTuesday update:

We have reached our initial funding goal of $9,006. Upon discussion with some of our collaborators, we have decided that instead of simply printing more books, we are going to devote our stretch goals to producing other types of products with these images that we can employ in workshops, conferences and other events that engage participants in discussion on survival, strength, and resilience (see Stretch Goals above).

However, our original plan for the one thousand copies of the book still remains:

The net profits from book sales will be utilized to donate and distribute the books to schools, libraries, cultural institutions, trauma prevention centers, disaster preparedness programs and other similar entities and initiatives, including in India and Thailand where the images were taken. 


It's Never About Just a Book

We may understand the words and numbers that describe the destruction caused by the tsunami, but we may not easily resonate with those words and numbers.

But when we look at a single image, an image of a human being—a man, a woman, a child—who survived the Tsunami, we can instantly relate. We can feel that person’s pain, that person’s loss as strongly as we feel his or her courage, strength, resilience, and hope for a new future.

This is why this book is a book of images and not words or numbers.

And because we believe in the power of the image to reach far beyond its source, its place of origin, we're working with selected partner organizations and groups to harness these images to raise funds for disaster preparedness programs in the regions impacted by the Tsunami on the one hand, and on the other, to inspire and support survivors of other disasters and traumatic events not related to the Tsunami. This collaboration may result in photography exhibits, seminars, presentations, fundraisers, and other types of events and initiatives.

Please see our campaign updates for more information on the development of these efforts.


Risks & Challenges

We've waited ten years to produce this book; we're not going to let anything stop us. But we need your help to print those first one thousand copies and produce the eBook. 

We are no spring chickens when it comes to publishing—Birgitte is one mean book producer and Dan leaves entire busloads of photographers in the dust when it comes to image optimization and color balance (not to mention how awesome his images are in the first place). We're blessed with two incredible designers, and a community of friends, colleagues, and more friends who believe in this project and the power of these images as passionately as we do. If not more so.

We have already received the first hardproof of the book and it's gorgeous.  In other words, the design and layout are done and the files are at the printer's, ready to be transformed into living breathing books.

So, there's little to zero chance of us not being able to deliver—barring a stampede of ravenous chihuahuas busting down our printer's doors in the middle of the night (but they have insurance against that. We think.).

Ditto for the fine archival print facility we have selected—they're a shop in Portland, Oregon that Dan has worked with in the past, so there's an established relationship there.

As far as the eBook is concerned, we manage the entire process from start to finish, beta test on multiple devices, and upload our own files so we have total control over the final product. Those of you who've read our other titles in eBook format know the quality of our work.

Now that we have secured funding for the one thousand copies we set out to print, we are turning our attention to our stretch goals. So we STILL need your support, but this time it's to help us and our collaborators take this project to the next level. The more support we have, the more products and uses we can produce with these images, and the more hands can touch these pages that have waited ten years to be produced. And the more likely that with proceeds from book sales we will be able to support the wonderful initiatives and programs designed to help local populations in the tsunami regions learn about tidal surges and tsunamis and plan routes of escape as well as early warning systems.


Dan on assignment in India.


How Else Can I Help?

Whether or not you can contribute financially, there is so much more that you can do to support TSUNAMI: IMAGES OF RESILIENCE:

  • Spread the word, email your friends, make some noise!  Let's make this campaign go viral—if we get enough likes/tweets/pins we may be featured in the Indiegogo newsletter!  At the top of the page, below the video, are links and buttons you can use. 

  • You can also mention this project to your loved ones, friends, and colleagues via email or in your newsletter if you publish one.  The short URL for this campaign is http://igg.me/at/tsunami-resilience. 

  • If you have a favorite bookstore, library, school, or museum that you feel might benefit from having a copy (or several) of this book, email us your recommendations.  Send your note to books <at> lucita <dot> net.

Thank you, from all of us, for taking the time to read about this project.  If you have any questions please email us at the same email as above or drop us a note in the comments.

~ Birgitte, Dan, and the rest of the team
story_txt:
Note of Gratitude


Tuesday, December 2, 2014.
4:04 pm Pacific Standard Time.
Right here on Indiegogo.
On December 2, #GivingTuesday, we received an extraordinary swell of support and went from 19% to 103% funded in less than 24 hours. Dan and I were stunned, thrilled, humbled. But most of all, grateful—grateful because the promise we made to the people Dan photographed ten years ago can now be fulfilled.
Because of all of you.
THANK YOU.
Here is the project web page, enjoy!Stretch Goals


We have set the following next-phase goals for this project to realize our long-term mission:

POSTCARDS: $750 to print a set of 5,000 5x7 postcards with inspirational captions. We'll print several different images from the book, for a total of 5,000 postcards to be distributed at presentations and workshops for all ages on survival and resilience. Postcards double as exercise tools as participants can write notes on the back.


SCREENSAVER: $250 to put together a digital package of images with inspirational quotes (and another version with captions from the book) you can upload to your desktop and use as a screensaver.



PRESENTATIONS IN SCHOOLS: $2500 to put together a first series of workshops and presentations on the subjects of strength, survival and resilience in the face of trauma and/or disaster, whether man- or nature-made, and conduct these events at local Bay Area high schools and colleges. We are working with the California Health Medical Reserve Corps on this.





The Tsunami


Sunday, December 26, 2004.
00:58:53 am Coordinated Universal Time.
160 km off the west coast of Northern Sumatra, Indonesia.
The world sleeps blissfully after the holidays. A 9.1 earthquake suddenly explodes deep beneath the Indian Ocean, setting off a series of tsunamis that swallow the shores of 11 countries and rip $9.9 billion in damages. Over quarter of a million people lose their lives; hundreds of thousands are left injured, homeless, or destitute.
That was the Indian Ocean Tsunami. 
Dan and I wanted to do something to make sure the world never forgets.
The Book
My name is Birgitte Rasine. I'm an author and producer based in Northern California. In January 2005, I approached ICLEI, a non profit working with local governments all over the world on sustainability, with the idea of a photography book to celebrate resilience, rejuvenation, and rebuilding in the aftermath of the tsunami, not death and destruction that so much of the mainstream media was focusing on. 
ICLEI loved the idea and gave us a travel grant; in March 2005 I sent photographer Dan Root to India and Thailand, the two countries where ICLEI had support personnel. He came back with hundreds of stunning photographs—images as evocative and meaningful today as they were the moment he took them. 
After Dan's trip, we ran into a few roadblocks that forced us to table the book idea.  So we built a website with what was left from the initial funds—the site is still up to this day.
But Dan and I never gave up hope that one day, this book we intended to produce, this promise we made to the people Dan encountered in the tsunami-affected areas, would become a reality.  
You can now hold that reality in your hands.  




With the sea changes taking place in the publishing sector, we no longer need a major publisher to give us the green light for this book. We have our own imprint, LUCITÀ Publishing, which has already released a number of titles.  
TSUNAMI: IMAGES OF RESILIENCE is a gorgeous full-color hardcover book of Dan's most striking and memorable images from India and Thailand. You can see some of the images from the book in the "Gallery" tab above.
We're also producing a digital version of the book—an eBook for your iPad, Kindle, Nook, or Kobo eReader.  

The print book is 112 pages, 10x8 landscape format.  The interior of the book will be printed in luscious four colors on 80lb matte paper.

The book layout is simple yet elegant:


Five sections of photographs: After the Wave, Water, Rebuild, Home, and Family. Poetic captions and quotes from Dan's original field notes accompany the images.

Personal statements by Dan and Birgitte 
Caption index that provides details about each image and where it was taken
A list of the international aid organizations active on the ground in the months following the tsunami








The Prints
What is a book without its best images printed in fine archival format, adorning the walls of your home? We have selected ten of the most powerful images from the book and are making them available as fine prints. The Gallery tab above showcases these ten prints (plus a few more images from the book).

The selected photographs will be printed with archival inks on Hahnemühle Fine Art Pearl 285gsm 40 mil paper and will be signed by the photographer, Dan Root. Available in two sizes, 8'' x 12'' and 16'' x 24''.

Here's one of our favorites, its light and texture reminiscent of Rembrandt: "Making Poori."






The Team

Dan Root is a Portland, Oregon-based photographer and former photojournalist who has shot for Nike, adidas, Manchester United, the Oregon Food Bank and many other companies and organizations. When he's color balanced too many images at a stretch he goes off fishing. See www.drootphoto.com.
Birgitte Rasine is a literary author, publisher, producer, and entrepreneur based in Silicon Valley. A former journalist for the Hollywood film industry, she is a member of various publishing organizations. Her idea of a great vacation is rubbing piranhas' bellies and swimming in ancient Mayan canals in Latin America. See www.birgitterasine.com.
Luba Ortoleva is a classically trained artist and designer originally from the Czech Republic based near New York. She's a true Renaissance woman—print, web, animation, and actual art drawn by hand, she can do it all. When threatened by a lazy Sunday, she can whip up a mean homemade crêpe.

Andrea Jiménez Guerrero is a designer based in Bogotá, Colombia. In addition to her work on this book, she’s also the head of design at a startup providing graphic, web and digital design services.  When she’s not at her desk, she loves to dance and chase new musical rhythms.
Our publishing assistant Amanda Broughton is a budding photographer in her own right; on this project she's supporting us with research and marketing & sales outreach. On top of it all she's incredible with kids.


Special thanks to Balanza (www.balanza.de), an amazing band from Germany that composed the music used in the video you've just seen, and to Chris Hornbecker, the man behind the camera. (Haven't watched it yet? Go back up to the top of the page!)

And shooting the video you see at the top of this page.


In short, for us this is a labor of love.  What we do need your help and support on is funding the physical printed copies and the eBook version of TSUNAMI: IMAGES OF RESILIENCE.  We seek to raise an initial $9,006 in funding, which will enable us to print and store 1,000 copies and produce the eBook.
Here's how it breaks down: 


Four-color printing (1K copies): $7,006

Fulfillment, storage, and order processing fees: $500

The funds are going not to us individually but to LUCITÀ Publishing, the publisher of TSUNAMI: IMAGES OF RESILIENCE and the publishing arm of LUCITÀ Inc., a company that has been in business since 1999.
#GivingTuesday update:
We have reached our initial funding goal of $9,006. campaign_city: San Francisco Bay Area, United States

story:
Story

In 2017, I was received a strange message from a guy named Joel in Liberia. What happened next has inspired millions around the world. I started making YouTube videos to document the events. Soon I received hundreds of requests to travel to Liberia and meet Joel.
 

The Book

This book tells the true story behind the YouTube series as well as my journey to Liberia. This is a true, inspirational story you'll love to share again and again. 

  • 56 pages
  • Never-before-seen photos
  • Professionally bound
  • Paperback



The Impact

Joel's story has taught us what can happen when people are given a chance. With the money raised from this book, we'll be able to provide opportunities for many more. 
 

"Get this Perk"

In order to get the book, you must select "get this perk." Otherwise we won't be able to collect shipping information.

story:
“The Female Buddha is beautiful and inspiring.”

                                                               Sharon Salzberg

 My name is Deborah and I am a photographer, psychologist and university professor. I am passionate about Guanyin and her message of wisdom and compassion. The book, The Female Buddha: Discovering the Heart of Liberation and Love, grew out of this passion and I am excited to bring her to the world.  Full of photos from Asia and the wise words of women from around the world it offers an inspiring opportunity: to reflect on beauty and bring love into the world. 

The Female Buddha introduces an ancient tradition of the divine feminine. Turning its pages provides a contemplative opportunity for both men and women.  Your help  offers you the opportunity to support this project and enjoy its treasures.  Your contribution will help spread Guanyins message far and wide. 

"In her gorgeous book, Deborah reminds us of the importance of compassion..."

                     Bernie Glassman

 What We Need and What You Receive

As you read this 1200 hardback copies of the book are being printed and shipped from overseas. My husband and I developed Samadhi Publications to bring The Female Buddha into form and we are securing a distribution company to get orders fulfilled.

This project has been mostly self-funded and now we need your help and support. So far our bigger expenses include: printing $10,380, marketing $960,layout $900, social media consulting $850, thank you books $780, publishing consulting $500, Social campaigns $285, Trademark $275, ISBN $250, editing $250 and distribution fees of 20+%. Miscellaneous costs are nearing $1000 and we can speculate postage costs near $800 before the end of the year.

Now we need your help to get The Female Buddha on the shelves of bookstores across the country. Your funding will help us purchase $3000 in marketing to bookstores and $2000 for extra expenses that include our social campaign and a virtual assistant to help with the endless details. 

Everyone in the biz tells us we will be lucky to break even on the first printing and we are asking you to help us accomplish this goal.  If we succeed, we will be able to continue offering The Female Buddha’s message to a broader audience with further printings.  Your contribution will help launch Samadhi Publications and its first offering of liberation and love.

 

“These joyous images will make you smile, with pride and with pleasure."

                                                                         Jan Willis

Your contributions are generously gifted with cards, books, photographs and more.  Your donation not only supports a good cause, you will be among the very first to receive a copy of the book, and it will be signed. 

Note Cards

You receive 6 black and white note cards (4.5X6.25) with photographs of some of the most loved images in the book.  Printed on fine matte paper the cards are blank inside and come with information on the back about the photo, and include envelopes. See www.thefemalebuddha.com to view the cards.

Books

Hardback, signed and sized at 9.5X9 The Female Buddha has 128 pages filled with 80 stunning photos and 54 inspired quotes.  Priced at $29.95, you receive incredible value for your contribution. The contents include:

  • Foreword – Sandy Boucher offers insight into the yearning of both women and men for a female source of spiritual insight and strength.
  • Introduction – Deborah shares her travel adventures, transformative stories, history of Guanyin and glimpses into the many contributions of Buddhist women.
  • Contemplations – Moving photographs and quotations offer a depth and breadth of spiritual wisdom.
  • Commentary on the Photos – Vivid details about the place, history and symbolic content of each photograph enrich the reader’s experience.
  • Commentary on the Quotes – A brief biography of each of the women quoted in the book celebrates their bountiful offerings and diversity.

We so hoped to get all the books to you by Christmas yet there have been several delays in the printing process.  Because of this we are having 50 shipped federal express instead of by boat.  This costs extra for each book and we are picking up part of the tab and need you to help us with this extra cost.  If you live in Boulder this is not necessary if you want to pick up the books from us directly.  Please let us know when you place your order.

Photos

All the photographs are from images in the book.  Each photo is 8X10 or 8X12 and is printed on high quality paper. You choose from 18 possibilities in the gallery on this site or at www.thefemalebuddha.com.  

Female Buddha Workshop

Deborah will share stories and slides of Guanyin and we will connect the dots to her inspiration and our lives through reflection and personal sharing. Contemplations on the images and quotes in the book will bring us closer to the wisdom and compassion of Guanyin. *See below for the full description.

In Boulder, CO, the workshop is on Feb. 9 - 10, 2013.  Limited to 28 participants.

Times are Sat. 9:30-12:30, 2-5 and Sun 9:30-1.

The inclusion of the book + cards as part of the workshop are only available through this Indigogo campaign. Another reason to sign up now!

Consulting

As an accomplished writer, photographer and teacher Deborah has years of experience to inspire and guide you in the creative process.  Her work extends to successful program development in educational and busniness settings.  She can help you move through blocks as well as discover your potential.

Additional Overseas Shipping Costs

For the book(s) and photo please add $5 for each for shipping to Canada, $10 for each for shipping to other parts of the world.  

“Deborah captures the essence of the divine feminine...”

                                                            Linda Leonard

If We Exceed Our Goal...

We will be able to continue all our marketing efforts for a longer length of time to insure success in making The Female Buddha available to a broader audience.  We will also be able to pay for an in-house assistant for continued help so Deborah may once again have time to take a photograph!   We’d love to print a second edition and any funds you provide get us closer to this long range goal.

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us get the word out by reposting this on your Facebook, Twitter, Google+ or other social media.

This work is a tribute to the many men and women who bring the divine feminine, her message and her many manifestations into form. Help us bring photographs of her image to those who long for her.  Help us bring the penetrating insight she embodies through women teachers who have mastered the understanding she represents. 

In gratitude, I will continue to work diligently and keep you posted on the project's progress. Please contact me directly if you would like to support The Female Buddha in any other ways including sponsoring a workshop or lecture.

By helping us to reach our goal we believe that we will all truly benefit from the compassion The Female Buddha has to offer the world.

 

*Discovering the Female Buddha Workshop description:

Stories and Slides

Focusing on the qualities of selflessness central to Guanyin, we explore her incarnation as the folk lengend Miao-shan, and compare her to the Handless Maiden in western tales.  Pertinent to our lives today, these stories ask a soul-searching question: what is sacrifice and what is unconditional love? 

Miao-shan is adolescent girl. As an adult figure, Guanyin has mastered the teachings of the Buddha. She wears an Eternal Buddha at her forehead and gestures with her left hand in a teaching mudra.  Like Sophia, she a feminine representation of great wisdom.

In sculptures and paintings we see Guanyin confidently standing in the back of a lion, carp, turtle or horse. Sometimes she is standing on the back of a dragon skimming the ocean waves.  Her all-knowing faith profoundly connects her to the natural environment.  How does she speak to our modern world?

Contemplations

The contemplations deepen our experience and understanding.  To set the tone a brief introduction and short periods of sitting and walking meditation will be offered. 

During the contemplations, one might simply reflect on a quote or image. A phrase is repeated to see what arises in the mind. An icon is simply appreciated or one may notice what other images, feelings or insights are evoked. 

Participants will be invited to write, draw or share in small groups what surfaces in their experience. In the large group, we look more deeply at themes of the individual and collective needs of our time.  We will resource what we have to offer and call to receive what we need.

Deborah Bowman, Ph.D. is a psychologist, photographer & professor of Transpersonal Counseling Psychology at Naropa University. She is a trainer with Boulder Psychotherapy Institute & has been a psychotherapist for 25 years. She is author of When Your Spouse Comes Out, The Luminous Buddha & The Female Buddha.

Books
Hardback, signed and sized at 9.5X9 The Female Buddha has 128 pages filled with 80 stunning photos and 54 inspired quotes.  Priced at $29.95, you receive incredible value for your contribution. The contents include:


Foreword – Sandy Boucher offers insight into the yearning of both women and men for a female source of spiritual insight and strength.

Introduction – Deborah shares her travel adventures, transformative stories, history of Guanyin and glimpses into the many contributions of Buddhist women.

Contemplations – Moving photographs and quotations offer a depth and breadth of spiritual wisdom.

Commentary on the Photos – Vivid details about the place, history and symbolic content of each photograph enrich the reader’s experience.

Commentary on the Quotes – A brief biography of each of the women quoted in the book celebrates their bountiful offerings and diversity.

We so hoped to get all the books to you by Christmas yet there have been several delays in the printing process.  Because of this we are having 50 shipped federal express instead of by boat.  This costs extra for each book and we are picking up part of the tab and need you to help us with this extra cost.  If you live in Boulder this is not necessary if you want to pick up the books from us directly.  Please let us know when you place your order.
Photos
All the photographs are from images in the book.  Each photo is 8X10 or 8X12 and is printed on high quality paper. You choose from 18 possibilities in the gallery on this site or at www.thefemalebuddha.com.  
Female Buddha Workshop
Deborah will share stories and slides of Guanyin and we will connect the dots to her inspiration and our lives through reflection and personal sharing. Contemplations on the images and quotes in the book will bring us closer to the wisdom and compassion of Guanyin. *See below for the full description.
In Boulder, CO, the workshop is on Feb. 9 - 10, 2013.  Limited to 28 participants.
Times are Sat. 9:30-12:30, 2-5 and Sun 9:30-1.
The inclusion of the book + cards as part of the workshop are only available through this Indigogo campaign. Another reason to sign up now!
Consulting
As an accomplished writer, photographer and teacher Deborah has years of experience to inspire and guide you in the creative process.  Her work extends to successful program development in educational and busniness settings.  She can help you move through blocks as well as discover your potential.
Additional Overseas Shipping Costs
For the book(s) and photo please add $5 for each for shipping to Canada, $10 for each for shipping to other parts of the world.  

“Deborah captures the essence of the divine feminine...”
                                                            Linda Leonard
If We Exceed Our Goal...
We will be able to continue all our marketing efforts for a longer length of time to insure success in making The Female Buddha available to a broader audience.  We will also be able to pay for an in-house assistant for continued help so Deborah may once again have time to take a photograph!   We’d love to print a second edition and any funds you provide get us closer to this long range goal.
Other Ways You Can Help
Help us get the word out by reposting this on your Facebook, Twitter, Google+ or other social media.
This work is a tribute to the many men and women who bring the divine feminine, her message and her many manifestations into form. Help us bring photographs of her image to those who long for her.  Help us bring the penetrating insight she embodies through women teachers who have mastered the understanding she represents. 
In gratitude, I will continue to work diligently and keep you posted on the project's progress. Please contact me directly if you would like to support The Female Buddha in any other ways including sponsoring a workshop or lecture.
By helping us to reach our goal we believe that we will all truly benefit from the compassion The Female Buddha has to offer the world.
 
*Discovering the Female Buddha Workshop description:
Stories and Slides
Focusing on the qualities of selflessness central to Guanyin, we explore her incarnation as the folk lengend Miao-shan, and compare her to the Handless Maiden in western tales.  Pertinent to our lives today, these stories ask a soul-searching question: what is sacrifice and what is unconditional love? 
Miao-shan is adolescent girl. As an adult figure, Guanyin has mastered the teachings of the Buddha. She wears an Eternal Buddha at her forehead and gestures with her left hand in a teaching mudra.  Like Sophia, she a feminine representation of great wisdom.
In sculptures and paintings we see Guanyin confidently standing in the back of a lion, carp, turtle or horse. Sometimes she is standing on the back of a dragon skimming the ocean waves.  Her all-knowing faith profoundly connects her to the natural environment.  How does she speak to our modern world?
Contemplations
The contemplations deepen our experience and understanding.  To set the tone a brief introduction and short periods of sitting and walking meditation will be offered. 
During the contemplations, one might simply reflect on a quote or image. A phrase is repeated to see what arises in the mind. An icon is simply appreciated or one may notice what other images, feelings or insights are evoked. 
Participants will be invited to write, draw or share in small groups what surfaces in their experience. In the large group, we look more deeply at themes of the individual and collective needs of our time.  We will resource what we have to offer and call to receive what we need.
Deborah Bowman, Ph.D. is a psychologist, photographer & professor of Transpersonal Counseling Psychology at Naropa University. She is a trainer with Boulder Psychotherapy Institute & has been a psychotherapist for 25 years. She is author of When Your Spouse Comes Out, The Luminous Buddha & The Female Buddha.

story:
I am humbled and floored that the fundraising goal was met in the first 48 hours! As this went a lot faster than I ever anticipated, I have some stretch goals!  Keep reading to see them! Please don't stop donating!!  Thank you!!

This November, there will be an exhibit at the Botanical Gardens of Buenos Aires of my series of photos of the Jacaranda trees that grace the streets, plazas and parks of Buenos Aires. This campaign will raise funds to pay for this exhibit and be a way for my extended family, friends, and maybe even some fans of my work to participate in this exhibit from both near and afar with both financial and emotional support. My name is Beatrice Murch and I am a photographer based in Buenos Aires, Argentina. Originally from the USA and the UK, I immigrated to Argentina in 2006 and immediately fell in love with the beauty of the trees of Buenos Aires.

What is Needed & What you Get

The exhibit will cost at least $1500. This total includes printing and mounting costs of the twelve photos, all promotional materials, and opening party supplies. I am asking for $3000 to cover the costs of the perks that will be given out to supporters and IndieGoGo’s cut. For example, my photo book “Seasons of Buenos Aires” printed by blurb.com costs $80 to print and ship. This is why this perk is the most expensive and for supporters who contribute $200.

  • Seasons of Buenos Aires $200 ($80 is my cost)
  • Canvas Prints are $125 ($70)
  • Jigsaw Puzzles are $100 ($45)
  • 2018 Calendars are $75 ($35)
  • Dozen Photo Cards are $50 ($30)
  • 8x10” Print is $25 ($10)
  • High Res Print $15
  • Twitter Thank you $10

The Impact

Jardín Botánico de Buenos Aires hosts monthly art exhibits in the prominent exhibit hall in the center of the garden. This beautiful brick building was the former home of the famed landscape artist Carlos Thays who is responsible for the design of most of the plazas and parks in Buenos Aires. A selection of my Tipa tree photographs was chosen for an exhibit in 2011, and I am thrilled to be invited back for this show of my Jacaranda tree photographs while the Jacarandas are in bloom in Buenos Aires. This exhibit will showcase the beauty that is the natural greenery that can be found on the streets and the plazas of Buenos Aires. It will help promote tourism to the city, create a positive experience, and bring a greater audience to my body of work.

Risks & Challenges

Though I have chosen the photographs for this new exhibit, the logistics are still to be worked out and executed. Having had a show in this specific location before and worked with the administrators, I know the steps, and am better organized and prepared this go round. That being said, this is Argentina and chaos has a way of infecting itself into projects. This is why I am starting early with the planning and have received quotes and timetables to get the photos printed and mounted, the promotional materials made, and the press release written and waiting to be sent to generate excitement about the show.  If the fundraising goal is not reached, the promised rewards of course will be shipped. The remaining costs of the exhibit will be born by myself. The show must go on!!

Stretch Goals

We made the first stretch goal of $5,000 - Thank you so much!!  The following improvements to the exhibition will be made:

  1. The prints will be of higher quality than first imagined.
  2. The opening reception party will get a bit of an upgrade. :)
  3. A videographer will be on hand to capture the event to show all my amazing supporters what they created.

If we generate $8,500, I will print 500 copies of my book "Seasons of Buenos Aires" here in Buenos Aires in bilingual format. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you very much for reading this far and for considering making a contribution. Your support in any form is most appreciated. If you cannot make a financial contribution at this time, your sharing of this campaign with your friends and family via email and social media is invaluable and would be greatly appreciated. Just use the provided Indiegogo share tools and away you go! Thank you for all your support.

story:
Who

I am a photographer who has finally found the subject matter that makes my heart the happiest. Over the last few years, I have self published several documentary style books, chronicling everything from carnival workers to wise words from our elders. In more recent years, I have also been working on concept photography, and when I found that dealing with my feelings about current social and political events by being able to capture my perception of them in images was therapeutic, I had a new mission.

What

This ten image series, was compiled to start a conversation. I want us to be able to laugh at ourselves, to be shocked, and maybe to even feel a bit uncomfortable with what is happening in these images, as it is a reflection of what is happening directly around us. I knew that I wanted to do something different with this project, and to make the biggest impact I have to date and because I have a limited amount of images in this series I plan on printing them to an awesome 40" x 60". I want every detail, pore, twig, and wrinkle - to have an impact on the viewer standing in front of it.

I have arranged the printing with a local print company, as well as taken into consideration the cost of transportation / cases for prints of this size. I am reaching out to small businesses and friends for the idea of sponsorship per canvas, but am also asking for anyone interested to donate towards the final goal. Whether you would like to sponsor an entire print, or secure a book of the prints, or just throw in a 'good luck' buck - I am forever grateful and humbled by whatever you would like to contribute. 

Why

I want you to walk into a art show where these canvases are on display, and I want you to really see the image. The faces, the places, each piece of costume, each element of the story, and although I don't expect you to feel like a changed person, I hope that I can make you want to talk about current events, or maybe even appreciate art and it's various outlets a little bit more.  All of my projects have always been to help the world see itself a little better. This project has opened up so many new visions for my future endeavors, and I truly feel like I have found my stride. With your donation, you are supporting a local artist, and although that is only a small part of the 'why' of this project, the impact will be felt by how we see ourselves and want to change if only a little - by seeing our place in the stories these images tell. Of course, art is subjective. I know what I want you to see, but if you only take away the fact that art and self-expression is important, especially today in the fight for change, then I've done what I set out to do.

How

Any donation towards this project will help! All funds gathered will be put towards

-  (10) 40" x  60"  Wrapped Canvas Prints

-  Hardcover Books of the series, "Gaudy" - A Social Commentary Series 2018

-  Fees, Expenses Exhibits / Gallery Costs

Whether you are all in to sponsor an entire print, want a book or just to throw in anything you can to help - you are making a huge difference! Any sales of the prints after the exhibits in 2018 will be given to charitable organizations which I will have a compiled list of before the project is over.

Grand Reveal

Not all of the images from this project have been shared publicly. I hope to garner enough interest to have people come see them in person and on display. All potential canvas / show sponsors, will be given access to view the images in an online gallery.

THANK YOU. Thank you for your time, your encouragement and for being the supportive people who have helped me realize my goals and allowed me to keep creating.

story:
Michael Cooper (1941-1973) was a beloved British photographer best known for his photographs of leading rock musicians of the 1960s. Cooper began his successful career as a fashion photographer for British Vogue capturing the vibrant energy of the Swinging Sixties in London. In 1964, through the art dealer Robert Fraser, Cooper became immersed in the art and music scene and photographed many leading figures in music, art, fashion, and literature, including The Beatles, The Rolling Stones, Andy Warhol, Cecil Beaton, Twiggy, Jean Genet, and Allen Ginsberg among many others. Cooper's close association with the Rolling Stones, resulted in his largest body of photographic work. As a trusted friend, Cooper was right there with them, camera in hand, capturing every moment, at home, at play, and in the studio. In 1967, Cooper photographed two of the most legendary rock and roll covers of all time, The Beatles’ Sgt. Peppers Lonely Hearts Club Band, and The Rolling Stones’ Their Satanic Majesties Request. In 1973, Cooper took his own life leaving behind an unparalleled photographic legacy that is cared for by his son Adam. 

We are pleased to offer the first ever Brian Jones photo book to be published as a deluxe limited edition. 

Rolling Stones: Their Satanic Majesties Request & The Beatles: Sgt. Peppers album covers which are among Michael Cooper's best known photographic works.

It has been 50 years since the death of Brian Jones (1942-1969). Jones, an English musician is best known as the founder and original leader of the Rolling Stones. 

To celebrate his life and work we have compiled a limited-edition book of rare photographs by Michael Cooper. In addition to the images, we invited some of Jones' closest friends to help tell his story, resulting in more than 10,000 words. Our contributor contributions include a foreword by music legend Donovan and new contributions from Linda Lawrence, Prince Stash Klossowski de Rola, Andee Nathanson, Jones' son Julian Leitch, his grandson Joolz Jones, Rolling Stones road manager Sam Cutler, and renowned music journalist Paul Trynka. Their stories told shed new light on one of rock and roll’s most enigmatic characters. 

Detail of the DELUXE edition signature page with all 8 signatures that you will get with any of the books numbered 1-50. Pictured here are Donovan, Linda Lawrence, Prince Stash Klossowski de Rola, Brian Jones' son Julian Leitch, and grandson Joolz Jones, Adam Cooper, Silvia Cooper, and Dagon James.

This book was overseen by editor & art director Dagon James in collaboration with Michael Cooper's son Adam Cooper and his wife Silvia Cooper. Together they carefully examined Cooper's original 35mm film, bringing into sharp focus the brilliance of Brian Jones at work and at play, featuring moments in the recording studio with bandmates Keith Richards, Mick Jagger, Charlie Watts, and Bill Wyman alongside more intimate candid images. In addition to the selected photographs, we are pleased to include a never before published poem, written by Brian Jones to his partner Linda Lawrence shortly before he passed away.  

Brian Jones & Michael Cooper on the Rolling Stones "Their Satanic Majesties Request" cover shoot.

Many of the photos in this book are published here for the first time, making this a truly unique document in the history of Rock and Roll.

Brian Jones: Butterfly in the Park will be printed on heavyweight 200gsm acid free paper, utilizing a 6-plate printing process with spot varnish and gold page edge gilding, housed in a printed slipcase with metallic foil details to accentuate and protect every book. We are working with one of the best fine art photography book printers in the world to ensure the finest photo reproduction possible. At 148 pages, this lavish book is sure to please the most dedicated enthusiast of Brian Jones, and The Rolling Stones.

Brian Jones during Rolling Stones recording sessions with bandmates Keith Richards, and Mick Jagger at Olympic Studios - London, England.

Sample view of the limited edition hardcover book and slipcase


100 numbered, hardcover books available in 2 editions. 

1. DELUXE EDITION - (Books numbered 1-50) Deluxe books are hand signed by 8 contributors including Donovan, Linda Lawrence, Julian Leitch, Joolz Jones, Prince Stash Klossowski de Rola, Adam Cooper, Silvia Cooper, and Dagon James. 

Every Deluxe edition comes with a numbered, estate stamped 8x10" or 11x14" archival pigment print of the Rolling Stones album cover Their Satanic Majesties Request, one of their most recognizable and sought after images. 

2. COLLECTOR EDITION - (Books numbered 51-100) Collector books are hand signed by contributors Adam Cooper, Silvia Cooper, and Dagon James. 

Choose from 3 (three) different numbered, estate stamped, 8x10" archival pigment prints of Brian Jones. 

Note: The Satanic Majesties Request print is only available with the DELUXE edition of the book.

PREMIUM ADD-ON OPTIONS AVAILABLE WITH EVERY BOOK!

The Rolling Stones album cover for "Their Satanic Majesties Request" - Comes as a numbered, estate stamped, archival pigment print with every DELUXE edition of the book.

BONUS PRINTS! Left: (Print A) Brian Jones recording piano on a Rolling Stones track at Olympic Studios, London. Center: (Print B) Brian Jones & Anita Pallenberg. Right: (Print C) Brian during a photo session at Michael Cooper's studio. All 3 are available as 8x10" and 11x14" print options with both the COLLECTOR and DELUXE editions as numbered, estate stamped, archival pigment prints.

"Eleven Hands" 5x7" postcard that comes with every copy of the book. 

Brian Jones was not only among the most stylish figures of the 1960's, he was also one of the most creative and adventurous multi-instrumentalists in the history of popular music. Michael Cooper captured Brian on film like no one else, and now you can be a part of this rich, musical legacy with Brian Jones: Butterfly in the Park.

story:
** BOOKS AVAILABLE NOW AT YOFFY PRESS!!***

 

 

Manatee, 2015                                                                                                         * available as print perk->

THE PROJECT

I’VE ALWAYS BEEN A COWBOY IN MY HEART​  is my outsider's observations of the weird happenstances that present itself on the great American road trip, as seen through the wide eyes of a Scotsman. After relocating from my native homeland of Scotland in the 90's, I have now spent over half my life in Texas. This 12-year project chronicles my fascination with everyday occurrences in the social landscape and explores the spaces between clarity and imperfection, composing a personal slice of America. 

When put into a photographic context, the aesthetics convey recurring visions of scrutiny, Scottish humor, absurdity and empathy, transforming the most banal scenarios into a nostalgic connection to myself and my background.

It has always been my dream to publish this project as a photobook, and  this year I have teamed up with with Yoffy Press, a kick-ass publisher in Atlanta, GA.

Your kind donations, help and good vibes toward the production of this photobook will make you part of a weird journey with me through the States and keeping physical media alive.

Glacier National Park, 2016                                                                                * available as print perk->

The project was a Photolucidia finalist in the 2019 Critical Mass Top 50 and was an editors pick in the BJP OpenWalls Arles.I have exhibited parts of I’VE ALWAYS BEEN A COWBOY IN MY HEART several times over the last couple of years, including Volcom Garden Gallery, Houston Center for Photography, Grey Duck Gallery, Austin City Hall and Street Level Photoworks (Scotland). 

THE BOOK

Physical media has a very special place in my heart, as well as on my book shelf and in my record collection. If you are a photobook nerd collector like me, you will agree that print serves as a totally different experience to the digital platform. Yoffy Press’ focus on creating photobooks that elevate a project and create a unique experience of the work made them a perfect fit to publish I’VE ALWAYS BEEN A COWBOY IN MY HEART. 

I am working very closely with the Yoffy Press designer, Tucker Capparell, to come as close to creating a weird Americana road trip experience as can be achieved within the pages of a book. We have been hunkering down on this one for a while and have some surprises inside! 

Projected book specs:

·  128 pages

·  72 color photographs

·  6 handwritten embedded postcards from weird and wonderful road trip destinations!

·  Collector pull-out postcard and envelope of the project to mail to friends.

·  Essay by the wonderful Dr Katherine Parhar  , UK photography historian (who knows my work better than me!)

·  Rust cloth-bound hardcover 10x8 inches. (featuring a design by the folks at the mighty LAND design)

· Edition of 500

Handwritten postcard spread mock up from book.

With your generous help, a hardback edition of I’VE ALWAYS BEEN A COWBOY IN MY HEART will be published by Yoffy Press in the fall of 2019, with a target print run of 500 books. Signed copies will be exclusive only to Indiegogo backers.

DIE MART 2015

THE GOAL

The ball is already rolling on this project, and we are aiming to raise an additional $5000 to add some really interesting design features to the book. With your kind financial contributions, this dream version of the book will be in your hands by September 2019 for its launch in Austin at BOOK PEOPLE.

I'm beyond thrilled to be working with a world-class publishing house who takes an innovative and collaborative approach to photobook publishing. Yoffy Press creates beautiful objects with pride, integrity, and an adventurous spirit.

Black Bear On a Log, 2009

 "You capture a culture unhinged and without gravity. Down is up, up is sideways, and in all that these people look to make claim to their space, place and identity.- Brian Ulrich. Photographer.

Mind The Gap, 2018

Daddy-O's Boots, 2016

THE PUBLISHER

Yoffy Press' mission is to transform bodies of photographic work into objects of art by marrying design to content in a way that creates a new experience of the work. They work collaboratively and in partnership with artists through every step of the publishing process, leveraging the individual strengths of each to create magic on the page.

Toothpick, 2013

"Love these images. Your sense of humor is present in all of these, but you have avoided making them gimmicky. They are well shot, intriguing, and even beautiful images (weird as they may be). I looked at the rest of this project on your website and could not stop giggling, you have an eye for the absurd. It is a really fun and lovely project that I hope you continue working on it! “-Audra Osborne, Photolucida

ABOUT SANDY 

Photo by Cubby

Sandy Carson is a self-taught documentary and commercial art photographer, film maker, musician and cyclist who grew up in Scotland, now based in Austin, Texas. He studied communications at University before dropping out to tour the UK and Europe playing in punk bands and making fanzines. After moving to the States in the '90s to pursue cycling, he travelled the world for 20 years as a professional BMX rider where he honed his skills a photographer. His work is an intersection of two careers that have been the recipient of numerous awards. His work is published and exhibited nationally and internationally. Sandy's long term photography projects and documentary works are represented by INSTITUTE.

Spring Break, 2009

Orange Muscle, 2014                                                                                            * available as print perk->

"I feel like you really captured some of the odd absurdity of the American landscape, and while I do not recognize the places, I do get a strong sense of your personal journey. As someone who has been a new immigrant more than once in my life, I also recognize something else in your work... the subtle way in which the mind familiarized itself with a new culture, by finding these visual anchors.  Your work is both fun to look at, and also thought provoking."  –Hava Gurevich Director, Art2art Circulating Exhibitions

Don't have a cow, 2012

WHY CROWDFUND?

Publishing a limited edition fine art book these days is no small feat. With Indiegogo as a crowdfunding platform, there is no risk to invest money in this project, as no money will change hands until the fund goal is met. When it does, you will receive this killer photobook that you helped see the light of day, and you get additional rewards for support. 

A giant cheers to you for supporting this project campaign by becoming a backer as well as sharing this with others. Let's do this!

It's a sign, 2014                                                                                                         * available as print perk>

RISKS & CHALLENGES 

This success of this campaign is essential to creating a photobook that realizes the vision of the work. If I don't raise the 5k in 30 days, everyone gets their money back, and the book will be way less awesome, simple as that. Yikes, I know, that would really suck! I reckon if we can all pull together like we did for my last book , we will be golden! 

Lazy Tree, 2009

Turtle Power, 2016

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

 In addition to supporting I’VE ALWAYS BEEN A COWBOY IN MY HEART financially, there are other ways you can help support this book!

· Please feel free SHARE the campaign through your social media accounts using the URL igg.me/at/cowboyheart . Every click and share helps the project.

· EMAIL your road trip and Americana fans who might be interested in this book. If you know someone who might really enjoy this book or appreciate it, shoot them a quick email with a link to the campaign.

· If you have a cool idea or item that you would like to DONATE as A PERK, such as a dusty old vintage BMX bike or an autographed picture of Bill Murray, please let me know by emailing EMAIL HERE. I would love to surprise backers with a new perk midway through the campaign. 

· Make a MATCH. If you plan to donate to the campaign, consider offering to match the donations of others. Email me if you'd like to become a MATCHING DONOR. 

Columbia River Gorge, 2016

I've Always Been a Cowboy In My Heart, 2016

 

THANK Y'all!

 

This project is sponsored in part by the Cultural Arts Division of the City Of Austin Economic Development Department.

And with gracious help from Pump Project

story:
• A project capturing and showcasing incredible photographic stories of humanity from around the world
  • YOU influence how it develops. Choose where I go next to capture these amazing stories

PROJECT WEBSITE: CapturedEarth.com

On social media:
FACEBOOK: facebook.com/CapturedEarth
GOOGLE+: plus.google.com/+CapturedEarth
TWITTER: twitter.com/CapEarth

Story 71 @ CapturedEarth.com


A global photography project you can influence

 Hello! I'm Tom, a New Zealander currently far from home. Six weeks ago I launched a photography project called Captured Earth, a project to capture and showcase amazing, sad, happy, funny, deep and sometimes brutally honest photographic stories of humanity from people around the world. 

With a successful first few weeks, I've decided that it's time to formally launch the project's crowdfunding campaign here on Indiegogo. 

WHY I'M UNDERTAKING THIS PROJECT

Despite technology making the world a smaller place, it has also created an information overload where incredible, individual human stories from everyday people around the world are never heard or too often lost. 

Captured Earth aims to find and retell some of these stories; stories which also promise to help showcase and remind us about the raw elements of humanity that exist inside every one of us, no matter our age, wealth, sex, religion, race or where we live. 

The photographic stories captured from the journey can be followed online at CapturedEarth.com and on the project's social media pages. Next year a beautiful coffee table book will be published containing a curated set of the stories captured.

>> More about Tom and the story behind Captured Earth

THIS IS OUR PROJECT. YOU CAN BE INVOLVED!

A unique part of the project is that it's crowdsourced, meaning you have input and can influence how it grows and develops! For example, you decide where in the world the project travels to capture these photographic stories of humanity. Since you help decide how it develops, let's call it our project :). 

Since commencing the journey six weeks ago, the project's followers have already sent me to several different locations to capture stories. These locations were determined by an interactive poll at CapturedEarth.com. The result from the most recent poll has brought me to Nepal, where I'm currently gathering and publishing some incredible stories from the amazing people here.

The next destination depends on the result of the newest poll on the project's website. Where would you like me to capture stories next? 

Feel free to head over to CapturedEarth.com and have a browse of the stories captured from the journey so far! New stories are usually added on a daily basis.


Story 43 @ CapturedEarth.com


What I'm needing

Undertaking an ambitious global project like Captured Earth is difficult without outside support; support which is critical for the continuation and growth of the project.

After careful consideration and budgeting for the likely expenses involved, I've set a fundraising target of US$12,000. I believe this is how much I would need to allow me to reach my goal of capturing 1,000 photographic stories of humanity from people around the world. Essentially, the more raised, the longer the project can continue and the more stories I can capture and showcase to you. 


WHAT THE FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR

The big ticket items such as flights, travel visas, insurance and the various costs involved in running a website and keeping my camera equipment maintained all add up to a scary sum.

The funds raised through this campaign will help with all these expenses as well as the day-to-day costs that enable me to survive, capture stories and connect to the online world so I can continue to bring you the stories through the rest of 2014 and into 2015.

Once the goal of capturing 1,000 stories is achieved (early-mid 2015) I will return to New Zealand and start work on the Captured Earth coffee table book, to be published later next year.


Story 73 @ CapturedEarth.com


The perks

As well as knowing you've helped ensure the continuation of the project, I've created several perks at differing support levels to give you something extra in return for your contribution. Hopefully most of the perks are self explanatory.

Included with every perk:

  • Your name (or company name + link to company website) will be posted on the Supporters Wall at CapturedEarth.com, unless you indicate you would like to stay anonymous. You'll also be credited in the Captured Earth coffee table book.
  • You'll be sent a special invitation to help create and curate the Captured Earth book in 2015. (see FAQs for more info)
  • You'll go into the draw to win one of five Supporters Stories. 

See FAQs for information on:
  • Supporter Stories (a super special perk)
  • The bronze, silver and gold sponsorship perks

In the media

I've been fortunate enough to get some exposure for Captured Earth in the media, including various BBC radio interviews (in the UK) and pieces in local and national press, including the NZ Herald - New Zealand's largest newspaper.

You can view the media clippings here.

Story 57 @ CapturedEarth.com


Risks and challenges

Apart from the obvious risk of injury or bad health ending or delaying the project, the main threat is the lack of funds to be able to complete what I have set out to achieve; this being to capture the 1,000 stories of humanity from people around the world.

I believe that if the US$12,000 funding target in this campaign is reached then I will be able to fulfil this goal. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute but still want to help, there's a few things you can do which cost absolutely nothing, yet it would greatly help me and the project:

  • Engage with and share the stories that appear on CapturedEarth.com and the project's social media pages
  • Spread the word about Captured Earth to friends, family and people you think would find the project interesting
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools on this page to spread the word about the crowdfunding campaign


Finally... (you're almost at the end!)

I just want to say a big THANK YOU for your time in reading this campaign and hearing what I've got to say about Captured Earth; a project that's a pretty big deal to me!

Feel free to engage with and share the stories to others, and if you've been able to pledge your support by taking up one of the perks available then I am eternally grateful!

Maybe I'll see you along the journey :)

All the best,

Tom Wrench
Photographer and creator of Captured Earth


Story 21 @ CapturedEarth.com

Related links.

OFFICIAL WEBSITE: CapturedEarth.com
CONTACT: CapturedEarth.com/contact

Follow Captured Earth on social media:
FACEBOOK: facebook.com/CapturedEarth
GOOGLE+: plus.google.com/+CapturedEarth
TWITTER: twitter.com/CapEarth
PINTEREST: pinterest.com/CapturedEarth
TUMBLR: CapturedEarthCom.tumblr.com
INSTAGRAM: instagram.com/CapturedEarth

-------------

Frequently asked questions (FAQs)

  • What are Supporter Stories?
  • What are the bronze, silver and gold sponsorship packages?
  • What does being invited to help create the Captured Earth coffee table book involve?

====

WHAT ARE SUPPORTER STORIES?
As you've hopefully seen on CapturedEarth.com, I've managed to capture some incredible stories from people in the locations I've visited. That said, I know there're so many people around the world with equally incredible stories that I'll never have the opportunity to meet.

If you know someone with an incredible story you think should be captured and shared with the world, I will interview them (via email, Skype or phone call), capture their story and publish it on CapturedEarth.com and the project's social media pages, just like I have with all the other stories captured so far. The story will also feature in the Captured Earth coffee table book in 2015. 

The person whose story is told could be a family member, a friend, an inspirational community leader, a volunteer, the shopkeeper down the road, the postman or even yourself! At the end of the day, everyone has a story of some sort to tell. Supporter Stories allows this story to be captured, published and then be seen and appreciated by thousands of people around the world. Having the story also published in the Captured Earth coffee table book would allow the story to live on for many years to come.

How will you capture them and will you need a photo to go with the story?

I will interview the subject just like I do any of the other people I capture stories from, although instead of interviewing in person I shall be asking the questions by email, Skype or phone call. I'll then write up a story based on the interview and send it to you/the subject to make sure you're happy with it before it's published.

I will also require a photo of the person to be posted with the story. All photo credit will of course be given to the person who took the picture. 

====
WHAT ARE THE BRONZE, SILVER & GOLD SPONSORSHIP PACKAGES?
These perks are aimed at companies and organisations wishing to support the project. Individuals are welcome to claim them as well if they wish.

As well as exposure of the company's logo and links through the Captured Earth website, social media pages and in the Captured Earth coffee table book, each of these packages also include a number ofSupporters Stories. These can be given out to people of your choosing who you think should have their story told to the world. Signed copies of the Captured Earth coffee table book will be sent out to you when published later in 2015. See FAQs below for more details regarding exposure your company will receive.

What sort of exposure will my company/organisation receive?

You will have your logo, company name and links published on the home page at CapturedEarth.com, across several pages on the site and of course be featured heavily on the Supporters Wall as a bronze/silver/gold sponsor of the project. 

You'll also be listed on the project's social media pages and receive exposure in the Captured Earth coffee table book when it is published later in 2015.

To discuss sponsorship or for more information, please feel free to contact me.

====

WHAT DOES BEING INVITED TO HELP CREATE THE CAPTURED EARTH COFFEE TABLE BOOK INVOLVE? 

To link in with the crowdsourced theme of the project, I'll be putting up interactive polls and lists on CapturedEarth.com in 2015 where you can choose what photographic stories and other content should go into the coffee table book.

As a supporter you will be sent an special invitation to take part in this. Come help make a beautiful coffee table book!

====

Have any more questions you want answering? Feel free to contact me!

You'll go into the draw to win one of five Supporters Stories. 


See FAQs for information on:

Supporter Stories (a super special perk)
The bronze, silver and gold sponsorship perks




In the media
I've been fortunate enough to get some exposure for Captured Earth in the media, including various BBC radio interviews (in the UK) and pieces in local and national press, including the NZ Herald - New Zealand's largest newspaper.
You can view the media clippings here.


Story 57 @ CapturedEarth.com


Risks and challenges
Apart from the obvious risk of injury or bad health ending or delaying the project, the main threat is the lack of funds to be able to complete what I have set out to achieve; this being to capture the 1,000 stories of humanity from people around the world.
I believe that if the US$12,000 funding target in this campaign is reached then I will be able to fulfil this goal. 
 Other Ways You Can Help If you can't contribute but still want to help, there's a few things you can do which cost absolutely nothing, yet it would greatly help me and the project: 
Engage with and share the stories that appear on CapturedEarth.com and the project's social media pages
 Spread the word about Captured Earth to friends, family and people you think would find the project interesting

Use the Indiegogo share tools on this page to spread the word about the crowdfunding campaign

Finally... (you're almost at the end!)I just want to say a big THANK YOU for your time in reading this campaign and hearing what I've got to say about Captured Earth; a project that's a pretty big deal to me!
Feel free to engage with and share the stories to others, and if you've been able to pledge your support by taking up one of the perks available then I am eternally grateful!

Maybe I'll see you along the journey :)
All the best,
Tom WrenchPhotographer and creator of Captured Earth



Story 21 @ CapturedEarth.com
Related links.

OFFICIAL WEBSITE: CapturedEarth.comCONTACT: CapturedEarth.com/contactFollow Captured Earth on social media:FACEBOOK: facebook.com/CapturedEarthGOOGLE+: plus.google.com/+CapturedEarthTWITTER: twitter.com/CapEarthPINTEREST: pinterest.com/CapturedEarthTUMBLR: CapturedEarthCom.tumblr.comINSTAGRAM: instagram.com/CapturedEarth


-------------


Frequently asked questions (FAQs)



What are Supporter Stories?

What are the bronze, silver and gold sponsorship packages?

What does being invited to help create the Captured Earth coffee table book involve?


====
WHAT ARE SUPPORTER STORIES?

As you've hopefully seen on CapturedEarth.com, I've managed to capture some incredible stories from people in the locations I've visited. That said, I know there're so many people around the world with equally incredible stories that I'll never have the opportunity to meet.

If you know someone with an incredible story you think should be captured and shared with the world, I will interview them (via email, Skype or phone call), capture their story and publish it on CapturedEarth.com and the project's social media pages, just like I have with all the other stories captured so far. The story will also feature in the Captured Earth coffee table book in 2015. 

The person whose story is told could be a family member, a friend, an inspirational community leader, a volunteer, the shopkeeper down the road, the postman or even yourself! At the end of the day, everyone has a story of some sort to tell. Supporter Stories allows this story to be captured, published and then be seen and appreciated by thousands of people around the world. Having the story also published in the Captured Earth coffee table book would allow the story to live on for many years to come.


How will you capture them and will you need a photo to go with the story?
I will interview the subject just like I do any of the other people I capture stories from, although instead of interviewing in person I shall be asking the questions by email, Skype or phone call. I'll then write up a story based on the interview and send it to you/the subject to make sure you're happy with it before it's published.
I will also require a photo of the person to be posted with the story. All photo credit will of course be given to the person who took the picture. 

====




WHAT ARE THE BRONZE, SILVER & GOLD SPONSORSHIP PACKAGES?

These perks are aimed at companies and organisations wishing to support the project. Individuals are welcome to claim them as well if they wish.
As well as exposure of the company's logo and links through the Captured Earth website, social media pages and in the Captured Earth coffee table book, each of these packages also include a number ofSupporters Stories. These can be given out to people of your choosing who you think should have their story told to the world. Signed copies of the Captured Earth coffee table book will be sent out to you when published later in 2015. See FAQs below for more details regarding exposure your company will receive.
What sort of exposure will my company/organisation receive?
You will have your logo, company name and links published on the home page at CapturedEarth.com, across several pages on the site and of course be featured heavily on the Supporters Wall as a bronze/silver/gold sponsor of the project. 
You'll also be listed on the project's social media pages and receive exposure in the Captured Earth coffee table book when it is published later in 2015.
To discuss sponsorship or for more information, please feel free to contact me.
====

WHAT DOES BEING INVITED TO HELP CREATE THE CAPTURED EARTH COFFEE TABLE BOOK INVOLVE? 
To link in with the crowdsourced theme of the project, I'll be putting up interactive polls and lists on CapturedEarth.com in 2015 where you can choose what photographic stories and other content should go into the coffee table book.

As a supporter you will be sent an special invitation to take part in this. Come help make a beautiful coffee table book!

====

Have any more questions you want answering? Feel free to contact me!

story:
MADAME: A Photographic Approach to Giving Back.

Hello and Welcome.

A few years ago, at a charming bakery in Lexington, Kentucky, I met Rosie Moosnick. I was instantly drawn to her eclectic style and her attractive personality. Before long, Rosie asked me to photograph the people she had interviewed for her second book, "Arab and Jewish Women in Kentucky, Stories of Accommodation and Audacity." (http://ethnickentuckian.com/) This collaboration was the beginning of our beautiful friendship.

A few months ago, Rosie encouraged me to come listen to Diane Cornelius talk about her work that intertwines community service with her business. The decision to attend this lecture has led me to this very opportunity to travel to Haiti. Diane is the owner of Ruth's Bridal, a local bridal boutique in Lexington, Kentucky (http://www.ruthsbridalshop.com/). Three years ago, Diane began a journey that has since changed her life. She helps in donating the gift of marriage to Haitian couples that have been living in a common law marriage for years. (http://ruthsbridalshop.com/brides-helping-brides/brides-helping-brides-2/) The sacrament of marriage will allow these couples, more specifically women, to be accepted in society and receive inheritance if their loved one should pass.  Once married, younger women will be treated with respect and middle-aged women will now be called Madame. By purchasing the rings, marriage license, and even dressing the bride and groom, Diane has made a huge impact on the people of North West Haiti.

I, too, want to make an impact on these people's lives with my talent. Most Haitian families are not graced with the everyday luxury of photographs like you and I are so accustomed to and can easily afford.  The average income in Northwest Haiti, specifically in St. Louis du Nord, is no more than $2.00 per day and it is rare for the opportunity of work to present itself. Feeding and giving shelter to their children is the woman’s first priority and in most cases, there is no money left for a wedding.

This campaign is intended to help me travel, document, and then print photographs for twenty couples that will be marrying at the end of March. I want to give the gift of photographs to these couples so they can cherish their wedding memories for a lifetime—photographs that can be passed down to their children and grandchildren. With every donation given in support of this campaign, it will help a family receive a collection of photographs from their wedding day. The more funds raised, the more lavish of a gift we can give them, for example, larger prints and a wedding album. I have been photographing American weddings for eight years. These years, I believe, have been in preparation for this very trip. If you believe in my campaign, or in me, please donate now.

Together, we can make a difference.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

SPREAD THE WORD.
Share this information with everyone you know wether its word of mouth, facebook, bogs, etc.  Every little bit counts and every bit iis appreciated!

To share, click on the share tools at the top of the page.

 

Thank you kindly, 

Sarah Jane Sanders 

 

 

(Photographs from Haiti used in the video have been donated by Ruth's Bridal)

 

"PERKS" cannot be substituted for any other products or services. Thank you.
