story:
Foto Istwa is a photography project taking place in Haiti.

In February, I had the opportunity to travel to Haiti and tell stories about Haitian culture and life through a series of photo essays. In October I will be going back to Haiti to teach two photography workshops in Port-au-Prince and Duchity. 

The students will be Haitian youth aged 9-15 and the photo assignment is to tell a story. By giving them a camera and an opportunity to tell a story about something they find interesting and something that's important to them, they will be able to tell stories about their lives and communities that we might not otherwise see. 

Haiti has a lot of stories to tell and this is your chance to support a project that will not only give the youth a creative educational opportunity, but it will also give you the opportunity to see Haiti through the perspective of Haitian youth! Your support will help fund two 1 week-long photography workshops in Port-au-Prince and Duchity, equipment, cameras, and transportation costs.

This project team includes myself and another volunteer who also traveled to Haiti earlier this year as well as members of The Vermont Haiti Project who have strong ties in both these communities we are setting up this photography project in. 

This project will provide youth with an opportunity to develop creative and practical skills in photography. The goal of Foto Istwa is to empower youth through story telling via photography.

Please check out the video and this page for information on the project as well as the following websites:

http://www.katrickphotography.com

http://www.facebook.com/katrickphotography

http://adventureswithclyde.wordpress.com/

No amount is too small to donate - I really hope that you will! If you are unable to donate please support this project by sharing this with your family, friends, and coworkers!

Thank you!

story:
Then and Now images, laid side by side, have always been a marvellous way to see how a place has changed over the years. But what happens when you take those two photographs- the then and the now- and mash them togehter? 

What comes from it is a stunning and dynamic way to interact with a place at two different times in one image.  The primary image, the background, is usually the current view: it provides the backdrop and the context to a key element from the historical phogoraph.  This element could be a building, or event just part of it, or it could be people, standing in that exact spot only 80 years ago. 

Using just an element from the historical photographs sets the tone, it creates a suggestions of what once was, while allowing the viewer's imagination to do the rest.

The Canmore Museum & Geoscience Centre is pleased to announce that it will host an exhibition of blended photographs (superimposing historical photographs into modern ones) in February as part of the 2015 Exposure Photography Festival.

The Museum also plans to use the blended photographs as an ongoing fundraiser by selling postcards, cards, resproductions and perhaps a book.  Your donation will not only help fund the exhibition, it will also help the Museum create a perpetual source of funding. 

Rob Alexander, a Canmore-based writer, photographer and historian will produce the blended photographs and the museum, which will host the exhibition, will have ownership and copyright of the final photographs. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $9500 to fund the exhibit. The funds raised from this fundraising campaign will go towards exhibit costs (including producing, printing and framing the photographs) and the exhibition fee ($250). 

Thank you for donating.  You will receive:

- A blended photograph postcard when you donate $15.00

- A set of 5 blended photographs postcards when you donate $50.00

- A 8x10 blended photograph print when you donate $100.00

- A 8x10 blended photograph print AND a set of 5 postcards when you donate $500.00

Other ways you can help

- Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word about this great project

- Visit the Museum to find out more about this exhibit

- Support the project by purchasing a raffle ticket (available at the Canmore Museum).

story: Kristen Abigail Photography went full-time early this year so Kristen could pursue her dream at full-force. She took on an internship full-time at Paste Magazine in order to gain knowledge of the journalism field and to become a better photojournalist. With this giant leap of faith comes a giant need for financial help. My passion is to capture moments that will stand still through the click of my camera and unfortunately it's never cheap to do what I do. And that's where you come in. I've got some awesome rewards for backers to take advantage of. You'll not only be supporting KAP to keep up and running, you'll be supporting a business that networks with artists, record labels, and many others in the music industry to represent it at it's best. The KAP experience is one that is fun, well-planned and full of moments you'll never want to forget! I guarantee when you step in front of my camera that you'll have a great time and you'll love the photographs that come from your session.

story:
A true sense of wildness

We all believe in this dream of exploration. Escaping the constraints of society. Reaching for the impossible. We are compelled to people who dream like this. But do we really have the bravery and grit to step out? Some do. Andrew Winn is one of those few individuals guided by this hunger for adventure. He just graduated high school and is stepping out in a massive way to this next phase of life - experiencing our world in ways the rest of us only dream about. We want to encourage this sense of wildness and support his journey across our great land.

Andrew has custom built a platform in the back of his Tahoe, providing storage and sleeping areas. He'll be packing in a camp stove, axe, hiking gear, camera, and much more to survive off the grid and out of his car for two months. During this process, Andrew will be posting updates from the road for us to catch a glimpse of what he is capturing - until he returns to create the book. This campaign will remain open for 60 days - earlier supporters will help fund the trip, while later supporters will more help fund the book publishing.

A beautifully memorable book

This summer, Andrew has the huge opportunity to explore and photograph huge chunks of our continent. Once he returns, I will be teaming up with him to create a ~100 page book of this adventure. This will be a photo wrapped adventure book, filled with some of the most breathtaking imagery of North America. We'll mix in pages of his journals, sketches of his routes, stories of the unique people he meets on the road, and stories of what life is like living on the road. Not many 18 year olds leave memoirs of this quality at such a young age, inspiring others of all walks of life to follow.


*Book cover subject to change with new photography.

Stunning prints

Some of the packages will include selected prints from this journey. These will be printed on beautiful lustre paper, shipped once towards the end of the trip. We will choose the best images captured during the 12,000 miles.

*Prints subject to change with new photography.

Path of this journey

Andrew is headed out on a very unique expedition to photograph countless areas, including the following:

  • Northern New Mexico

  • Western Colorado

  • Yellowstone National Park

  • Grand Teton National Park

  • Sawtooth National Forest

  • Snoqualmie National Forest

  • Glacier National Park

  • Banff National Park


What We Need

Our goal is $3,000 to help keep Andrew on the road and to cover the minimum printing of 100 books. Photo prints will be handled separately, so here's how the funds will break down for book purchases:

  • 40%: trip support
  • 40%: book publishing
  • 10%: book design, editing
  • 10%: shipping cost


The Impact

This trip is important on many levels:

  • Our opportunity to become a part of something bigger than what we can do alone.
  • Pushing a young photographer to go further than he ever dreamed possible and discover what he is truly capable of accomplishing.
  • Creating a sense of wonder and appreciation for this world - for all who receive a copy of the Where Shall We Wander book.

story:
Bio

Hi everyone! My name is Avery and I am a third year student at the University of Florida studying Chinese and History. While I was studying abroad for 10 months in Ghana on a US State Department scholarship, I had the fantastic opportunity to work with Tremendous Entertainment in producing two shows that aired on the Travel Channel. After returning home I bought my first DSLR camera, and have been taking photos ever since.


My first study abroad experience took place five years ago in South Korea on a scholarship from the Naples Council on World Affairs. Since then, I have not looked back; this summer will be my fourth experience studying abroad. This time, I will be attending a university in Taiwan on a Taiwan-USA scholarship. As always, when I study abroad this summer, I will maintain my travel, food, and culture blog, www.averysegal.com.

My Goal:

My goal is to take a step up in photography by purchasing the Canon 6D.  My Canon T3I has taken me far, but is designed as an entry-level DSLR.  A mid-level full-frame camera like the 6D is essential for capturing low-light and high-dynamic range photos. With the new camera, I plan to start a daily photoblog of my summer travels on my website.


Even the smallest amount helps. The lowest perk costs less than a cup of coffee, and would be deeply appreciated. The perks range from thank you notes to postcards and prints. All profits will go towards my next camera.


I'm not purely asking for donations, but am instead looking to sell my photographs. I've printed several canvas and prints over the past six months, and love the feeling of having art hanging on walls..

How Do I Travel?

I believe that traveling responsibly has the ability to make a difference in the way no other thing can. World politics and international relations are often simplified to one country being good, and another bad. Oftentimes, we only hear the negatives about the outside world.  Traveling allows us to see the individuals -  to meet and understand the people of the world. In this manner, I often discover that we are more similar than people often think.


My favorite photography subjects include food, landscapes, and people. However, I have learned that indiscriminately taking photos of people abroad often leads to  a zoo mentality. I've been asked, "Why do you want to take my photo?" Rather, I've found that the best photos I've taken are of my friends and acquaintances abroad whom I've gotten to know, and received permission to take their photo.  Afterwards  I make a point of taking their email or address to eventually send the photos taken.

Quick Run-Down For Buying Prints

All photos are printed on high-quality photographic paper by a professional printing company and are neither matted nor framed. If there is a specific print from my blog that you want that is not on the page provided, send me an email at avery.segal@gmail.com and we'll get it figured out.

To Buy a Print...

Go to my print website, choose which image(s) you want, and let me know which one you would like either through the comments or by email!

If you want to order prints in bulk (5 or more), just shoot me an email and I will give you a bigger discount.

Thank you very much for reading!

How Do I Travel?
I believe that traveling responsibly has the ability to make a difference in the way no other thing can. World politics and international relations are often simplified to one country being good, and another bad. Oftentimes, we only hear the negatives about the outside world.  Traveling allows us to see the individuals -  to meet and understand the people of the world. In this manner, I often discover that we are more similar than people often think.
My favorite photography subjects include food, landscapes, and people. However, I have learned that indiscriminately taking photos of people abroad often leads to  a zoo mentality. I've been asked, "Why do you want to take my photo?" Rather, I've found that the best photos I've taken are of my friends and acquaintances abroad whom I've gotten to know, and received permission to take their photo.  Afterwards  I make a point of taking their email or address to eventually send the photos taken.



Quick Run-Down For Buying Prints

All photos are printed on high-quality photographic paper by a professional printing company and are neither matted nor framed. If there is a specific print from my blog that you want that is not on the page provided, send me an email at avery.segal@gmail.com and we'll get it figured out.
To Buy a Print...
Go to my print website, choose which image(s) you want, and let me know which one you would like either through the comments or by email!
If you want to order prints in bulk (5 or more), just shoot me an email and I will give you a bigger discount.
Thank you very much for reading!

story:
My Story

My name is Serkan Zanagar and I’m from Istanbul, Turkey where east meets west. I live in Dallas and photography is my passion.

I don’t just photograph subjects. I simply capture the way they make me feel. It's hard to explain but I consider myself a visual narrator and documentarian. If you ask me which of my photographs is my favorite - it's the one I'm going to take tomorrow.

I have countless images currently in use by friends, musical and performing artists, local businesses, blogs, social media, and press including Dallas Observer and Dallas Morning News, D Magazine, Fort Worth Weekly, USA Today, Weather Channel, and various local papers and album covers…plus several of my pictures have received awards in competitions.

Over many years and every chance I get, I have invested into my equipment to continuously improve my art. Sadly…on August 30, 2015 as I was out hiking and photographing Dinosaur Valley State Park, one clumsy move and my camera and lenses were submerged under water. 


What I Need and What You Get

I need to replace my equipment including a Nikon D7100 or 7200 camera body and a telephoto lens.

I’ve never really marketed myself and everyone tells me I should.  So pick a perk and help raise funds to replace my heart and soul. And I will keep telling the stories of the people, places, fur babies, artists, and all this complicated world simply has to share. 

Every dollar helps!  Please spread the word and share with others!  I look forward to continuing to photograph our journeys.

Perks

Each contribution helps get me back doing what I love to do and gives you a memory and stories to have forever.

  • $5 – Hugs and love! Your name listed in the photo book and a big Turkish hug!
  • $20 – Thank you card! Featuring a photo from my collection.
  • $50 – Coffee and a photo mug! Featuring photos from my collection - it’s a toast and a coffee date!
  • $100 – 12 x 18 Photo! Choose from my collection shipped matted or hand delivered for that personal hug, plus your name will be in the book!
  • $125 – Dallas Photo Session! Your very own 2 hour photo shoot session for 1-4 people or empty home (individual, family, band, pets, head shot, etc.). Receive up to 5 retouched digital images.  Shoot in Dallas – there are lots of options!  And I’ll put your name in the book too! Your band, dog, business, favorite goldfish – it’s in the book!
  • $125 – The Book!  A coffee table photo book featuring photos from my collection.  An old fashioned, hard bound book to show your family and friends.
  • $150 – Photograph Your Event – Your Memories! I will attend your Dallas event (3 hours) and capture the performers, artists, stage and audience. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Share my campaign through your network of friends and people you know who would benefit from a photo shoot of themselves, family, performance, a pet, house on the market, or an upcoming event.


    Thank you for your Support!

story:
My Story

Hi! My name is Staci Alziebler and I have had quite a year of new beginnings, from becoming engaged to a wonderful man, to launching an international nonprofit, to starting a photography business. I was honored to be selected to participate in the Gracie Art Show in New York City October 1 and 2. For more information about that, go here: http://graciesquareartshow.info/node/989. The hard part is finding the necessary funds to start a new business. It occurred to me though that maybe my friends and colleagues would rather help me launch my photography business then give me yet one more vase for a wedding or birthday present, so why not ask!

The Impact

The campaign and subsequent art show will enable me to launch my new photography business both at the art show and online in ways that I have only dreamt of before now.

What I Need & What You Get

If the campaign works, it will enable me to purchase a gridwall display at an estimated $200.00, as well as matte and frame at least 8 photographs at an estimated $150.00 each. (The more money raised, the more I can display!) If the campaign doesn't work, then I will still present at the art show, but I may have found an easy weight loss solution! For anyone giving $10 or more, not only do you get to be a part of my new beginnings, but you could get a perk (listed below).

Other Ways You Can Help

I know times are difficult, so if you can't help, I understand, but I hope you will spread the word to your friends and colleagues via Facebook, Twitter, email, aluminum cans and string, whatever works.

 

Thank you so much for being a part of my new beginnings!

story:
Summary

  • Over the past year, I've had the pleasure of documenting Rand's grassroots campaign for President from Iowa to New Hampshire to South Carolina, Nevada, California, Texas, Kentucky, Arizona, Ohio, and many more parts of this great country, contributing hundreds upon hundreds of images of various rallies and meet and greets, and giving a "fly on the wall" view of the man who will become the 45th President of the United States.
  • In order to continue funding these efforts, I'd like to reach out to the grassroots supporters of the liberty movement.
  • Every dollar contributed will go 100% towards these documentation efforts, which includes travel, lodging and transportation. There is no specific goal, but your dollar will definitely go a long way.

In order to continue funding these efforts, I'd like to reach out to the grassroots supporters of the liberty movement. Every dollar contributed will go 100% towards these documentation efforts, which includes travel, lodging and transportation. There is no specific goal, but your dollar will definitely go a long way.

story:
Introduction

We are a class of seven students reading for a Higher National Diploma in Photography at Mcast Institute of Art & Design. Our hard work over the past two years have prepared us for the end of year exhibition, which will be taking place in July, 2015.

We have named our exhibition Room 7. To us, this simple title has a world of meaning. The 'room' refers to the exhibition space containing our work, and the '7' indicates the number of students in our class that made it to the end.

During this amazing experience, we bonded and helped each other be successful. We are a TEAM, merging our individual talents and strengths to produce an exhibition that surpasses even our own expectations.

Room 7 - A collection of photographs featuring the essence of life through artistic interpretation; society and relationships, human nature and desires, life goals and interests, beauty and emotions. It is an exploration of the human experience.

What We Need

We are raising funds for:

  • Materials, such as wood sheets

  • Catering and refreshments for opening night

  • Promotional Material - printing costs

  • Printing of the photos to be exhibited

  • Setting up the exhibition

  • Other costs

Perk Details

When the campaign is over, we will start sending out all the e-mails and perks as promised. We will contact you for your photo or calendar selection before printing; the choices can be seen below.

Calendar themes: Abstract or Flowers.

  

The Impact

Please help us make this exhibition a memorable experience as we begin our journey into the world of professional photography. Your donation - any amount - will bring us a step closer towards achieving our wish to make this exhibition a remarkable one; for ourselves, and all those who attend. 
We also hope this exhibition will help in the efforts to establish photography as an esteemed art form in Malta.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • You can contact us to donate materials
  • You can feature our campaign in your paper, magazine, or other medias
  • You can help us by sharing this campaign on social media
  • You can also like our Facebook page, which will be updated regularly

Plans for Extra Funds

Any funds that exceed our goal will go to a local charity.

story:
70 days - 9,000kms - 9 CFL cities

(and a lot of photos)


GOAL: Photographer Johany Jutras is going to embark on a roadtrip across the beautiful Canadian countryside, completing the first ever documented CFL roadtrip. Along that amazing journey, she will capture - through her lens - each CFL city's unique culture and history, finally telling you the story of our Canadian Football passion, with the end result being a premium 112-page long photobook. 

ABOUT THE ROADTRIP: The roadtrip is going to be a 70-75 day long journey travelling through Canada. Photographer Johany Jutras will hit the road alone on July 20th, and she will make a stop at each of the 9 CFL cities: Montreal, Ottawa, Toronto, Hamilton, Winnipeg, Regina, Edmonton, Calgary and Vancouver. During this journey she will spend about 6-8 days in each city, and immerse herself with the fans of the local CFL team, letting her capture the essence of the culture and the love of the fans for their team. A social media campaign is going to be conducted along the journey. Fans and supporters will be able to follow her through her many social media accounts (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Snapchat) as well as on an online blog that she will update every 3-4 days with stories, photos and videos. 

(Photographer Johany Jutras. Photo: Bernard Brault)

ABOUT THE BOOK: The book is originally designed to be a 10 x 8 landscape oriented photo book; constructed of 112 pages of premium quality paper. It could result in being a bigger sized book with even higher paper quality, depending on the funds that we are able to reach before the print date. 

An original concept by photographer Johany Jutras, it will be visually assembled by her.  Enriched with the participation of professional sports writers, it is also verified and approved by the Canadian Football league.  

Your contributions will enable the production of this book, which will result in being the first Canadian Football photo book. Documenting - with photos and texts - our Canadian Football league fans and their -each to be different and unique per team, city, province- culture and history.

The book sales premiere will take place during the 2015 Grey Cup week in Winnipeg, MB. From November 23 to 29, 2015. Every contributor that has a book in their package will receive it during these dates, too. 
After that, the book will be available for purchase online. Stay tuned for more details.

The budget of this roadtrip is over $20k. 

That includes minimal transportation, meals, lodging and insurances fees only.

IF ANY NATIONAL CAR COMPANY AS WELL AS HOTELS AND/OR RESTAURANT CHAINS WOULD LIKE TO PARTICIPATE AND CONTRIBUTE TO THIS PROJECT. Please contact johanyjutras@gmail.com

Please note that the budget for this project does NOT INCLUDE any extras such as: 

  • Cameras and lenses equipment: +/- $35 000
  • Computer, hard drives to store and edit photos, as well as software to build the book template. More than $5 000
  • Working times and salary (invaluable). 

Also, please note that this project is entirely funded by photographer Johany Jutras herself. The CFL is a partner of this project and will participate with it and help make the project come true, without financial participation. 

THANK YOU for helping her accomplish this amazing project and journey. Your support, whether big or smaller, makes all the difference.

***Remember, in life, every good action WILL REWARD YOU A HUNDREDFOLD! See this opportunity as an investment.

story:
Short Summary

Mohammad Kheirkhah is a freelance photographer and Multimedia producer having worked for the BBC, United Press International and Deutsche Welle since 2004. Mohammad won an Award of Excellence from Picture of The Year International contest, a program by Missouri School of Journalism for his picture in Iran in 2007. He is now based in San Francisco, CA.

When we speak of influential Persians, we often reference people of the past, sometimes those who lived 2500 years ago.  However, there are many great Persians who live among us in the present, many who continue to influence the way we see the world through art, music, science, technology, and healthcare, just to name a few. My aim is to shed a little light on their faces and capture their brilliance in a unique book. Imagine holding a photo book full of your favorite people!

What We Need & What You Get

To successfully fund this project, $15,000 is needed. More than $6000 will go for the publishing, such as ISBN, printing, distribution, etc.  Around $3000 will go for the cost of writers, translators, editors, and designers. More than $5000 will go for the cost of traveling, and the rest (about $1000) will be spent on videographers who work behind the scenes. Keep in mind that 10% of the funds raised will cover fees for hosting the project on Indiegogo. After these fees have been deducted, the remaining total will be $13,950. 

- What we need: $15,000 
- Publishing cost: $6,000
- Traveling cost: $5,000
- Cost of writers, editors, designers, and translators: $3,000
- Videographers: $1,000
- Fees for hosting the project in this website: $1050

If we don’t reach our entire goal, the funds will be spent to finish photographing these portraits and publish them in an alternative manner.

The Impact

Last year, with your help, I was able to successfully publish my first book, which is available now on iTunes, Amazon, and Blurb. You can view the book by clicking the link below.

http://www.bayareapicture.com/book

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that some people might not be able to contribute money, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help.  Please ask your friends to get the word out and make some noise about the campaign.

story:
My Story....

I'm Chad Almquist, I have been a photographer for 20+ years. Over the past 5 years,  I have done freelance work for 97.3 Kiro Radio's MyNorthwest.com, 99.9 Kisw.com and have covered many events. I have also covered tryouts and games for the Seattle Mist Lingerie Football team. Which my images have appeared on Linda Thomas's blog on MyNorthwest.com. 

Last year I started doing modeling photography. I have done Vintage Pinup, glamour, beach, goth, zombie, and much more. 


My Plan....

My Plan for 2012 is to launch YumeUniverse.com to a new level. With an accompanying magazine,

Featuring  woman, art, stories, and etc. It's aimed toward a male audience. Similar to other men's magazines. Yet set to a higher level of sexiness and class. Also a Sci-Fi/action/horror mag slated for late 2012, hopefully before the world ends.

Also to offer photography services for events, as in weddings, parties, and much more.

 

 

 

With Your Support........

I will be able to upgrade my equipment. As of now, I'm using a camera that is on its last shutter clicks. It has done me well over the last couple years. Yet to take the magazine and other projects to the next level. I need more up to date technology that will free up the constraints and to make me more competitive.  I.e. Lens,speedlights and etc.

Also to be able to get the prints,calendars,posters and the Magazines, so my Ladies (featured in the images on this page)can start making some money. Which is one of the most important aspects to my 2012 plan.  

 

This is a breakdown of the planned equipment:


Nikon D7000

Nikon 50mm 1.8 Lens

Nikon 28mm-70mm 2.8 lens

Nikon 80mm-200mm 2.8

2 Nikon SB900 speedlights

Battery Grip

Blackrapid Strap

Service Costs


With this equipment, it will open up a new dimension of creativity and what I can offer in photography services.




What's in it for You?

I have created different perk levels. Each growing with each donation level. From Prints, Photo Shoots, and even the Debut #1 issue of YumeUniverse.com magazine.  No matter what level you help at. you will be a part of the universe.  

I know not everyone can help out financially, but by posting a link to this campaign on your Facebook ,Twitter, Google+ or even by word of mouth,  you’re really helping out. Thank you!

story:
Version Français Dessous

Sunday April 6, Update: 5 Hours to go, 114 funders and almost 75% funded. Amazing. Can we make the last bit? Please share!!!

Saturday April 5, Update: Less than 36 hours to go and so close to the $6,000 mark, thank you everyone for your support so far! 

Thursday April 3, Update: The campaign has also been picked up in EcoWatch. 

Wednesday April 2, Update: Along the Pipeline was just covered by TckTckTck in this great article. Take a moment to read it.

Tuesday April 1, Update: $6,000 to go, 6 days to do it, please share and help make this a success. 

Monday March 31, Update: Nouveau! Une version Français dessous. Merci beaucoup a Estelle! 

Sunday March 30, Update: Great coverage from the Montreal web magazine and blog, Forget the Box. Check out their feature piece on this project. 

Tuesday, March 25, Update: 50 Funders! Wow! Thanks Michel for being number 50. Amazing, let's get this done.

Monday, March 24, Update: A new week and 26% raised. Great! I have also just received word that we should have a French version of this campaign up very soon. 

Thursday, March 20, Update: The website for this project has been registered. Reaching the 10K goal or blowing beyond will be huge in making the site alongthepipeline.com live!! Onwards.

Wednesday, March 19, Update 2: The project has just been featured on the Canadian site of DeSmogBlog. Here is the link.

Wednesday, March 19, Update: I just wanted to share that this issue is making headlines right now in Canada. It appears that the benefit to Eastern Canada touted by TransCanada is vastly overblown. A few articles worth taking a look at are this one in the Chronicle Herald and this one on CTV.

Monday, March 17, Update: Wow, what a great start! Already 13% funded. Some amazing donations coming in and I really look forward to following up with perks and staying in touch as this project develops. Let's make this happen. Keep sharing it on social media and with your friends. 

 Version Français Dessous


I am looking for supporters that believe that culture and art have an important role to play in building a better world. Supporters that believe in thriving communities. Supporters that care about the environment and think it is time for change! Are you one of those? Than please add your voice, donate and join me on this journey.

What Is 'Along the Pipeline'

An ambitious project to photograph those impacted by the proposed Energy East pipeline.

In a few weeks I will be starting out on a long journey to follow the route of the proposed Energy East pipeline from Hardistry, Alberta to St.John, New Brunswick in Canada. I will use photography to create portraits and multimedia pieces that put a human face on this pipeline. Through this work I hope to demonstrate the strength of Canadians and First Nations, what we value and how this project will have far reaching implications.

The end goal of this project is a photography exhibit that will help elevate the conversation in Canada around pipelines and climate change. Several leading environmental NGOs in Canada are already planning how to incorporate this exhibit into their work. 

I was born in Canada and lived for many years in the Netherlands. I believe in the role of art and photography to create a thriving world. Throughout my career I have used photography to focus on issues related to our rapidly changing climate. I have worked for Canadian Geographic, National Geographic Traveler and a variety of NGOs. My work can be found at vanwaardenphoto.com.

About Energy East

TransCanada, the same company behind the Keystone XL pipeline, is proposing another pipeline but this time across Canada. If approved, Energy East would transport 1.1 million barrels of diluted bitumen a day from the oil sands of Alberta to St. John. It would cross hundreds of waterways and drinking water supplies and would be responsible for greenhouse gas emissions that would equal 7 million new cars on the road. 

Is this the future we want?

With your support, I will build a body of work that documents people along the pipeline route and share these striking pieces with Canada and the world. 

Map courtesy of Environmental Defence

The Impact

Visual media has been a critical tool in mobilizing tens of thousands of people in Canada and the US to stop the extraction and exporting of Tar Sands oil. Poignant and powerful photographs and videos were key to visualizing and sharing the struggle and delaying the Keystone XL pipeline in the US.

Energy East is Canada's opportunity to do the same. "Along the Pipeline" will share the untold story of what the pipeline will really mean for Canadians and First Nations.

By leveraging the power of visual storytelling we can bring people from all over Canada to the frontlines of this issue. People who see this exhibit will recognize themselves and their communities in the faces of others and realize that they are not alone. 

The great news is that I have already partnered with several leading environmental groups in Canada to put this media to use. We will work to come up with the best strategy to share the exhibit far and wide through a mix of online and offline media outlets and venues.

So now I just have to create it!

With a track record that includes projects and images being displayed at the UN in New York, on Parliament Hill in Ottawa and the EU parliament in Brussels, I am confident that with your support we can make this happen.


How You Can Help 

More great news! Those environmental organization partners have already provided some seed funding. However, it isn't enough to make this a success and that is why I am asking for your help. 

I need funding for basic items like transportation, fuel, food and - critically - an assistant. With your support I can hire an amazing multimedia/video/social-media person (who is already ready to go!) to help out on the journey. They will help with the social media, documentation, the logistics and of course the driving so I don't fall asleep at the wheel. 

You can help by donating above.

What You Get

Besides my eternal gratitude and that fuzzy feeling that comes with supporting a project, I have compiled some really exciting (in my humble opinion) 'perks' for your support. These include mystery postcards from somewhere in Canada, prints, consultations and a few other things. Details on the right. 

If through your generous support I raise more than 10K that would be amazing! The extra will be used to create a mini documentary about the voyage, build a website, and dedicate time post journey to make the project a success.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute financially, that doesn’t mean you can’t help. Share this campaign with your friends. Use the Indiegogo share tools on this site to help me get the word out!

Or Get Involved. Join or volunteer with a local organization or community campaign. Here are some great organizations to consider.  

  • Greenpeace is always running exciting campaigns.
  • In Ontario, Environmental Defence is running some exciting community based initiatives. 
  • In New Brunswick the Conservation Council and the New Brunswick Environmental Network are amazing. 
  • In Quebec, Equiterre is an the one to seek out, join them. 
  • 350.org is building an incredible movement world wide. 
  • LeadNow, an independent advocacy organization that is bringing Canadians together to achieve progress through democracy is great, connect with them. 

Image Rewards

Below are the selected images available for the perks. 

Galeairy lake, Algonquin Park, Ontario


Lobster Fishing, Cavendish, Prince Edward Island

Abandoned House, Hunter River, Prince Edward Island

Ice Climber, Pont Rouge, Quebec

Je recherche des partisans qui sont convaincus que la culture et l'art peuvent influencer la construction d'un monde meilleur. Les partisans qui croient en des communautés prospères, des partisans qui se soucient de l'environnement et pensent qu'il est urgent d’agir! Êtes-­‐vous de ceux-­‐là? Si oui, s'il vous plaît faites retentir votre voix, donner et rejoignez-­‐moi au cours de ce voyage.

Qu'est-­‐ce que « le long du pipeline » ?

Un projet ambitieux pour photographier les impacts du pipeline Energy East sur les populations humaines. 

Dans quelques semaines, je vais commencer un long périple pour suivre le tracé du pipeline de East Energy Hardistry, dans la province d’Alberta à Saint-­‐Jean, dans la province du Nouveau-­‐Brunswick au Canada. Je vais utiliser la photographie pour créer des portraits et des supports multimédia pour mettre un visage humain à ce pipeline. Le but de ce projet est de provoquer un débat au Canada concernant le pipeline et les conséquences du changement climatique. 

Grâce à ce travail, j’espère démontrer la force des Canadiens et des Premières nations, ce que nous apprécions et comment ce projet aura des conséquences de grande envergure. Plusieurs Organisations Non Gouvernementales (ONG) environnementales de premier plan au Canada prévoient déjà la façon d'intégrer cette exposition dans leur mission. 

Je suis né au Canada et j’ai vécu de nombreuses années aux Pays-­‐Bas. Je suis persuadé que l'art et la photographie contribuent à créer un monde prospère. Au cours de ma carrière, j'ai utilisé la photographie pour me concentrer sur les questions liées au rapide changement climatique. J'ai travaillé pour la presse notamment le « Canadian Geographic », le « National Geographic Traveler » ainsi que diverses Organisations Non Gouvernementales. Vous pouvez consulter mon travail sur le site www.vanwaardenphoto.com. 


À propos de East Energy 

TransCanada, l’entreprise soutenant le projet de pipeline Keystone XL, propose un autre pipeline, mais cette fois-­‐ci traversant le territoire Canadien. Si le projet est approuvé, East Energy pourra transporter 1,1 million de barils de bitume par jour à partir des sables bitumineux de la province de l’Alberta à Saint-­‐Jean. Il croisera des centaines de cours d'eau et fournisseurs en eau potable et sera responsable d’émissions de gaz à effet de serre égale à 7 millions de voitures neuves circulant sur les routes. 

Est-­‐ce l’avenir que nous voulons ?

Avec votre soutien, je vais créer un ensemble de travaux qui informera les populations durant la traversée du pipeline et fera partager ces résultats impressionnants au Canada et dans le monde. 

Environmental Defence

L’impact 

Les médias ont été un outil essentiel dans la mobilisation de dizaines de milliers de personnes au Canada et aux États-­‐Unis pour arrêter l’extraction et l'exportation de pétrole des sables bitumineux. Les photographies et reportages poignants et lourds d’émotions ont joué un rôle clé dans le combat et ont permis de retarder le projet de pipeline Keystone XL lancé aux États-­‐Unis. 

Le projet East Energy est l'occasion pour le Canada de renouveler ce combat. " Le long du pipeline " vise à sensibiliser le public sur la signification du pipeline pour les Canadiens et les Premières Nations. 

En profitant de l’intensité de la narration visuelle, nous pourrons conduire les gens au Canada à réfléchir sur cette question. Les personnes qui assisteront à cette exposition se reconnaitront dans ces communautés et prendront conscience qu'ils ne sont pas seuls. 

La bonne nouvelle est que j'ai déjà tissé des liens de partenariat avec plusieurs grands groupes environnementaux du Canada afin d’utiliser ce média. Nous allons travailler à la mise en place de la meilleure stratégie pour diffuser cette exposition par divers canaux d’informations, tant en ligne que dans les points de vente ou sur des sites internet. 

Alors maintenant, je dois juste le créer ! 

Avec les antécédents de projets et d’images affichées à l'Organisation des Nations Unies (ONU) à New York, sur la Colline du Parlement à Ottawa et au Parlement européen à Bruxelles, je suis convaincu qu’avec votre soutien, nous réussirons. Comment nous aider ? 


Encore plus de bonnes nouvelles!

Nos partenaires d'organisation environnementales ont déjà apporté un financement de démarrage. Cependant, il n’est pas suffisant pour le considérer comme un succès, c'est pourquoi je fais appel à votre générosité. 

J'ai besoin de financements pour des éléments basiques comme le transport, le carburant, la nourriture et – d’un assistant. Avec votre soutien, je peux engager un webdesigner spécialisé en multimédia / vidéo / médias sociaux (et déjà prêt à partir!) pour nous aider durant le voyage. Nos partenaires nous aideront avec les médias sociaux, la documentation, la logistique et bien-­‐sûr la conduite, pour que je ne m'endorme pas au volant ! 

Vous pouvez aider en faisant un don ci-­‐dessous. 

Ce que vous obtenez 

En plus de mon éternelle reconnaissance et de ce sentiment agréable qui vient à l'appui d'un projet, j'ai compilé plusieurs « avantages » excitants (à mon humble avis) pour votre contribution. Il s'agit notamment de cartes postales mystérieuses, postées d’un peu partout au Canada, de posters, de consultations et quelques petites choses. Détails à droite. 

Si grâce à votre soutien généreux je soulève plus de 10 000$, ce serait génial! L’excédent sera utilisé pour créer un mini-­‐ documentaire sur le voyage, construire un site web , et consacrer une partie du temps pour le succès du projet.


Autres façons d'aider 

Si vous ne pouvez pas participer financièrement, cela ne signifie pas que vous ne pouvez pas aider ! Partager cette campagne avec vos amis, utilisez les outils de diffusion IndieGoGo sur ce site pour faire du bouche à oreille ! Ou impliquez-­‐vous ! 

Rejoignez-­‐nous ou devenez bénévole au sein d’une organisation locale ou de campagne communautaire. Voici les noms de quelques grandes organisations environnementales

  • Greenpeace mène toujours des campagnes passionnantes. 
  • En Ontario,  Environnemntal Defense mène des initiatives communautaires intéressantes. 
  • Dans le Nouveau-­‐ Brunswick, Conservation Council  et  The New Brunswick Environnemental Network sont étonnants. 
  • Au Québec, Équiterre recherche des bénévoles. N’hésitez pas à les rejoindre 
  • 350.org construit un mouvement mondial. 
  • LeadNow, une organisation de défense indépendante qui réunit des Canadiens pour faire avancer les progrès dans la démocratie est grande. Mettez vous en relation avec eux. 

Récompenses de l'image 

Voici les images sélectionnées disponibles pour les avantages. 

Galeairy lake, Algonquin Park, Ontario


Lobster Fishing, Cavendish, Prince Edward Island


Abandoned House, Hunter River, Prince Edward Island

Ice Climber, Pont Rouge, Quebec

Récompenses

1$ Toutes les pièces de monnaie. Je vous remercie. Chaque dollar compte pour ce projet. Vous serez ajouté à la liste de diffusion exclusive où vous recevrez des mises à jour du sujet, dans les coulisses des histoires du projet et de l'information sur l'exposition qui se déplace. 

$5 Prise de parole. Une prise de parole sur les pages Twitter et FB de Robert van Waarden et vous serez ajouté à la liste de diffusion exclusive. 

$25 Carte postale mystérieuse. Une carte postale écrite à la main à partir d'un mystérieux endroit du Canada et ajouté à la liste d'envoi. 

$50 Consultation 1. Trente minutes d’examen ou de consultation skype portant sur les médias au sein de votre organisation ou de votre propre travail artistique, vous recevrez également une carte postale et serez ajouté à la liste d'envoi. 

$100 Sur le mur. Vous recevrez un paysage canadien imprimé et signé aux dimensions 8 po x 12 po ( 20cm X 30cm ) et sélectionné à partir de l'une des images indiquées en plus d'un carte postale et vous serez ajouté à la liste d'envoi. Vous serez également inscrit sur les crédits pour l'exposition. Comprend expédition au Canada. S'il vous plaît ajouter 10 $ pour adresse internationale. 

$250 Photo du visage. Tout le monde aime les photos de visage. Obtenez une séance d'une heure avec moi pour créer une photo de votre visage pour votre profil. Valable à Montréal ou ailleurs où je me rends en 2014 pour d'autres travaux ou pour le plaisir. Contactez-­‐moi et je vous dirai les chances que vous aurez de me rencontrer dans votre quartier cette année. Vous recevrez également une carte postale, serez ajouté à la liste de courrier électronique et figurez dans les crédits pour l'exposition. 

$250 Consultation 2. Une heure d’examen ou de consultation skype portant sur les médias au sein de votre organisation ou de votre propre travail artistique. Vous recevrez également une carte postale, un paysage imprimé et signé aux dimensions 8 po x 12 po ( 20cm X 30cm ) et choisi parmi l'une des images indiquées, serez ajouté à la liste de courrier électronique, et figurez dans les crédits pour l'exposition . Inclut les frais d’expédition au Canada. S'il vous plaît ajouter 10 $ pour les adresses internationales. 

$1000 Caractère personnel. Disponible uniquement dans le corridor Toronto Québec. Un diaporama d'une nuit hébergé dans un petit lieu de votre choix, cela pourrait être votre salon. Nous allons nous asseoir ensemble autour d'une bouteille de vin ou de bière et je partagerai mes images et histoires du voyage. Vous recevrez également une carte postale, un paysage imprimé et signé aux dimensions de 8 po x 12 po ( 20cm X 30cm ) et choisi parmi les images indiquées, vous serez également ajouté à la liste de courrier électronique, et figurez dans les crédits pour l'exposition . 

$5000 Un échange complet. Pour votre incroyable générosité, vous recevrez un fichier d'exposition numérique et les droits d'impression et d’affichage de l'exposition complète dans un lieu de votre choix. J’assisterai à la soirée d'ouverture. Inclut les coûts de déplacement au Canada. Des frais supplémentaires à l’extérieur du Canada peuvent s'appliquer. Vous recevrez également une carte postale, un paysage imprimé et signé aux dimensions 16po x 20po signé (40cm X 50cm) et choisi parmi l'une des images indiqué, serez ajouté à la liste de courrier électronique, et figurez dans les crédits pour l'exposition.

En plus de mon éternelle reconnaissance et de ce sentiment agréable qui vient à l'appui d'un projet, j'ai compilé plusieurs « avantages » excitants (à mon humble avis) pour votre contribution. Il s'agit notamment de cartes postales mystérieuses, postées d’un peu partout au Canada, de posters, de consultations et quelques petites choses. Détails à droite. 
Si grâce à votre soutien généreux je soulève plus de 10 000$, ce serait génial! L’excédent sera utilisé pour créer un mini-­‐ documentaire sur le voyage, construire un site web , et consacrer une partie du temps pour le succès du projet.


Autres façons d'aider 
Si vous ne pouvez pas participer financièrement, cela ne signifie pas que vous ne pouvez pas aider ! Partager cette campagne avec vos amis, utilisez les outils de diffusion IndieGoGo sur ce site pour faire du bouche à oreille ! Ou impliquez-­‐vous ! 
Rejoignez-­‐nous ou devenez bénévole au sein d’une organisation locale ou de campagne communautaire. Voici les noms de quelques grandes organisations environnementales


Greenpeace mène toujours des campagnes passionnantes. 
En Ontario,  Environnemntal Defense mène des initiatives communautaires intéressantes. 
Dans le Nouveau-­‐ Brunswick, Conservation Council  et  The New Brunswick Environnemental Network sont étonnants. 
Au Québec, Équiterre recherche des bénévoles. N’hésitez pas à les rejoindre 
350.org construit un mouvement mondial. 
LeadNow, une organisation de défense indépendante qui réunit des Canadiens pour faire avancer les progrès dans la démocratie est grande. Mettez vous en relation avec eux. 

Récompenses de l'image 

Voici les images sélectionnées disponibles pour les avantages. 


Galeairy lake, Algonquin Park, Ontario
Lobster Fishing, Cavendish, Prince Edward Island

Abandoned House, Hunter River, Prince Edward Island

Ice Climber, Pont Rouge, Quebec

Récompenses
1$ Toutes les pièces de monnaie. Je vous remercie. Chaque dollar compte pour ce projet. Vous serez ajouté à la liste de diffusion exclusive où vous recevrez des mises à jour du sujet, dans les coulisses des histoires du projet et de l'information sur l'exposition qui se déplace. 
$5 Prise de parole. Une prise de parole sur les pages Twitter et FB de Robert van Waarden et vous serez ajouté à la liste de diffusion exclusive. 
$25 Carte postale mystérieuse. Une carte postale écrite à la main à partir d'un mystérieux endroit du Canada et ajouté à la liste d'envoi. 
$50 Consultation 1. Trente minutes d’examen ou de consultation skype portant sur les médias au sein de votre organisation ou de votre propre travail artistique, vous recevrez également une carte postale et serez ajouté à la liste d'envoi. 
$100 Sur le mur. Vous recevrez un paysage canadien imprimé et signé aux dimensions 8 po x 12 po ( 20cm X 30cm ) et sélectionné à partir de l'une des images indiquées en plus d'un carte postale et vous serez ajouté à la liste d'envoi. Vous serez également inscrit sur les crédits pour l'exposition. Comprend expédition au Canada. S'il vous plaît ajouter 10 $ pour adresse internationale. 
$250 Photo du visage. Tout le monde aime les photos de visage. Obtenez une séance d'une heure avec moi pour créer une photo de votre visage pour votre profil. Valable à Montréal ou ailleurs où je me rends en 2014 pour d'autres travaux ou pour le plaisir. Contactez-­‐moi et je vous dirai les chances que vous aurez de me rencontrer dans votre quartier cette année. Vous recevrez également une carte postale, serez ajouté à la liste de courrier électronique et figurez dans les crédits pour l'exposition. 
$250 Consultation 2. Une heure d’examen ou de consultation skype portant sur les médias au sein de votre organisation ou de votre propre travail artistique. Vous recevrez également une carte postale, un paysage imprimé et signé aux dimensions 8 po x 12 po ( 20cm X 30cm ) et choisi parmi l'une des images indiquées, serez ajouté à la liste de courrier électronique, et figurez dans les crédits pour l'exposition . Inclut les frais d’expédition au Canada. S'il vous plaît ajouter 10 $ pour les adresses internationales. 
$1000 Caractère personnel. Disponible uniquement dans le corridor Toronto Québec. Un diaporama d'une nuit hébergé dans un petit lieu de votre choix, cela pourrait être votre salon. Nous allons nous asseoir ensemble autour d'une bouteille de vin ou de bière et je partagerai mes images et histoires du voyage. Vous recevrez également une carte postale, un paysage imprimé et signé aux dimensions de 8 po x 12 po ( 20cm X 30cm ) et choisi parmi les images indiquées, vous serez également ajouté à la liste de courrier électronique, et figurez dans les crédits pour l'exposition . 
$5000 Un échange complet. Pour votre incroyable générosité, vous recevrez un fichier d'exposition numérique et les droits d'impression et d’affichage de l'exposition complète dans un lieu de votre choix. J’assisterai à la soirée d'ouverture. Inclut les coûts de déplacement au Canada. Des frais supplémentaires à l’extérieur du Canada peuvent s'appliquer. Vous recevrez également une carte postale, un paysage imprimé et signé aux dimensions 16po x 20po signé (40cm X 50cm) et choisi parmi l'une des images indiqué, serez ajouté à la liste de courrier électronique, et figurez dans les crédits pour l'exposition.

story:
Lucy Pringle is one of the best-known photographers of Crop Circles in the UK, and she has built up a photographic library of images over the past 25 years which is available on her website. www.lucypringle.co.uk

For over 20 years, Lucy Pringle has been documenting Crop Circles in the UK, compiling a huge resource of photographs and information for those studying this phenomenon.  Until last year she was able to fund her work from her own income and sales of photographs, but this hasn’t kept pace with the cost of the work.  Due to Civil Aviation Authority regulations, she needs to hire helicopters to get the best shots of the circles, and she needs help with maintaining the library of photographs and the website for her photographic record, which is open to everyone.
 
She has worked to make sure that she has the most comprehensive record for the area of southern and central England where these circles proliferate in the summer months.  In addition to her photographic documentation, she has been working with scientists to conduct research into the effect of electromagnetic fields on living systems and is currently focussing on the temporary relief of Parkinson's disease symptoms when visiting certain crop circles, She liaises with farmers in the region, and with other crop circle researchers.
 
Lucy is faced with the prospect of being unable to afford to fully record the crop circles for 2013, without this Indiegogo funding, and therefore the prospect that the photographic record that she has maintained for so long, might remain incomplete.
 
Help her to fund her photographic work for the 2013 season, and ensure the continuing success of the UK’s crop circle photographic library for the future.

Even if you can't afford to help financially, you can help to get the word out about the appeal - please share the details and links on your mailing list, Facebook, google+ and twitter.

IF YOU DO CONTRIBUTE PLEASE REMEMBER TO GIVE ME YOUR ADDRESS.

story:
The 1000 Shillings Photography Fellowship Program is offering me an exciting opportunity to live and work alongside artisan entrepreneurs in a developing country for three weeks to three months.

1000 Shillings works in developing nations around world, with the goal of giving women artisans a future through small businesses and a voice through in-depth storytelling. I'm excited to work alongside an organization that has a strong belief that female empowerment can act as a means to alleviate poverty. I will be joining a women's collective, photographing and building relationships, that will allow consumers to connect with the women artisans of 1000 Shillings.

I am looking forward to the opportunity to connect with a group of women who are trying to bring change to their community!

Please Visit www.1000shillings.com to see if you suppot the cause! The money raised will cover my travel and living expenses, and anything left over will be directly donated to the organization.




Thank you and Be Well!

Corinna

 

 

*photography and video courtesy of 1000Shillings

story:
UPDATE: Our expenses have changed and we can get by with $180. We've found a way to use the venue (Beacon Hill Light Rail Station) with special permission and so the cost is covered. Remaining costs are photography, wardrobe, models, and our publicist. Some of us are doing this for barter, or very little money.

Esther's previous 4 books can be found here: www.thedevicebook.com

So why should you donate to this campaign?

1) The money raised goes to local authors, models, and photographers.

2) The money raised (if enough) also goes to public transit, specifically Sound Transit.

3) You can get some nifty stuff: books, music, maybe even a hoverboard! The holidays are coming, and these gifts would warm the heart of your loved ones.

4) You deserve to have nifty stuff to "treat yo' self" with.

5) You maybe need something extra unique, like a make-up tutorial, choir class, deep breathing class, a song written ABOUT you (or a loved one), a poem/short story written ABOUT you (or a loved one). These could be amazing gifts, or things you need in your very own life.

***INDIEGOGO was chosen over KICKSTARTER for 2 reasons:

1) This isn't "all-or-nothing." Even if we raise just $40, we get to keep the funds and you get the nifty stuff I mentioned.

2) After the two week campaign is over, you can STILL donate afterward, and get nifty stuff.

story:
Los Angeles, CA Photography

www.1jameshuang.com/photo

I'm building my network in Los Angeles to photograph anyone and everyone from actors, models, artists, family portraits, gatherings, special events and special requests. So pick a perk and get me as your professional photographer for an hour or two. Or get me for a half or full day to photograph your special event. This campaign ends on Halloween night, but we can start shooting right away. The earlier you book me, the more scheduling options you will have. (All photos shown are by me, James Huang)

Improve your business with new professional photos. Or treat your family or friends to a fun personalized photo session. We can't only have cell phone selfies for the rest of our lives. If you want your image to really stand out, shoot with me.

What pics to shoot?

  • Actor Headshots - It's about that time folks. IMDb awaits.
  • Modeling Photos - Build your book with the photos YOU want.
  • Business Portraits - Anyone from realtors to chefs need profile pics.
  • Family Portraits - Frame worthy or Holiday cheesy - can be at your home.
  • Professional Groups or Musicians - Get the perfect image for your brand.
  • Live Events - Birthday, Showers, Gatherings, Film Sets, Premieres, etc.
  • Special Requests - Not to be used in my portfolio - You name it, I'll shoot it.
  • RETOUCHING INCLUDED on 4 pictures for free!

[CHECK OUT MORE PHOTO SAMPLES HERE] 

[CHECK OUT MY PHOTO SAMPLES HERE]

If you're seeing this then we likely know each other, so lets get shooting. But if we're not acquainted yet, please read on. Since 1997, I have worked professionally in front of and behind the camera in film, television, and print modeling, so I'm experienced, fun to work with, and I know what style of photos work in the industry. I can also bring out your best in personal photos, family portraits and capture all the right moments at events. www.1jameshuang.com/photo

James Huang Photography (1jameshuang) This is me:

    Photography is an extension of my current actors demo reels business which I've been doing for many years as a way to help my fellow actor by filming and/or editing performance reels. You'll see on my IMDb that I'm a very active filmmaker and have written and directed feature films and short films. My whole life has been dedicated to working in the arts and photography feels like a natural progression and extension of my career. To build my body of work, I am offering my photographic services as very inexpensive perks to you.

    Why I'm IndieGoGo-ing?

    • I'm not a novice, but I'm still working on my craft. I want to build my business and practice my photography with people I can feel comfortable with. I feel this model will ease the pressure of us working together and I hope to spread the word this way through my network of friends and referrals.
    • I will work my tail off to deliver fantastic photos. I'm establishing myself so you can be assured I'm going to do my best for you. Let's establish a working relationship together and continue to working in the future.
    • Photo gear is really expensive and I need to buy more. So I'm putting in the work to build my brand and expand my photo capabilities.

    Risks & Challenges

    • We're in this together. I'm nice, easy going, and very good at taking all kinds of photos. But everyone has their own idealized notion of photography. Let's talk about the looks you want to achieve and discuss how we can get the photos you want ahead of time.
    • I will do everything I can to ensure that you have great photos and a great experience. We're helping each other - Remember, this is IndieGoGo, not Groupon. Either way, you're getting a steal.
    • PRIVACY - I plan to include my best photos to build my professional portfolio on-line but I will NOT include a photo of you without your permission first. I will guarantee the safety of your images as it is in both of our best interest as professionals.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    • Please spread the word to people you know or surprise a friend by gifting them a perk.
    • Everyone needs photos - just maybe not right this minute. So book me now and schedule me later.
    • You can chip in a few bucks just to be super awesome or even get a link to your website on my photo website's 'Wall of Thanks' for $15 or $25.
    • Rent/ Buy/ Stream my feature film www.StartingFromScratchMovie.com

    I shoot with a Canon EOS 7D with a sweet 24-70mm f/2.8 L USM Lens (The world's sharpest zoom lens). Thanks for all your support!

story: I am raising money for funds to have the calendars printed. The photos have already been taken, I just need to have them produced. I want to start out printing 250 calendars because not only do I know multiple people who want copies, but the men in the photos have family and friends who also want copies. The photos feature men with beards who attend Texas State University. The purpose of doing this is it's a fun creative product that I know many women, and men, current students, alumni, and fans would love to own, and it's a great way to advertise myself as a photographer.

story:
My name is Marion Rinaldi, and I celebrate life through the lens of a camera.  This campaign is about creating a studio that will allow me to tell the story or the human spirit, and create an outlet for local artists to showcase their passions.

The City of Monticello is a little slice of Southern charm located in rural, middle Georgia.  Monticello and Jasper County are steeped in history, and the area is a popular tourist attraction with beautiful historic homes, stunning wildlife preserves, friendly home-town culture, and unique shopping on the picturesque Monticello square.  I believe that Monticello and Jasper County deserve the convenience of a professional photography studio, and that there is a great need for an outlet for the artistic talent found throughout the area.  I have a vision of creating a multi-function venue for promoting the talented local artists in Monticello.  We have painters, sculptors, quilters, wood workers, and so many more artists in other media that need a place to display and offer their work

My goal for this campaign is two fold:

First, I want to open a studio in Monticello that will make quality, professional photography services available in Jasper County.  I will offer individual, family, artistic, and business services to my clients in a friendly, creative, and comfortable setting.  

Additionally, I want to offer space for some of the talented, local artists in Monticello a place to promote their work.  The space that I am currently considering for a studio is very open and well-lit.  To begin with, I plan to host "Gallery Nights" in the studio where artists and authors may set up booths for their work, and visitors can enjoy an evening of local art, socializing, and refreshments.  Long-term, I hope to open a studio on the square that can house both my studio and a gallery so both can operate simultaneously.  

As you can see, donating to this campaign does not just benefit an individual trying to open a business.  In helping me to meet my fund-raising goal, you are helping me make a big step toward promoting the arts in Monticello and Jasper County.  

My goal is to raise $7,000 in 45 days.  This amount will allow me to purchase the equipment I need to begin shooting.  Following is an itemized list of the equipment and estimated costs (I am a bargain hunter.  If my campaign is successful, I will shop comparatively for the lowest cost of the item.):

1. Nikon D750 full-frame camera body  ($3,000)
2. 50 mm 1.8 Nikor Lens ($250)
3. 35 mm 1.8 Nikor Lens ($180)
4. MSI GP70 Laptop ($900)
5. Adobe Editing Software Subscription ($200)
6. Portable Lighting and Backdrops ($400)
7. Business license, permit, and insurance ($1,500)
8. Equipment Storage and Accessories ($500)

Any funds raised over the original goal will be put toward renting a temporary studio until downtown property can be obtained.

Don't forget- no contribution goes unnoticed!  See the available perks on the right panel of the page to see what you can receive for your contribution!

Please visit my blog at www.mrinaldiphotography.blogspot.com to learn more about me and keep up with my progress in making M. Rinaldi Photography a reality!  Thank you so much for your support!

story:
Summary

OneThink, a collective of six photography students at Edinburgh Napier University are putting on an exhibition at the incredibly unique Coburg House Art Gallery. This will run from the 2nd to the 9th of April, with an opening night on the 2nd. It would be our honour to offer free art work to the city of Edinburgh. However, we need a little help getting started.

Our name is based on the idea that our work will adhere to one idea, one meaning, ‘OneThink’, united by poetry. Living in the city of Edinburgh, we are constantly surrounded by wonderful literature. We have drawn inspiration from a poem by Shel Silverstein, A Light In The Attic.

There's a light on in the attic. 
Though the house is dark and shuttered, 
I can see a flickerin' flutter, 
And I know what it's about. 
There's a light on in the attic. 
I can see it from the outside. 
And I know you're on the inside... lookin' out. 

We felt this particular poem was short enough to hold the theme close in proximity to the possible meanings derived. Providing us creative freedom and inspiration while at the same time guiding us in a firm direction. This enabled us to independently explore our own creative minds, whilst the poem itself brings the work together. Further, this poem enabled us to combine the contextual and visual language of photography and poetry. We aim to each create our work by addressing one line of the poem, of which there are 7, with a repetition of one. Our individual interpretation will pay close attention to light, using this as a tool to create continuity and bind our work together.

You are able to find information about the individuals in this collective on our Facebook page, there you can see examples of our work.

https://www.facebook.com/OneThink-843795719070216/

What We Need & What You Get

We need funding to help us kick start our exhibition. Donations will cover costs of the venue, printing, framing and advertising. In addition to this, a number of us will be working with medium and large format film. Supporting this traditional way of making photographs unavoidably adds additional costs in the form of purchasing and processing the film.

We have a great list of perks available for a wide range of donation values. We want to remind you that every single donation, large or small, will help us a great amount.

The Impact

Art work being made available to the public is invaluable. Within this digital age, the photography industry is expanding like never before, with the majority of images being viewed on screens. This instantaneous way of viewing images encourages us to scroll past without taking the time to appreciate what the image is saying. 
We feel that it is extremely important to showcase the creative possibilities that occur when the lens, eye and mind work together. We aim to encourage people to reconnect with imagery out with the screen and experience images in a gallery environment.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that money can be tight. If you can't donate, simply getting the word out there would be a great help. Like and Share our page on Facebook and get chatting to everyone you know about the exciting collective that is OneThink. 

Also, make sure to come along to our exhibition. We can't wait to see you there!
story_txt:
Summary 
OneThink, a collective of six photography students at Edinburgh Napier University are putting on an exhibition at the incredibly unique Coburg House Art Gallery. This will run from the 2nd to the 9th of April, with an opening night on the 2nd. It would be our honour to offer free art work to the city of Edinburgh. However, we need a little help getting started.
Our name is based on the idea that our work will adhere to one idea, one meaning, ‘OneThink’, united by poetry. Living in the city of Edinburgh, we are constantly surrounded by wonderful literature. We have drawn inspiration from a poem by Shel Silverstein, A Light In The Attic.
There's a light on in the attic. Though the house is dark and shuttered, I can see a flickerin' flutter, And I know what it's about. There's a light on in the attic. I can see it from the outside. And I know you're on the inside... lookin' out. 
We felt this particular poem was short enough to hold the theme close in proximity to the possible meanings derived. Providing us creative freedom and inspiration while at the same time guiding us in a firm direction. This enabled us to independently explore our own creative minds, whilst the poem itself brings the work together. Further, this poem enabled us to combine the contextual and visual language of photography and poetry. We aim to each create our work by addressing one line of the poem, of which there are 7, with a repetition of one. Our individual interpretation will pay close attention to light, using this as a tool to create continuity and bind our work together.
You are able to find information about the individuals in this collective on our Facebook page, there you can see examples of our work.

https://www.facebook.com/OneThink-843795719070216/
What We Need & What You Get We need funding to help us kick start our exhibition. Donations will cover costs of the venue, printing, framing and advertising. In addition to this, a number of us will be working with medium and large format film. Supporting this traditional way of making photographs unavoidably adds additional costs in the form of purchasing and processing the film.
We have a great list of perks available for a wide range of donation values. We want to remind you that every single donation, large or small, will help us a great amount.
    The Impact
Art work being made available to the public is invaluable. Within this digital age, the photography industry is expanding like never before, with the majority of images being viewed on screens. This instantaneous way of viewing images encourages us to scroll past without taking the time to appreciate what the image is saying. 
We feel that it is extremely important to showcase the creative possibilities that occur when the lens, eye and mind work together. We aim to encourage people to reconnect with imagery out with the screen and experience images in a gallery environment.

    
Other Ways You Can Help

 We understand that money can be tight. If you can't donate, simply getting the word out there would be a great help. Like and Share our page on Facebook and get chatting to everyone you know about the exciting collective that is OneThink. 
Also, make sure to come along to our exhibition. We can't wait to see you there!

story:
About me
I am a photographer , director, actor, and aspiring playwright.

In early September of last year, I started having trouble with my vision. By the end of the month, I lost a majority of my sight. By the end of October, after various tests and diagnoses, it was deemed by my ophthalmologist that I was legally blind and would most likely remain as such for the rest of my life.

In two short month, I went from perfect vision and an active life to legally blind and severely limited in my ability to participate in life.

My sight is such that I can still function, but at a highly reduced capacity than I had been before the issues began. On many occasions, I need guidance with daily chores and while maneuvering away from home.

While seeking answers for what caused the blindness, it was discovered I have cancer. I was immediately thrust into a chemotherapy regiment, as well as two different treatments for my vision. The cancer will eventually be eradicated, but it is unknown at this time if it will return later in life. The vision treatments have guaranteed that I won't go completely blind, but it is unknown if the damage will be reversed. So I am expecting to live with low vision the rest of my life.

These changes have impacted my life immensely. I had to stop driving, quit my job, and give up my livelihoods of theatre and photography. In the months since I was presented with this life changing news, I have slowly learned to cope and regain some of the independence I lost, but I will never be without a need for assistance. It's been a slow journey the, but I am on the right path back to happiness.

Only recently have I dared try my hand at my former artist livelihood, as I adjust to the regiment of hospital visits and in-home treatments. With the patience of a friend  or family member at my side, I have been slowly getting back to photography. It's the one medium I feel moat comfortable returning to, and admittedly, the least likely choice. But it's one of the few things I find myself doing that keeps my mind of my health issues.


Why I am on Indiegogo
I had to leave my day job because of the vision loss. And now, between chemotherapy and the uncertainty of any vision improvement, returning to the work force is not an option for the time being. So I am without the stable income I was dependent to on to live and support my passion for the arts.

So I am turning to you, the folks who use and peruse Indiegogo, for assistance in regaining some normalcy in my life by contributing to my photography campaign and aiding me to once again be able to create art.

I am not seeking much. I'm only looking to raise enough funds to cover a few basic needs to make a return to taking photos.


What your donation will help me accomplish
A donation made to my campaign will ensure the following:

• Investment in a studio so I can work in a single, safe environment, rather than an outdoor location where I would be unsure of the terrain in which I am maneuvering. I can give all my focus to model work and still lifes, subjects I am looking to expand upon, rather than concentrating on where I am walking.

• Purchase much needed accessories such as: batteries, a remote flash and camera trigger, a light meter, lens cloths, and portable lights and backdrops should I need to work on location, amongst other things.

• Secure the domain name for my website so I can have a legitimate online portfolio to present when asked for examples of my work.

• Afford a much needed external hard drive to backup my work and not run the risk of losing anything should something happen to my computer.

• Cover rental costs for any location shoots I may want to book.


Thank you in advance
I very much appreciate you taking the time to look at my campaign. It would mean the world to me if I could return to doing something I loved before my life was put on hiatus. Please consider making a donation.
