story:
DAWSON VERNISSAGE 2014 

Our time of training and studying photography is coming to an end and we are celebrating with our graduating vernissage! We've spent numerous hours mastering lighting techniques, learning about our equipment and growing as artists.


This vernissage will be a celebration of our years of hard work and we would love to create a show that will make a terrific and memorable impression on all guests, from our family and friends to industry professionals.

 

We have made it our goal to raise a total of about $6500 to make our show memorable for the estimated 500 guests who will be present. This budget will be allocated to catering, drinks, exhibition and promotional material, and a promotional catalog of our work. Having raised half of our goal already through various fundraising efforts, we plan to promote and continue raising money with our Indiegogo campaign. 


Every dollar will help us put on our show! We have a gift to offer as a thank you to those who donate.

After you choose your perk we will send you an email to find out which print(s) you would like. 

PRINT PERK

To select your print go here: 

http://www.flickr.com/photos/dawsonvernissage2014

please take note that your print will not have a watermark on it. 

CATALOG

The catalog is a lasting collection of our work. It serves as an efficient way for each student to easily exhibit their work and allows others to appreciate the art. A majority of our budget is being allotted to this catalog that is high in quality and a lasting work of our art!

Other ways to support

To support us futhermore, please spread the word to your friends and family about our vernissage and our Indiegogo campaign as it is vital to our success!

Thank you !

HOW TO DONATE

If you already have a Paypal account you may use it as usual by following the steps after you click "contribute!"

If you do not have a Paypal account, you will be asked whether or not you would like to create one after you click "contribute." First, you will be asked how much you want to donate and whether you want to claim a perk:

You will then be directed to Paypal by Indiegogo where you can choose to pay by credit card (instead of logging into/creating a Paypal account). Enter your information as you normally would when checking out online. If you choose not to create a Paypal account, you are essentially making a guest Paypal appearance! Your payment is being safely directed through Paypal, but you will not hold an official account.


If you need help, don't hesitate to contact us at dawsongrads2014@gmail.com

Other instructions and general information about Paypal here -->https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=xpt/Help/general/TopQuestion2-outside

.....................................

DAWSON VERNISSAGE 2014

Notre formation d'étude de la photographie professionnelle tire à sa fin et nous voulons celebrer avec un vernissage de gradués ! Nous avons passé de nombreuses heures à maîtriser des techniques d'éclairage, à apprendre sur l'équipement photographique et à s'épanouir en tant qu'artiste. 

Ce vernissage sera une célébration a l'aboutissement de trois anneés de dur labeur et nous aimerions créer un evenement qui laissera une impression admirable et mémorable auprès de tous les invités, nos familles, nos amis et les professionnels de l'industrie. Nous avons etabli un objectif d'amasser un total d'environ 6500 $ pour faire de notre evenement un succes pour nous et les quelque 500 invités qui seront présents.

 Ce budget sera alloué pour la nourriture et les boissons, l'exposition des photos, le matériel et un catalogue promotionnels de notre travail . Après avoir atteint la moitié de notre objectif grâce à divers efforts de financement , nous avons l'intention de promouvoir et de poursuivre la collecte de fonds avec notre campagne Indiegogo . 

Chaque dollar va nous aider à mettre sur pied notre vernissage! En guise de remerciement pour vos dons, nous vous offrons:

 - Une image imprimée de votre choix 

Pour choisir votre image rendez-vous ici : 

http://www.flickr.com/photos/dawsonvernissage2014

Veuillez prendre note qu'aucun filigrane n'apparaîtra sur votre impression finale. Après avoir choisi votre present, nous vous enverrons un e-mail pour que vous puissiez choisir quelle copie(s) que vous souhaitez .


CATALOGUE

Le catalogue est une collection durable de notre travail . C'est une plateforme efficace pour chaque élève qui permet d'exposer facilement leur travail et à d'autres d'apprécier notre art. La majorité de notre budget est alloué à ce catalogue de grande qualité et un témoignage durable de notre art. 

Pour nous soutenir d'avantage, s'il vous plaît, passez le mot à vos amis et famille au sujet de notre vernissage et de notre campagne INDIEGOGO car ils sont essentiels à notre succès ! Un gros merci de notre part à tous !

COMMENT FAIRE UN DON : 

 Si vous possédez déjà un compte Paypal, vous pouvez l'utiliser et suivre les étapes après avoir cliquer sur "Contribuer!" Si vous ne possédez pas de compte Paypal, il vous sera demander si vous voulez en créer un après avoir cliquer sur "Contribuer!". 

Premièrement, il vous sera demander combien vous voulez donner et si vous voulez demander un présent: 

 Vous allez, par la suite, être dirigé vers Paypal par Indiegogo où vous allez pouvoir choisir de payer par carte de crédit (plutôt que de créer un compte Paypal). 

Entrez vos informations comme vous le feriez lors d'un achat en ligne. Si vous choisissez de ne pas créer un compte Paypal, vous êtes un client Paypal par apparence!

 Votre paiement sera dirigé en toute sécurité grâce à Paypal, mais vous ne serez pas titulaire d'un compte officiel. 

 Si vous avez besoin d'aide, n'hésitez pas à nous contacter par e-mail : dawsongrads2014@gmail.com 

Si vous voulez d'autre instructions ou d'autre informations générales en lien avec Paypal, cliquez ici --> https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=xpt/Help/general/TopQuestion2-outside

story:
Uryaen, photograper founder of uryaen.com is doing an EPIC Sucker Punch Cosplay Shoot. 

This photography shoot will involve the following characters: 

Babydoll - played by Elora, the model you see in the picture above 

Sweet Pea - Played by Abby

Rocket - Played by TBD 

Amber - Played by Lin 

Blondie - Played by TBD but tentatively filled

Here, "TBD" means that I have at least a few candidates but I may not have chosen the final casting yet. Rest assured there are several viable candidates for these roles, and I'm in the process of test shooting and choosing the final one. 

Depending on the level of funding the project receives, I may add the Wise Man and other bonuses. 

As you can see above, I have already cast the two most difficult parts to fill. I've done extensive test shooting with my "Babydoll" and some test shooting with "Amber". I'm fully confident that I will cast the remaining three in time to do the shoot and fill the perks. If I have to, I can always import models from anywhere, should the stretch goals get high enough. We'll explore that later. 

I'll be adding images from the first Babydoll test shoot really soon, but wanted to go ahead and get this launched now. 

For a special look at the first test shoot, see the images below, or find the full size images on my site at www.uryaen.com. 

This shoot will happen even if the project isn't funded. How many projects promise you that? The main difference is whether we get to see some of neat upgrades to it that I have planned, and the perks. So pledge with confidence! This is purely a fun project, and not a "for profit" project. No images are being sold. Pledges go into materials, paying models, and renting space and equipment and fulfilling perks. 

The output of this project is a set of high quality, stylized images, and a brief video featuring the models in motion. No copyrighted music will be used in this video, so sorry, no soundtrack music from the movie.

I'm starting this thing off extremely modest, and as Indiegogo takes a good chunk as do perks, all perks will be modest unless the project is funded beyond 100%. 

Who is Uryaen?

Qualifications include:

  • Experience with video game design, web design, and software development.
  • Experience in product evaluation, with an emphasis on technology such as computer parts.
  • Published writer since 1989, with articles in national print magazines as recently as 2010. ( HD3D article in GameFan Magazine, PDF available )
  • Photography, videography, visual effects ( movies ) and photo manipulation.
  • Recognized expert and contributor to the toy industry, with a line of custom Nerf Guns on a separate blog with 57k views and my own entry on the worlds most viewed toy blog.
  • For a real world view of my varied abilities, look no further than uryaen.com itself.

uryaen.com and Indiegogo: 

uryaen.com is hoping Indiegogo users will love the idea enough to fund the various levels of perks we have planned. We'll go over that in a moment, but first; let's break down how funds are to be used.

How Funds are used:

All funds go directly into the acquisition of costumes, which are being designed and created especially for me, the studio rental space, paying Make Up Artists, possibly paying the models if we get enough, and some extra materials and supplies this shoot needs. The more we get, the better the props, etc!

The project as set up will fund the perks for the shoot, and that's pretty much it. I'm keeping the perk levels fairly modest, but if we go levels above that, I'll offer new, higher tier perks!

What if we go above the 100% goal?

Might as well answer this here. For additional funding, which I highly encourage, we'll have the chance to do a number of things:

  • Pay the models, because they deserve it!
  • Pay an additional Make up or hair artist or two, to add to the overall quality level of the shoot.
  • Purchase additional quality props like swords and guns and the other crafted bits that make it more special.
  • Possibly higher quality lenses, and lighting gear, sky is the limit!
  • Higher tier perks .
  • Possibly other bonuses, let's see how it goes. 

Perks 

The fun stuff!

The perks section isn't big enough to hold all of the goodness we're offering, so here is a breakdown of the actual perks , including the truly special stuff for the big pledges:

Perk Level $1

You get to be part of the project and I'll send you an email the moment the image set is released online. You'll get to be among the first to view them!

Perk Level $5

A download link to the full set of images. I'll be releasing a set of images for free online but only pledges this tier and above get the full set. I promise there will be some nice exclusives in there. 

Perk Level $25

Access to an exclusive "Extended Edition" video, with extra material not seen in the released version.

If the project meets the $2500 mark, I'll add a "Behind the Scenes" sequence filmed by a second production shooter, complete with Make up, bloopers, set up, and other surprises. This tier will gain access to this video.

Perk Level $75

For this tier, I will do a short run of 8.5x11 or so prints, and have a model sign one. You will receive this print once everything is produced, and I can schedule the model to sign it. Prints will be on basic photo paper. If higher tiers of funding are achieved, I will look into higher quality prints. 

I'm limiting the run of these to add to their exclusivity. There will ONLY be ONE image of a solo model per model and ONE set of all five in a run of five. That's a total of TEN printed and signed photos so get there fast!

Which image will you get? Sorry, that's for me to decide. 

Shipping is extra, as I cannot control where the perk goes and final shipping cost to be determined by print size.   

Perk Level $250

For this tier, I will do a short run of 8.5x11 or so prints, and have all five models sign each. You will receive this print once everything is produced, and I can schedule the models to sign it. If higher tiers of funding are achieved, I will look into higher quality prints. 

I'm limiting the run of these to add to their exclusivity. There will ONLY be ONE set of all five in a run of ten. That's a total of TEN printed and signed photos so get there fast! This set is unique from the previous set. 

Which image will you get? Sorry, that's for me to decide. 

Shipping is extra, as I cannot control where the perk goes and final shipping cost to be determined by print size.

Perk Level $250 International and Digital Friendly Package

Want something special but don't want to bother with shipping? For this tier, I will do a special set of images and a video with Backer Only content. You get everything in the lower tiers, as far as exclusive images, and you get a special thank you video from all of us

Stretch Goals!!

I'm starting small, but here is how I see the breakdown if new tiers of funding are achieved:

If funding reaches:

$1250

I will add a real replica Babydoll sword, instead of the plastic one we're currently set to use.

$1500

I will rent a higher quality, low F-Stop lens, to increase the quality of the shoot.

I will add a few bits and pieces to the costumes to increase accuracy.

I will add a second MUA ( Make Up Artist ) to increase the quality of the shoot. 

$2500

I will hire a second video shooter to document parts of the shoot, including Make up, behind the shooting, bloopers, etc. 

A new Perk bonus will be added for $25 and above perk tiers to access this content.

To put this in perspective, this stretch goal only requires 60 $25 backers to hit. We can do that! We can do better than that!

$5000

If the project really takes off, I'll add a second day of shooting, on location outside, for some action shots and video sequences in full costume. 

I will add a new perk tier - $500, and those backers will receive ONE piece of the props. This may include goggles, fake lollipop, or whatever other bits we have. This will NOT include the weapons, as there may be shipping regulations to worry about, or the costumes. This tier will be extremely limited, and may go FAST. 

I will also add an additional bonus pay to each model, because they work hard. Don't worry, it'll be worth their time. 

$10000

For this tier, I'll do one additional day of shooting, and add a new HIGHLY exclusive perk tier: $1000. For this plus shipping, I will send you one randomly selected full backup costume from the shoot. This costume will not have been worn, as that would be inappropriate, but it will be an exact duplicate of one of our costumes. 

Shipping will be extra and TBD.

At this tier I'll be able to hugely increase the overall quality of the lighting by using a full set of Paul C Buff lights. 

Depending on costume and model availability, I might be able to do a Wise Man or maybe Steampunk Nazi's. If things get higher, I'll just keep adding content!! 

I may have some other surprises up my sleeve if we hit this stretch goal. 

Can there be stretch goals beyond this? You bet. I have many ideas, ( better lighting, additional characters from the movie ) but let's hit this one before we really talk about those . . .

Conclusion

Thank you for viewing, and if you think it's a great idea, toss in a few bucks. If this thing takes off, I'll update with possible new tiers and perks.

Experience with video game design, web design, and software development.
Experience in product evaluation, with an emphasis on technology such as computer parts.
Published writer since 1989, with articles in national print magazines as recently as 2010. ( HD3D article in GameFan Magazine, PDF available )
Photography, videography, visual effects ( movies ) and photo manipulation.
Recognized expert and contributor to the toy industry, with a line of custom Nerf Guns on a separate blog with 57k views and my own entry on the worlds most viewed toy blog.
For a real world view of my varied abilities, look no further than uryaen.com itself.

uryaen.com and Indiegogo: 
uryaen.com is hoping Indiegogo users will love the idea enough to fund the various levels of perks we have planned. We'll go over that in a moment, but first; let's break down how funds are to be used.
How Funds are used:
All funds go directly into the acquisition of costumes, which are being designed and created especially for me, the studio rental space, paying Make Up Artists, possibly paying the models if we get enough, and some extra materials and supplies this shoot needs. The more we get, the better the props, etc!
The project as set up will fund the perks for the shoot, and that's pretty much it. I'm keeping the perk levels fairly modest, but if we go levels above that, I'll offer new, higher tier perks!
What if we go above the 100% goal?
Might as well answer this here. For additional funding, which I highly encourage, we'll have the chance to do a number of things:

Pay the models, because they deserve it!
Pay an additional Make up or hair artist or two, to add to the overall quality level of the shoot.
Purchase additional quality props like swords and guns and the other crafted bits that make it more special.
Possibly higher quality lenses, and lighting gear, sky is the limit!
Higher tier perks .
Possibly other bonuses, let's see how it goes. 


Perks 
The fun stuff!
The perks section isn't big enough to hold all of the goodness we're offering, so here is a breakdown of the actual perks , including the truly special stuff for the big pledges:
Perk Level $1
You get to be part of the project and I'll send you an email the moment the image set is released online. You'll get to be among the first to view them!
Perk Level $5
A download link to the full set of images. I'll be releasing a set of images for free online but only pledges this tier and above get the full set. I promise there will be some nice exclusives in there. 
Perk Level $25
Access to an exclusive "Extended Edition" video, with extra material not seen in the released version.
If the project meets the $2500 mark, I'll add a "Behind the Scenes" sequence filmed by a second production shooter, complete with Make up, bloopers, set up, and other surprises. This tier will gain access to this video.
Perk Level $75
For this tier, I will do a short run of 8.5x11 or so prints, and have a model sign one. You will receive this print once everything is produced, and I can schedule the model to sign it. Prints will be on basic photo paper. If higher tiers of funding are achieved, I will look into higher quality prints. 
I'm limiting the run of these to add to their exclusivity. There will ONLY be ONE image of a solo model per model and ONE set of all five in a run of five. That's a total of TEN printed and signed photos so get there fast!
Which image will you get? Sorry, that's for me to decide. 
Shipping is extra, as I cannot control where the perk goes and final shipping cost to be determined by print size.   
Perk Level $250
For this tier, I will do a short run of 8.5x11 or so prints, and have all five models sign each. You will receive this print once everything is produced, and I can schedule the models to sign it. If higher tiers of funding are achieved, I will look into higher quality prints. 
I'm limiting the run of these to add to their exclusivity. There will ONLY be ONE set of all five in a run of ten. That's a total of TEN printed and signed photos so get there fast! This set is unique from the previous set. 
Which image will you get? Sorry, that's for me to decide. 
Shipping is extra, as I cannot control where the perk goes and final shipping cost to be determined by print size.
Perk Level $250 International and Digital Friendly Package
Want something special but don't want to bother with shipping? For this tier, I will do a special set of images and a video with Backer Only content. You get everything in the lower tiers, as far as exclusive images, and you get a special thank you video from all of us
Stretch Goals!!
I'm starting small, but here is how I see the breakdown if new tiers of funding are achieved:
If funding reaches:
$1250
I will add a real replica Babydoll sword, instead of the plastic one we're currently set to use.
$1500
I will rent a higher quality, low F-Stop lens, to increase the quality of the shoot.
I will add a few bits and pieces to the costumes to increase accuracy.
I will add a second MUA ( Make Up Artist ) to increase the quality of the shoot. 
$2500
I will hire a second video shooter to document parts of the shoot, including Make up, behind the shooting, bloopers, etc. 
A new Perk bonus will be added for $25 and above perk tiers to access this content.
To put this in perspective, this stretch goal only requires 60 $25 backers to hit. We can do that! We can do better than that!
$5000
If the project really takes off, I'll add a second day of shooting, on location outside, for some action shots and video sequences in full costume. 
I will add a new perk tier - $500, and those backers will receive ONE piece of the props. This may include goggles, fake lollipop, or whatever other bits we have. This will NOT include the weapons, as there may be shipping regulations to worry about, or the costumes. This tier will be extremely limited, and may go FAST. 
I will also add an additional bonus pay to each model, because they work hard. Don't worry, it'll be worth their time. 
$10000
For this tier, I'll do one additional day of shooting, and add a new HIGHLY exclusive perk tier: $1000. For this plus shipping, I will send you one randomly selected full backup costume from the shoot. This costume will not have been worn, as that would be inappropriate, but it will be an exact duplicate of one of our costumes. 
Shipping will be extra and TBD.
At this tier I'll be able to hugely increase the overall quality of the lighting by using a full set of Paul C Buff lights. 
Depending on costume and model availability, I might be able to do a Wise Man or maybe Steampunk Nazi's. If things get higher, I'll just keep adding content!! 
I may have some other surprises up my sleeve if we hit this stretch goal. 
Can there be stretch goals beyond this? You bet. I have many ideas, ( better lighting, additional characters from the movie ) but let's hit this one before we really talk about those . . .
Conclusion
Thank you for viewing, and if you think it's a great idea, toss in a few bucks. If this thing takes off, I'll update with possible new tiers and perks.

story:
Short Summary

Our Photo Club has been active for three years and our students are very passionate about supporting our school (through yearbook and events), our local community (photographing community service events (feeding the homeless, vistiting elderly homes etc.).  I have taken the photo club on field trips to Unversal Studios backlot, the beach (which some of our students had never been to before!), and well known Photographer's studios.  Having additional equipment will allow each student to particiapte more, taking additional pride in the great technical and creative skills they are mastering, as well as enjoying the product, great pictures!

 

What We Need & What You Get:

  • $762
  • For: Rebel Canon, tripod, memory card
  • We need 2 more Rebel Canon cameras to support the many regular day events/multi media that our club supports but also to support student creativity and involvement. With the Rebel T1i, students will also be able to film, allowing us to expand our program to offer film club as well.  In addition to the Canon cameras, this 762 dollars will go towards Sandisk memory sticks and a tripod.  Thank you for your help.

  • The Impact

Along with increasing the creative and technical skills of our students and allowing them more capability to support our school events and community events, we will be creating a book entitled "Our Beautiful Struggle" which highlights the work of our students over the past three years, and proceeds will go to buying college text books for our alumni who exhibit finincial need and were photo club members.

Other Ways You Can Help

We can also use more used equipment such as cameras, lights, back drops, c stands, image software etc. NBC Universal Studios donated a Canon to us in January, how generous! 

 

Thank you for chanigng the lives of our talented students in south central LA, and for helping them to share their gift and their photo stories wiht the world!

story:
THE IDEA:

The Shot I Never Forgot is a new group exhibition, featuring over 25 Photographers and being shown for the first time as part of the Brighton Photo Fringe 2014.

The participating photographers were asked to think about an image that  they have never published or exhibited before and might have sat untouched for some time, but has remained in their mind since they shot it.

Most of the artists instinctively knew which image they should share because it was poignant or held some personal significance.

Most of us shoot many more images than ever see the light of day, often including fabulous standalone pictures, shot on instinct, whilst making work for another project. Because these single images do not fit the theme, they sit gathering dust in the archive.

The Shot I Never Forgot is a chance for some of these images to stand alone, in their own right, for others to enjoy. This is a chance to see some of these photographers most memorable images exhibited for the first time.

In order to put on this fantastic exhibition we need some help towards the costs of organising it.

WHY WE NEED HELP:

We are looking to raise at least £750, which is the minimum amount needed to put on the exhibition, however, the more we can raise the better show we can put on.

Our ideal target would be to get over £1000 - the more we can raise the more we can do!

The money is needed to pay for;

- Printing and mounting of images
- Marketing and publicity of the exhibition
- Materials to covert the space into a temporary gallery
- Help towards the costs of running workshops for students during the festival
- If we can raise enough money a freely distributed newspaper of the images would   accompany the exhibition.

    OUR IMPACT:

    The Brighton Photo Fringe is one of the biggest photography festivals in the country.

    This is set to be one of the highlight exhibitions of this years event with over 25 photographers showing a previously unseen image that holds a personal significance to them.

    The exhibition is being arranged to share these fabulous images that might otherwise go forgotten as well as provide a platform for the Photographers to show work at the festival in a fully collaborative and democratic way.

    Our ambitions are high and there is an active Arts Council funding application going through the assessment stages.  The more money we raise, the bigger and better the exhibition can be - with more photographers participating, workshops for students alongside the exhibition and a freely distributed newspaper publication.


      This will be a fantastic exhibition no matter what the budget we have to spend on it and it will be freely open to the public.  

      The exhibition venue has been freely donated and is a perfect space - we would love to do the photographs justice by raising the funds to print and mount them to a high standard and make this an really exciting exhibition and a highlight of the Photo Fringe 2014.


        Thank you for any help you might be willing to provide.

story:
Have you every looked at a turd and thought "Wow!  That looks just like a bratwurst!"?  No? You haven't? Really!?!?  Well we have!  And because we're a little bit not right, we took that turd, put it on a bun and served it up with a beer for the month of September.  Get your copy to see the rest of the year!

What's this all about?

This all began over 15 years ago with two best friends and a little dog named Jake, who's turds looked like breakfast sausage.  One day, while on a road trip, the two friends came up with an idea to, just for a goof, prepare a special breakfast of eggs, bacon, toast and "sausage", take a picture and send it to a sister.  Well the sister thought it was hilarious, and the idea for a calendar full of poop on a plate was born!  We kicked it around for more than 15 years and finally decided that, at the end of the day, it's darned funny and that we should share it with the rest of the world. 

Who are we?

We're just two middle-aged women who still find poop funny.  Fortunately, one of us married a professional photographer who also thinks poop is hilarious.  Together, the three of us have created a full year of mouth-watering photographs and assembled them into this beautiful calendar.

While we'd really love for our children to inherit a fortune built on a poop empire ('cuz...American dream, right?), we're really only trying to see this years-long idea through and share it with all of you who appreciate a little silly humor.

But...WHY?

There really is no good reason, except that it's just funny.  Here's a list of some of the people who have said so:

  • Farmer Joe
  • The lady at the county clerks office who helped us get a business license
  • The woman at the post office who helped us set up our P.O. Box
  • My cousin Cheri
  • Ramona from work
  • The nice guys at the box store who helped us sort out our shipping needs
  • Kate's mom

For the sake of presenting both sides...the following people do NOT think it's funny at all:

  • The lady at the bank who opened our business account
  • Every telemarketer who calls us and has to say the business name out loud
  • Tim

*Kimberly's dad is on the fence, but he's leaning toward funny.

We Do Have Standards

Here are a few important facts you should know:

  1. We ONLY use animal poop.  Human poop will NEVER be an option. 
  2. That's gross.No animals are EVER harmed in the production of this calendar.
  3. We do not modify the specimens in any way.  We use it as we find it, with the exception of occasionally slicing it.
  4. No Mom, you can NOT send us homemade samples.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $2500 for the initial print run of the calendar.  For being one of our backers, you'll get a great deal on your very own copy!  This is a time-sensitive project, as we need to be able to start shipping in November to make sure you have them in time for the holidays and the new year.

  • All funds raised will be put toward printing and shipping costs.
  • Exciting perks and deals for helping us out!
  • If we don't reach our goal...you will still get your calendar!  If we exceed our goal, we'll print more calendars and start working on the 2018 edition.  We also have a greeting card line in the works!

Risks & Challenges

There really are no risks to you.  It's simple.  You donate, we send you your stuff. 

As far as challenges, we have already overcome all of those.  For example, there was a really mean duck at the farm that did NOT want us near the poop.  We won...with no harm to the duck, but it was definitely a challenge.  You may not realize all that went into this project.  For example, where does one get all that poop?  Have you ever thought about where it would be stored until the photo shoot?  How about not gagging as you serve it up?  What happens when you can't find any rubber gloves and the perfect turd is right there...just daring you?  How do you ever eat spaghetti again after that?

"Be careful out there today girls.  I've been seeing a lot of snakes in the pasture lately." - Farmer Joe

We have happily already faced every challenge imaginable to bring you the 2017 Poop Calendar!  All you have to do is sit back and enjoy!  (Oh, and donate)

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute right now, please help us out by telling all your friends, sharing our campaign on social media and go like our Facebook page - The Poop Artist

"Be careful out there today girls.  I've been seeing a lot of snakes in the pasture lately." - Farmer Joe
We have happily already faced every challenge imaginable to bring you the 2017 Poop Calendar!  All you have to do is sit back and enjoy!  (Oh, and donate)

If you can't contribute right now, please help us out by telling all your friends, sharing our campaign on social media and go like our Facebook page - The Poop Artist

story:
HELLO FRIENDS. I am reaching out to my community of dreamers, makers, advocates, and wild-hearted humans who believe as I do, that whatever makes your life beautiful, is essential. Please share this with the people in your world too. I am so grateful for your support.

 

story. 

Photography is a memorial art, retelling our stories and framing our joys and our losses. I want my images to be an honest account of the imperfect perfectness, the letting go, the yes of it all. The forever of a single moment. An act of love.

In the hurriedness of my days, I am attempting what feels like the impossible - to show up for my life and for my craft in a new way.

your gift.

My business has grown a lot in the last few years, but I have been limited by not having the capital to build an infrastructure (a foundation of using the right technology, in the right moment, in the right space, with resources available to me when I need them),  or to invest in the equipment that I need to truly grow into the photographer that I hope to be (a faster camera, lenses that allow me flexibility and balance in my shooting, and other equipment that will mean more creative freedom). 

Your support will allow my business to thrive, to have continuity, to further partner with individuals, educators and organizations that are doing amazing things in this world, and identify ways to give back to the communities that I work with. 

Please note that any amount at all can be given. It does not need to be the amount listed under the perks section. 

the impact.

I want and need the work that I do, with both children and adults, to cultivate connection, and a sense of self-acceptance and self-sanctuary. The impact of your contribution is sharing in that truth. When I give back, it is the people who supported me during this journey giving back too. Thank you so much.

story:
Get a 'Porthread', your personal thread portrait!

Give me some clues of what you are like, your basic physical and emotional characteristics and I will try to create a photographic fine art thread portrait inspired and dedicated to you, titled under your name!

Brand new campaign! Please spread the word and help me go on!

Read the full story:

The motive: Education + Art = A better world!

Hi there, my name is Konstans and I am a passionate fine art photographer and video artist.

I strongly believe that education and arts could make the difference in this world: well educated people owe the privilege of knowledge, awareness, the ability to understand and decide what is the best for the society and themselves while art gives a great sense of aesthetics, opens people minds and increase the sensitivity to  different social and personal issues.

As an artist I feel very keen to deal with important issues concerning human beings, their behavior, their attitude and how this is developed, the diversity that we face among people and above all to communicate the idea of  respect to human life, personality and choices.

The Artwork: Respect diversity

The award winning (IPA - International Photo Awards 2013) project that I present here called "The unique complexity of being" is an effort to communicate the idea that although people are made of the same material they can be so different and complicated in so many ways.

The concept: A simple thread as an expressive means

A simple thread represents the common material that all human beings are made of and share while the infinite ways of forming the thread represent the infinite ways of personal development as a member of a society and the huge diversity that we have to face, accept and respect.

The medium: B&W medium format photography

To enhance the artistic result I use a RZ Mamiya medium format analog photo camera that enables me to create the sense of depth with blurred, focused, light and dark areas, as this happens with humans having secret, confused, forgotten or aware aspects of their personality.


Campaign aim - Give me a chance to express the idea!

My aim is to create hopefully 30 thread portraits inspired by YOU and exhibit the project to the public communicating the idea of diversity among the human beings and how this is an issue to respect.
The exhibition will take place on March in Athens Greece hoping to move later to Berlin.


"The unique complexity of being" - International Photography Awards 2013
http://www.photoawards.com/en/Pages/Gallery/zoomwin.php?eid=8-58135-13&uid=79646&code=Abstract


"The unique complexity of being" Featured in Zealous X exhibition - London
100 creatives, 35  live acts, 1 venue, 4 epic days
http://blog.zealous.co/blog/company-2/zealous-x/introduction-zealous-x/


Get a 'Porthread', your personal thread portrait!

If you like my project and wish to support me and my partners let me create your portrait as a thread!
Give me some clues of what you are like, your basic physical and emotional characteristics and I will try to create a photographic fine art thread portrait inspired and dedicated to you, titled under your name! You will also receive a 40cm x 40cm  fine art print of your portrait.
Your personal portrait will carry your name in any exhibition or other artistic event that will appear!

GREAT PRESENT IDEA!
Dedicated to your beloved persons: Let me create your partner's, friend's, relative's thread portrait inspired and dedicated to her/him under hers/his name and offer it as a present! Wouldn't it the perfect gift?

Unique perks for you!

If you wish to contribute to this project in some other way than your personal portrait, please check the rest of my perks and consider supporting me in order to continue and fulfill my project:

- Get digital PDF with porthread collection and special dedication to you!
- Get fine art porthread photo prints for your collection or your wall with special dedication to you plus invitation to the exhibition!
- COLLECTIBLE: Receive a signed and numbered porthread collection for your art collection!
- Get your personal or your beloved person's personal porthread titled under your name!
- COLLECTIBLE: Get your personal or your beloved person's personal porthread and receive limited edition archival fine art print!


The amount I ask will enable me to purchase all needed material for shooting (analog medium format films - development and printing material), to prepare the artworks for the exhibition (printing - framing), arrange all expenses for the event and of course to cover the expenses for creating and posting your perks to you!
Above all it will give me the opportunity to devote all my energy and creativity on the project, do something meaningful and satisfy my supporters!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please, if you like my project let the world know about my campaign! It would be very helpful!

You can always use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you very much! You are the best!

Konstans
story_txt:
Get a 'Porthread', your personal thread portrait!Give me some clues of what you are like, your basic physical and 
emotional characteristics and I will try to create a photographic fine art thread portrait 
inspired and dedicated to you, titled under your name!Brand new campaign! Please  spread the word and help me go on!Read the full story:
The motive: Education + Art = A better world!Hi there, my name is Konstans and I am a passionate fine art photographer and video artist. I strongly believe that education and arts could make the difference in this world: well educated people owe the privilege of knowledge, awareness, the ability to understand and decide what is the best for the society and themselves while art gives a great sense of aesthetics, opens people minds and increase the sensitivity to  different social and personal issues.As an artist I feel very keen to deal with important issues concerning human beings, their behavior, their attitude and how this is developed, the diversity that we face among people and above all to communicate the idea of  respect to human life, personality and choices.The Artwork: Respect diversityThe award winning (IPA - International Photo Awards 2013) project that I present here called "The unique complexity of being" is an effort to communicate the idea that although people are made of the same material they can be so different and complicated in so many ways.
The concept: A simple thread as an expressive meansA simple thread represents the common material that all human beings are made of and share while the infinite ways of forming the thread represent the infinite ways of personal development as a member of a society and the huge diversity that we have to face, accept and respect. The medium: B&W medium format photographyTo enhance the artistic result I use a RZ Mamiya medium format analog photo camera that enables me to create the sense of depth with blurred, focused, light and dark areas, as this happens with humans having secret, confused, forgotten or aware aspects of their personality.
Campaign aim - Give me a chance to express the idea!
My aim is to create hopefully 30 thread portraits inspired by YOU and exhibit the project to the public communicating the idea of diversity among the human beings and how this is an issue to respect.The exhibition will take place on March in Athens Greece hoping to move later to Berlin."The unique complexity of being" - International Photography Awards 2013 http://www.photoawards.com/en/Pages/Gallery/zoomwin.php?eid=8-58135-13&uid=79646&code=Abstract "The unique complexity of being" Featured in Zealous X exhibition - London100 creatives, 35  live acts, 1 venue, 4 epic dayshttp://blog.zealous.co/blog/company-2/zealous-x/introduction-zealous-x/Get a 'Porthread', your personal thread portrait!If you like my project and wish to support me and my partners let me create your portrait as a thread! Give me some clues of what you are like, your basic physical and emotional characteristics and I will try to create a photographic fine art thread portrait inspired and dedicated to you, titled under your name! You will also receive a 40cm x 40cm  fine art print of your portrait.Your personal portrait will carry your name in any exhibition or other artistic event that will appear!GREAT PRESENT IDEA!Dedicated to your beloved persons: Let me create your partner's, friend's, relative's thread portrait inspired and dedicated to her/him under hers/his name and offer it as a present! Wouldn't it the perfect gift?Unique perks for you!If you wish to contribute to this project in some other way than your personal portrait, please check the rest of my perks and consider supporting me in order to continue and fulfill my project:- Get digital PDF with porthread collection and special dedication to you!- Get fine art porthread photo prints for your collection or your wall with special dedication to you plus invitation to the exhibition!- COLLECTIBLE: Receive a signed and numbered porthread collection for your art collection!- Get your personal or your beloved person's personal porthread  titled under your name!- COLLECTIBLE: Get your personal or your beloved person's personal porthread and receive limited edition archival fine art print!The amount I ask will enable me to purchase all needed material for shooting (analog medium format films - development and printing material), to prepare the artworks for the exhibition (printing - framing), arrange all expenses for the event and of course to cover the expenses for creating and posting your perks to you!Above all it will give me the opportunity to devote all my energy and creativity on the project, do something meaningful and satisfy my supporters! Other Ways You Can HelpPlease, if you like my project let the world know about my campaign! It would be very helpful!You can always use the Indiegogo share tools! Thank you very much! You are the best!
Konstans

story:
Die Fotografie eine Leidenschaft!

Hallo ich bin Happy Berry und bereits 23 Jahre alt und komme aus Leipzig , ja aus dem wundervollen Leipzig wo auch die Buchmesse ihr Zuhause hat.

Da fing damals alles an .. ja die Buchmesse , damals war ich noch Cosplayerin und locker 50 Kilo leichter xD ich liebte es vor der Kamera zu stehen und mich Ablichten zulassen .. nur merkte ich schnell das die damaligen Fotografen nichts auf dem Kasten hatten und sich einen " Dreck" um ihre Modele gekümmert hatten ... nach ein paar Jahren und einer Freundin die ich wirklich oft damals "Geknipst " hatte , sagte sie mir ... das ich echt paar gute Winkel drauf habe und auf die kleinsten dinge achte und da fing ich an das Cosplayen an den Nagel zu hängen und mein Herz endgültig der Fotografie  zu schenken.

Was alles so leicht klingt und alles so schnell ... naja das dauerte gut 4 Jahre bis ich mich dazu entschloss eine bessere Kamera zu Kaufen .

Ich hatte allerdings nie viel Geld und naja meine familiären Umstände waren nie so gut. Ich musste eine menge Steine aus dem Weg Räumen um an eine ordentliche Kamera zu kommen und um meinem Traum " Ich will die allerbeste sein..." ein bisschen näher zu kommen.

Darauf folgte ein Jahr im Üben, jeden Menschen vor die Kamera zu ziehen, wieder viele Menschen von denen ich Hass abbekam und abneigung.. Viele Freunde gingen neue freunde kamen. Wieder viele Steine und Geröll aus dem Weg räumen um das zu tun was ich so Liebte und das mir half mit meinen Problemen klar zu kommen.. es lenkte mich ab , ich versteckte mich hinter der Kamera , hinter dem Namen "Happy Berry" , mitlerweile.. ist es nicht mehr nur ein Name .. Mittlerweile kennt man mich und das war wirklich nicht Leicht., mittlerweile bin ich in der Ausbildung zum Fotografen, habe eine wundervolle Beziehung und einfach super tolle Freunde die nicht einfach so gehen wenn es mal schwierig wird oder auch mal Probleme verstehen und mir Helfen!

Wie ihr Lest oder auch nicht , bin ich nicht einer der Fotografen die damit Geld verdienen wollen oder Anerkennung haben wollen! Für mich ist es KUNST! Meine Auslebung , flucht aus dem Alltag und ein bisschen Kopf abschalten.

Deswegen ist mir diese Kampagne auch so extrem wichtig, ich stehe vor einem Problem , ich bin 2 Lehrjahr , kaum verdienst alles mache ich nebenbei... alles Kostenlos . Ich brauche daher eure Hilfe für meine nächsten Projekte die groß werden etwas Geld zusammen zu kratzen .

Daher habe ich mit großartigen Cosplayern dieses Jahr daran gesessen 3 Kalender euch anbieten zu können!

Alle in A3 Größe in den Kategorien :

-Cosplay

-Fantasy , Fabelwesen, Gijinkas

-Fashion

oder 13x18 Prints

Sowie Poster in 30x40 mit verschiedenen Motiven , vielleicht auch von euren Lieblingen ;)

Es geht mir nicht darum um mit dem Geld was bei raus kommt , mir nen Fetten zu machen und in den Urlaub fliegen zu können ... NEIN! Ich brauche nur Unterstützung .

Was ihr bewirkt? Neue großartige Projekte mit vielen Modelen... wenn euch meine Seite oder sogar ich euch als Mensch viel bedeute ... bitte Unterstütz meine Modele und mich dabei , noch krassere Sachen zu Planen und umzusetzen

Happy Berry ist ungern die 0815 Fotografin um die Ecke, sie will DIE Fotografin werden und dafür Opfere ich meine Freizeit und großteils die Zeit mit meinem Freund... Urlaube die ich hätte schon längst machen können und Conventions zu denen ich hätte fahren können.

Ich Stecke jedes Geld was ich irgendwie über habe .. da rein und das können alle meine Modele bestätigen, sei es ein neuer HG bei mir zu Hause , ein neuer Nebler oder eine neue Kamera ( danke meine Freunde) besten Einfälle.

 

Ich danke schonmal allen die mir wirklich helfen wollen auch wenn es nur wenig ist , es ist hilfe  und die kann ich dringend gebrauchen.

DANKE!

story:
Growing with Atlanta

Atlanta Through My Lens: The Photography of Ron Sherman is my fifth hardcover book since my arrival in Atlanta in 1971.  Two of the four books were sponsored by Atlanta Organizations, the Chamber of Commerce and Economic Development Commissions and the other two by publishers.  These book assignments allowed me to create a collection of Atlanta photos that helped build my extensive photo archives.

My current book is about the people and events that made this city what it is today.  Most other Atlanta books are basically travel guides, including my first four. This book is my effort to illustrate the people, personalities and events that made a difference in the city’s growth, opportunities and prosperity. These are the people I want to honor.

While many of the subjects in this book were only in front of my camera for the length of the event I was covering, quite a few gave me more time than I had expected.  Besides the famous subjects like Jimmy Carter, Hank Aaron, and Maynard Jackson, many of the subjects were not famous, just everyday people doing their job, volunteering, protesting, and making a difference.

I have preserved thousands of photographs of Atlanta and have selected about two hundred images that will tell the best story.  Subjects range from a natural resource like the Chattahoochee River and the string of parks throughout the city, volunteers giving countless hours helping neighbors to the numerous protest marches, to corporate and political leaders, and key events in the last three decades of the 20th century.

I am using Indiegogo to raise the funds to pay for the printing and creative effort to produce this book.  Your investment now in one or multiple of the soon to be collector item books will help this walk through thirty years of Atlanta’s explosive growth become a reality.

Projected Book Specs

  • Approximately 224 pages signed by the photographer
  • Approximately 195 photographs, black & white and color
  • 3 custom made note cards for each book purchased
  • 8x10, 11x14, 13x19 Archival pigment prints signed by the photographer
  • Hard bound 9x12 inches with wrap-around cover
  • Edition of 1000

 

 

About Ron

My Story

I fell in love with photography when I was in junior high school and saw the magic of the first Polaroid camera making a finished photo in minutes.  My first published photo was a year later with my family’s camera in the school newspaper.  Equipment changes over the years, but I never lost my love of photography.

My goal as a photographer was to work for Life magazine. College, Vietnam and graduate school was my life’s path after high school. I arrived in Atlanta in 1971 and in 1972 ceased publishing its weekly magazine. 

Then it was plan ‘B’.  I had connected with the UPI wire service while in college and they welcomed me in the Atlanta Bureau as a stringer.  I also made contacts with Life, Newsweek, Time, and Business Week and started getting assignments from them.  There were also organizations like Volunteer Atlanta and the Boys Club looking for help marketing their services, so I volunteered for them.

Stock photography are photographs either done on assignment or self-assignment that are collected, organized and captioned by photographers, who then market these images to publications, advertisers and other potential users.  Some photographers find a stock photo agent to license their images, so they can keep on making photos while someone else distributes them. 

My first agent started to represent me in 1964 and I continued to have an agent until 2005.  Over the years, I have built up an archive of over 500,000 black and white and color negatives, transparencies and prints.  About half represent my collection of Atlanta subjects

The Atlanta Through My Lens hard cover book will feature photographs of famous and not so famous people. On my volunteer photo assignments, I found many of the individuals I documented may have had ordinary jobs, but they were extraordinary people.  Atlanta Festivals allows us to see through the dance, songs, dress and food the variety of cultures that live in our city.  The large events like the Super Bowl, National Conventions, and the Olympics gave Atlanta national and International exposure. The smaller event like job fairs, food pantries, fund raisers, and river cleanups improves our quality of life.

As a self-unemployed (employed on paid assignment, unemployed between assignments) I was only able to cover some of the many people,  events, protests and news stories that took place in the last three decades of the 20th century.  The challenge for me was to show through photographs and stories the essence of those thirty very important years.  I hope you agree and make this book possible.

story:
Short Summary

We are a group of Photography students studying in our final year at the University of Hertfordshire. The Apex Exhibition will be the last collaborative work as a group and will promote our photographic work in the heart of London at the Old Truman Brewery, Brick Lane. 

Donations and contributors will help us realise this opportunity in showcasing in the Big City and pay for the venue, as well as all the delights of drinks for the "big night". 

All contributors are invited to the Apex Exhibition, running from 28th June - 3rd July 2018. (Located: 2nd Room, Bottom Floor, The Old Truman Brewery, Brick Lane)

Opening Night: 28th June 6pm - 10pm

 

What We Need

We need to raise £3,000 in total to pay for the gallery space and the refreshments for the showcase, in order to make our night as successful and your night as enjoyable as possible. 

We will also be using the money to print posters, postcards, flyers and stickers to put in the exhibition. They will all be available for you to take as a souvenir. 

The image below presents the area (highlighted in green) which we will be hiring for a week in order to present our work to the public.

If we are unsuccessful in reaching the target goal, we will be forced to do more fundraising outside of this website, which could result in fewer and smaller donations. Therefore, for such a big sum of money, we are relying on this project to reach our target. 

 

The Impact

As Final Year students, this is the last and most important exhibition of our photographic career so far, as potential employers and clients are attending the showcase. This creates a lot of pressure on us to assure that our full potential is realised because "first impressions" do count! 

We have previously had group exhibitions at: The Heartwood Forest Exhibition and an exhibition in Luton, both of which had very successful turnouts and outcomes. 

 

Risks & Challenges

There are risks in all projects involving money and donations, although the biggest hurdle we face is not making enough money to pay for the exhibition space.

This, however, can be overcome by fundraising more around the university grounds and the surrounding towns of St. Albans and Hatfield Town Centre, in order to get the local people involved in the donations. This will involve creating photobooth stands, family portraits and general cash donations to our cause. 

We are very positive about the outcome of this project, but we understand you always have to look at the challenges that may arise along the way. We have risen above the challenges we faced in previous years to produce very successful exhibitions and know we'll be able to do it again with your help.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute to our campaign, please share this page with your friends and family on social media!

Every bit of exposure and support is very important to us and we will be extremely grateful for your help.

story:
Just a few words before starting. 

This crowdfunding is entirely dedicated to the production of the photographic book. The goal is to reach the funds necessary for the entire process to produce an edition of 300 copies. 

That's why your help is so important to keep it real!

Thank you 

 

THE PROJECT

East is a 'on the road' journey through the countries of the Balkan Peninsula started in 2015 and ended in 2018. The project aims to explore the relationship between the past and present of these nations and show how the past may influence or interact with the world today.

A particular focus is given to countries which until 2006 were part of Yugoslavia

In the project also have been immortalized some ‘Spomenik’.

The "Spomenik" memorials are reminders of bloody battles and thousands of deaths in the concentration camps. They were part of the celebratory program of the Yugoslav government, in an attempt to show the strength of the Socialist Republic through a strong visual impact.

Architectures, landscapes and portraits are explored in different seasons, from summer to winter to show all the facets of each nation and try to deepen their aesthetics.

The nostalgic key that serves as a leitmotif of the story is also maintained through the exclusive use of 35mm analog cameras.

The nations portrayed are Bulgaria, Bosnia-Herzegovina, Croatia, Albania, Serbia, Montenegro, Romania, Moldova and Transnistria. 

 

YOUR HELP

Thanks if you are reading these captions and thinking about making a donation, it means a lot. Your help will cover the entire production costs of 300 copies of the book.

Specifically, you are donating money for: proof-printing, printing on high quality paper, hardcover, wire binding, professional text editing, font licensing and graphics works. For those who choose the "special edition" options in addition you're donating for: box costs, printing costs.

If the goal is not achieved, the copy of the book you have purchased will still be delivered to you. The only difference will be that the edition will not be of 300 copies but a smaller number of copies.

 

THE BOOK

The book is ready to be printed and this is how it will be:

- Size 21x29cm

-  Hard cover 

-  Total of 140 pages and 60 photos  

- Wire binding

- Edition of 300 copies 

 

WHEN WILL I RECEIVE MY COPY?

The campaign will last 50 days. At the end of the campaign we will start the printing process which will last around 15/20 days.
In the end of April -or at the beginning of May- you will receive your copy directly at home.
Shipments will be made worldwide by courier with tracking number.

For any delays on the production I'll keep you updated.

 

RISK AND CHALLENGES

The ultimate goal is to get 300 copies for the first edition of this book, and it's also a challenge because it's a high number of copies, and to guarantee the quality of the photobook, the production cost is quite high. 

If unfortunately we don't reach the necessary funds for the stated purpose, the copy of the book you have purchased will still be delivered to you. The only difference will be in the number of the edition, not a 300 copies edition but a smaller number of copies.

 

CAN'T CONTRIBUTE TODAY, DON'T WORRY

If you can't make a donation now you can help us in other equally important ways:

- Share! Facebook, Instagram, Twitter - I will be graceful 

- Talk to a friend who may be interested, spread the word

- If you have a magazine, a blog, a webiste about art or photography just contact me and I will give you more information to share the project

 

SPECIAL EDITION WITH 50x70 PRINT

If you are still in doubt about which option to choose, or if you've already chosen this option this is the direct link to see the 50x70cm prints available.

http://benedettaristori.com/order-east-the-book/

After the order just send an email to benedetta.ristori@gmail.com  with the number of the photo that you've chosen.

 

SUPPORTERS LIKE YOU

 

 

STAY IN TOUCH

Website: www.benedettaristori.com

Instagram: www.instagram.com/b.ristori

Facebook: www.facebook.com/benedettaristoriph

Email: benedetta.ristori@gmail.com
story_txt: Just a few words before starting. This crowdfunding is entirely dedicated to the production of the photographic book. The goal is to reach the funds necessary for the entire process to produce an edition of 300 copies. That's why your help is so important to keep it real!Thank you  THE PROJECTEast is a 'on the road' journey through the countries of the Balkan Peninsula started in 2015 and ended in 2018. The project aims to explore the relationship between the past and present of these nations and show how the past may influence or interact with the world today.A particular focus is given to countries which until 2006 were part of YugoslaviaIn the project also have been immortalized some ‘Spomenik’.The "Spomenik" memorials are reminders of bloody battles and thousands of deaths in the concentration camps. They were part of the celebratory program of the Yugoslav government, in an attempt to show the strength of the Socialist Republic through a strong visual impact.Architectures, landscapes and portraits are explored in different seasons, from summer to winter to show all the facets of each nation and try to deepen their aesthetics.The nostalgic key that serves as a leitmotif of the story is also maintained through the exclusive use of 35mm analog cameras.The nations portrayed are Bulgaria, Bosnia-Herzegovina, Croatia, Albania, Serbia, Montenegro, Romania, Moldova and Transnistria.  YOUR HELPThanks if you are reading these captions and thinking about making a donation, it means a lot. Your help will cover the entire production costs of 300 copies of the book.Specifically, you are donating money for: proof-printing, printing on high quality paper, hardcover, wire binding, professional text editing, font licensing and graphics works. For those who choose the "special edition" options in addition you're donating for: box costs, printing costs.If the goal is not achieved, the copy of the book you have purchased will still be delivered to you. The only difference will be that the edition will not be of 300 copies but a smaller number of copies. THE BOOKThe book is ready to be printed and this is how it will be:- Size 21x29cm-  Hard cover -  Total of 140 pages and 60 photos  - Wire binding- Edition of 300 copies  WHEN WILL I RECEIVE MY COPY?The campaign will last 50 days. At the end of the campaign we will start the printing process which will last around 15/20 days.In the end of April -or at the beginning of May- you will receive your copy directly at home.Shipments will be made worldwide by courier with tracking number.For any delays on the production I'll keep you updated. RISK AND CHALLENGESThe ultimate goal is to get 300 copies for the first edition of this book, and it's also a challenge because it's a high number of copies, and to guarantee the quality of the photobook, the production cost is quite high. If unfortunately we don't reach the necessary funds for the stated purpose, the copy of the book you have purchased will still be delivered to you. The only difference will be in the number of the edition, not a 300 copies edition but a smaller number of copies. CAN'T CONTRIBUTE TODAY, DON'T WORRYIf you can't make a donation now you can help us in other equally important ways:- Share! Facebook, Instagram, Twitter - I will be graceful - Talk to a friend who may be interested, spread the word- If you have a magazine, a blog, a webiste about art or photography just contact me and I will give you more information to share the project SPECIAL EDITION WITH 50x70 PRINTIf you are still in doubt about which option to choose, or if you've already chosen this option this is the direct link to see the 50x70cm prints available.http://benedettaristori.com/order-east-the-book/After the order just send an email to benedetta.ristori@gmail.com  with the number of the photo that you've chosen. SUPPORTERS LIKE YOU  STAY IN TOUCHWebsite: www.benedettaristori.comInstagram: www.instagram.com/b.ristoriFacebook: www.facebook.com/benedettaristoriphEmail: benedetta.ristori@gmail.com

story:
phōs

Summary:

phōs is a photographic exhibition presented by University of Guelph’s 2014 Photography IV students. Many of us have been studying photography most of our undergraduate careers and this exhibition is a space to show our best work as undergraduate photographers. 

The exhibition will be held in two locations in the City of Guelph, Ontario, Ed Video (March 22 - 29) and Boarding House (March 22 - April 5), the closing reception will be held Saturday March 29, 2014. 

What We Need & What You Get:

We hope to raise $500 to help cover the costs of holding the exhibition; printing, framing and mounting, building and paintings costs, as well as food and beverages for the reception. Funds raised will also cover the publication of an exhibition book featuring each of the artists involved in the exhibition. 

All those who donate are invited to the closing reception. 

Each donation of $50 or more will receive an exhibition book after the closing of the exhibition.

story:
ONLY $2,500 MORE!!! 

 

We raised money through fundraisers and partnerships, but we need $2500 more!

Support a good cause now and help us turn this dream into reality!

“We live in a global community and our care and concern for others often finds us helping in places far from home. We are a nation known for our compassionate and generous people and we make a difference in the world. Humanitarians give freely to those in need. They ask little for themselves and they bring comfort and relief wherever possible. Documenting these acts of care and kindness is a valuable tribute to those who experience the uncertainties of altruism, when they leave the safety and security of our land for often hostile and dangerous places. Our London connection to those serving abroad will create a tangible link to the challenges they face and the changes they make.”  Honourable Joe Fontana – Mayor of London, Ontario, Canada

The HUMANitarians

the Faces, the Places, the Challenges

 What is The HUMANitarians?

The HUMANitarians is an idea we strongly believe in. It is a recurring dream and careful planning of years. It is a photographic documentary initiative about the human side of voluntary work. It is about feelings, fears and emotions. It is about situational, cultural and personal challenges. 

Why?

Relief work makes it into the media mainly on the basis of crisis situations. But as much as you hear about the circumstances, little is mentioned about the people who face danger and adversity to help others. It rarely makes the headlines, although the functionality of providing assistance would not be possible without the dedication of field staff.

We would like to give a little credit where credit is deserved and shed some light into the backstage darkness of voluntary medical support. By presenting a different angle to humanitarian work, we aspire to raise awareness and recognition, while honoring the tremendous effort that goes into providing aid. Featuring impressive photographs, personal stories and interviews from the field operations we will pursue compassion and pay tribute to the personalities behind the scenes.

What is your part? 

We invite you to dream our dream with us and be a part of something truly majestic. Something that is good, feels good and does good. With your contribution we can bring forward the human elements of such inhumane circumstances and show support to the supporters. 

With your gracious generosity we can visit three different geographical locations to offer regionally and culturally diverse context. Emergency assistance is needed in cases of armed conflict, natural disaster, epidemic and health-care exclusion. To deliver insight from these areas, we focus on the regions of West Africa, North India and South-East Asia. Our three-month journey begins at the end of November and we will be steeped in the day-to-day realities beside the field crews.

Who are we?

Juozas is a Canadian artist who has received his BFA from Concordia University in Montreal, and his MFA from the School of the Art Institute of Chicago. He is a professional photographer passionate about showing the shadows not just the colors.

Anita is a Hungarian economist, a graduate of Oxford Brookes University (Budapest). She is in constant search of information about people, stories, motivations, thoughts and feelings to find the good in the world.

Together, we run Forward Factory, a web-based enterprise where art and adventure meet charity. It is a forward thinking concept about an artistic approach to providing information, traveling responsibly while helping devotedly.

What do we need and what do we offer?

We need $19,000 to cover the costs of travel and research. We want to do something important. We do not intend to build a house or fly to the moon. We promise that every pledged penny will go towards getting us there and back and getting you as many pictures and stories as possible. The funding for The HUMANitarians - after having paid all the fees - will be used for travel costs (i.e. flights and local transportation), for personal and gear insurances and for food and accommodation. We have modest needs, modest expenses, but big dreams. 

We would like to honor your philanthropy by offering unique gifts for believing in us and our dream including archival quality prints, copies of our previous book, recognition and a whole lot of gratitude.

What if...?

If we surpass our goal? We fly to the moon... Ok, maybe not, but we will get closer to having the material published and being able to offer it to the charity organizations we work with for fundraising and recruiting purposes. 

If you can't afford to contribute financially, your support is still needed and highly valued. Please assist us in spreading the word and make some noise to get the ball rolling!

WE APPRECIATE YOUR HELP TO MAKE A DIFFERENCE!

Recent Publicity

We are were proud of having been featured in the following:

Metro News - online and print edition -

The London Free Press - online and print edition - 

The NonProfit Press

Aid Resources

Humanitarian News

CBC Radio "Ontario Morning" with Wei Chen

The School of the Art Institute of Chicago

My Little Hungary

Downtown London

Scene Magazine

The Beat Magazine

CTV News

Fanshawe College Radio

story:
Dixie Ramone and Albadoro Gala meet on the set of “Lady Burlesque” on air on Sky Uno in march 2011.

The harmony between them starts instantly but being respectively the teacher and a participant they have to wait until the show is over, from then on they are inseparable.

Dixie Ramone

After many years of dance training and driven by a great passion for music and performing arts, she studies at the Academy of the Art of Burlesque of the Micca Club of Rome, cradle of the industry in Italy, she becomes its teacher and raises newcomers now well known on an international level. She is one of the first Italians to perform on international stages: Berlin, Hamburg, Paris, Dusseldorf, New York, and more.

In 2011 she takes part, in the role of teacher, in the first talent show about burlesque “Lady Burlesque”, on air on Sky Uno TV in prime time for ten weeks; the same year following the wave of this success she is the first Italian performer to participate in and win the “Dixie Evans Burlesque Festival” in Las Vegas and the first to partake in the New York Burlesque Festival where she is by now at home.

In 2012, after being assigned the lifetime achievement award during the Catania Film Festival, she sets another record being the first Italian to take part in the Perth International Burlesque Festival and its tour in Western Australia. 

In 2013 she wins the 8th edition of the Rome Burlesque Festival which happens every year at the Micca Club.

 Albadoro Gala

The typical screenplay where the main character goes with her friend to an audition and she gets selected instead!

This is how the burlesque kidnaps Albadoro during the talent show “Lady Burlesque”, pulling her out from her business woman life made of grey suits.

From then on she performs in the best clubs in Italy and Europe, takes part in the Fish & Whips Contest in Berlin and in the Milan Burlesque Award in 2012 and with Dixie goes to the 10th edition of the New York Burlesque Festival. In 2013 she wins the Best Classic award during the Munich Burlesque Festival.

 

They start to tour the world together between international clubs and festivals, first as separate artists and then giving life to “The Missunderstanding”.

The Missunderstanding is a whimsical duo and after a few weeks from its life it is selected for the Milan Burlesque Award 2013.

But the duo is not just about art: the experience of the first and the entrepreneurship of the latter bring the two ambitious performers to be determined to create and produce events, but especially to give back to this ancient art the prestige that it deserves, contributing to the building up of a burlesque community in Italy like it exists in the rest of the world and bringing the Italian burlesque scene to an international level.

This is where the idea of producing the “Eternal Beauty” 2014 calendar comes from, with the aim of portraying the burlesque scene of Rome.

A comparison between the eternal beauty of the city of Rome and the fleeting one of its performers, between the austerity of its artistic patrimony and the frivolousness of burlesque, between the urban folklore and the glamour of the proscenioum.

The subject of every shot will be a performer and a roman view; from hidden corners of the capital to sights that are by now famous all over the world, highlighted by the splendor of the protagonists.

One of the experiences that Dixie and Albadoro shared was modeling for the 2013 calendar “Girls and Legendary US Cars” by the german photographer Carlos Kella, produced by Sway Books.

 

Carlos Kella is a photographer based in Hamburg. His passion for photography became his profession in 2007, after 20 years of work in the field of art buying, consulting and production for the advertising industry. 

His artistic works are dominated by american cars of the 40's, 50's, 60's and 70's combined with feminine beauty, a combination that portrays the power of women through their beauty, elegance and irony.

He met Dixie and Albadoro during his shootings for his 2013 calendar "Girls & Legendary US cars" for which they posed as models.

Some of his books and calendar publications include:

Coffeetablebook „Private Arrangements Part 1“ (2007)

Postcardbook „Erotic to go“ (2008)

Coffeetablebook „Model-Edition Vol. 1“ (2008)

Coffeetablebook „Model-Edition Vol. 2“ (2009)

Weekly calendar „Girls & legendary US-Cars“ (2009 - 2013 every year)

Monthly calendar „Burton on the Road“ (2011, 2012, 2013)

Monthly calendar „Gents & legendary US-Cars“ (2013)

Coffeetablebook „Photos, Love & Stories.“ (2012)

Monthly calendar „Queen Calavera - The Home of Burlesque“ (2013)

Postcardbook „SAY IT SWAY“ (2013)

 

"Eternal Beauty" is a new and challenging project for him, and he has embraced it with his typical enthusiasm and passion,  characteristics that make Carlos unique and a real pleasure to work with.

We, The Missunderstanding, have chose Carlos as the photographer of "Eternal Beauty".

One of the advantages of this cooperation is that the calendar will be distributed in Germany, Austria and Switzerland thanks to the label "Sway books" and in Italy thanks to the Caput Mundi International Burlesque Award, when it will be released.

 

This is an important project for the italian burlesque community, it will be a step towards the growth of this amazing and very valuable art, which has a long tradition and can fit in different industries, like art, culture, fashion, cinema and so on.

Italian artists are very talented and we feel the responsibility of our future, this is why your contribution will be of immense importance for the days to come.

The possible profit that we will get with the sale of "Eternal Beauty" 2014 calendar will be allocated to subsidize the Caput Mundi International Burlesque Award, an international burlesque festival that will be organized by us, The Missunderstanding, and will take place in Rome in november 2013, during which the calendar will be presented.

The funding are needed to cover the expenses of the achievement of this project.

Carlos will have to fly to Rome in the month of july for the shooting straight from Hamburg, Germany, he will need accommodation and a per day, this amounts to about 500 euro.

Equipment will have to be rented, the estimate is of about 2500 euro.

The post-production work and the printing will cost about 2500 euro.

It is fundamental to reach the entire goal in order to turn this little dream into reality.

 

This calendar will have a limited edition of 1000 copies and will be issued in occasion of the international burlesque festival in Rome called “Caput Mundi International Burlesque Award” organized by The Missunderstanding, which will take place in November 2013.

It will be distributed in Italy, Germany, Switzerland and Austria but it will be available on line, hoping that the beauty of Rome will get much further.

Here is a preview of the performers that have enthusiastically married this project and that will pose for us: Vampfire, Sophie D'Ishtar, Candy Rose, Peggy Sue, Giuditta Sin, Scarlett Martini, Rita Lynch, Grace Hall and of course us, Dixie Ramone and Albadoro Gala.

 

During the photo shooting also a brief video of the “making of” will be shot, and it will show how every performer turns from the girl next door into a diva, what kind of relationships are set up between them and the photographer, how the set will be organized, and noteworthy moments, funny and not, that now is impossible to predict but that will surely add interesting material for our supporters.

We will be happy to receive any sort of offer and we want to thank you in advance for the support that we hope to get.

 If you can't contribute, we will be happy and grateful to all those who can spread the word about this campaign in any way they can.

 

Thanks for your attention and support, we strongly believe in the power of people and we are positive that this project will inspire all those like us who strive to make the world a beautiful place with their art and passion!
