story:
Short Summary

Hello, my name is Joshua Gyovai. I am currently a student at Radford University where I am studying Elementary Education, one of my two passions in life. My second passion is photography, although over the past year or two I have not been able to contribute to my portfolio as much as I would like. My digital SLR is slowly becoming out of date (Nikon D70) and due to some lens issues, my only lens is an 18-55mm. This means that I am very limited when going out to take photos. I am asking for donations because I want to have the desire to photograph anything and everything again, and have confidence in doing so. After graduating, and becoming a teacher, I would love to be able to use my photography skills as a summer / side job. For those of you that know photography, you know that it can be a very expensive hobby. Lenses alone can cost thousands of dollars which is a real bummer, especially to a college student. That is the real reason for creating this campaign. Fifteen hundred dollars is not really close to what I need in order to purchase new equipment, but it is a start, and I'd rather not be too greedy. Please continue to read and thank you already for showing interest in my campaign. 

 

What I Need & What You Get

My primary need is of course new equipment, preferably: 

- Nikon D800 or something along those lines

- Various lens lengths and functionalities

- Printing Money

I will be offering various perks for those of you that are able to contribute:

- 4x6 photographs

- 8x12 photographs

- Autographed prints

- Poster sized prints (18x24)

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

- 'Like' my facebook page

- Email me at jgyovai@radford.edu for any custom orders. Prices are negotiable

 

Thank you so much for taking a look!

Hello, my name is Joshua Gyovai. I am currently a student at Radford University where I am studying Elementary Education, one of my two passions in life. My second passion is photography, although over the past year or two I have not been able to contribute to my portfolio as much as I would like. My digital SLR is slowly becoming out of date (Nikon D70) and due to some lens issues, my only lens is an 18-55mm. This means that I am very limited when going out to take photos. I am asking for donations because I want to have the desire to photograph anything and everything again, and have confidence in doing so. After graduating, and becoming a teacher, I would love to be able to use my photography skills as a summer / side job. For those of you that know photography, you know that it can be a very expensive hobby. Lenses alone can cost thousands of dollars which is a real bummer, especially to a college student. That is the real reason for creating this campaign. Fifteen hundred dollars is not really close to what I need in order to purchase new equipment, but it is a start, and I'd rather not be too greedy. Please continue to read and thank you already for showing interest in my campaign. 
 


What I Need & What You Get
My primary need is of course new equipment, preferably: 
- Nikon D800 or something along those lines
- Various lens lengths and functionalities
- Printing Money
I will be offering various perks for those of you that are able to contribute:
- 4x6 photographs
- 8x12 photographs
- Autographed prints
- Poster sized prints (18x24)


Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:
- 'Like' my facebook page
- Email me at jgyovai@radford.edu for any custom orders. Prices are negotiable
 

Thank you so much for taking a look!

story:
To view the images, follow the link below or have a look at the 'gallery' tab. 

https://uowphotodegreeshow.wordpress.com/

Thank You

Thank you for visiting our page. We are a group of students from the University of Westminster studying for our BA in Photography. At the end of this, our final year, we will be exhibiting our final projects at the Free Range Shows held at Old Truman Brewery in Shoreditch, London. A leading industry show, Free Range is open to the public and will also be attended by many leading industry professionals, providing us with an unparalleled opportunity to share our work in a professional context. 

The aim of this crowdfunding campaign is to support us, a group of 45 students, in raising enough money to help pay for our show catalogue, our space at the show, as well as printing, materials for framing and display, and any other additional costs that come with installing a high quality, professional standard exhibition.


What We Need & What You Get

We're looking to raise a total of £3,000. This money will primarily go towards collating and printing our show catalogue, an important presentation of all of our work that visitors to the exhibition can take away with them. 

The remaining budget will go towards paying for the exhibition space (alongside contributions from the University and ourselves), and materials, framing etc. 


The Impact

The show represents a culmination of three years of consistent hard work and dedication towards our craft as photographers. 

As a team we will be responsible for designing, setting up and curating the exhibition space. It is extremely important to make this show happen for all us, as it’s an exciting platform to show our work to a large audience and many great future opportunities are born out of exhibitions such as this one. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to donate, you can still help just by letting people know about the show! Please share this page with all of your friends, and we hope to see you all there.

story:
OLLI BERY

“Olli Bery has photographed the world’s margins for a long time. If this logical device wished he remains obscure, his images’ bright darkness have decided otherwise “ Michel Verlinden - LE VIF, L’Express

“Olli Bery a longtemps photographié les marges du monde. Si cette logique périphérique aurait voulu qu’il reste obscur, l’éclatante noirceur de ses images en a décidé autrement.” Michel Verlinden - LE VIF, L’Express

Far from the current logic of the world of photography and with the greatest fervor, Olli Bery dedicated for over a year all of his work to CRUSADE. An unprecedented photographic series, intense and unusual, the result of 13 years of a process in constant renewal.

Loin des dynamiques actuelles du monde de la photographie, et avec la plus grande ferveur, Olli Bery dédie depuis plus d’un an l’intégralité de son travail à CRUSADE, suite photographique sans précédent, résultat intense et atypique de ces 13 années d’une démarche en constant renouvellement.

http://www.olli-bery.com

LES EDITIONS SERITI

Les Editions Seriti were born from the desire to design books, with a sensitive and uncompromising approach. Each published book is designed from a special dialogue with the photographer. It’s the unique result of a photographic and editorial encounter.

The book is thought of as an object, revealing itself as a photographic work’s sensitive frame. From its narrative structure to its form, it is the result of a thought process, an answer to the photographer’s work.

Les Editions Seriti sont nées de la volonté de concevoir des livres, avec une approche sensible et intransigeante. Chaque livre publié est conçu comme un dialogue privilégié avec le photographe. C’est le résultat unique d’une rencontre photographique et éditoriale.

Le livre est ici pensé en tant qu’objet, et se révèle le support tangible d’un travail photographique. Depuis sa narration, jusque dans sa forme, il se veut l’aboutissement d’une réflexion, une réponse au travail du photographe.

http://editions-seriti.tumblr.com/

CRUSADE

The CRUSADE book is the result of a close collaboration between the author Olli Bery, and Marie Lan, from les Editions Seriti. It is above all a meeting of two unique personalities, animated by the desire to create a photographic and editorial work in its fullest conclusion.

It is important for us to axknowledge our independence, the deep beliefs and convictions that drive our daily work. This book is the brainchild of two allies who recognize themselves in their respective approaches.Freedom and dedication inspire us and allow us to conceive the work in its different shapes.

Le livre CRUSADE est le résultat de la collaboration étroite entre son auteur Olli Bery, et Marie Lan, des Editions Seriti. C’est avant tout la rencontre de deux personnalités singulières, animées par le désir de donner à voir un travail photographique dans son aboutissement le plus complet.

Il est important pour nous de souligner notre indépendance, les convictions profondes et les certitudes qui animent notre travail au quotidien. Ce livre est le fruit du travail de deux alliés, qui se reconnaissent dans leurs approches respectives. La liberté et le dévouement qui nous animent nous permettent de projeter le travail sous toutes ses formes.

Our collaboration has begun with the creation of a unique photographic film for the Festival Les Nuits Photographiques in Paris, in which Olli Bery was selected as the opening night’s “art director’s favorite”.
Screened on June the 26th, 2013, with the strong support of the evening’s honor guest, the MAGNUM photo agency, the film shows an editorial work in constant progress.

This film has also been screened on June the 5th, at Les Rencontre d'Arles , in the Off Section.

Notre collaboration commence avec la création d’un film photographique inédit pour le Festival des Nuits Photographiques à Paris, où Olli Bery a été sélectionné en Coup de Coeur pour la soirée d’inauguration.
Projeté le 26 juin 2013, avec le soutien marqué de l’invité d’honneur de la soirée, l’agence MAGNUM, ce film annonce un travail éditorial en constante évolution.

Ce film a ensuite été projeté le 5 juin aux Rencontres d'Arles, dans le cadre du Off

 http://www.lesnuitsphotographiques.com

 

If the film is a milestone in the creative process, we have never ceased to propose and respond to requests by driving the work always as far as possible, with accuracy and consistency, as a perpetual overtaking.
We have already proposed a creation of 10 pages for the catalog of Les Nuits Photographiques, and have released the first poster of a collector series, published in 100 numbered and signed copies.

Si le film a été une étape décisive dans le processus créatif, nous n’avons eu de cesse de continuer à proposer et de répondre aux demandes en emmenant le travail toujours le plus loin possible, avec justesse et cohérence.
Nous avons ainsi déjà proposé une création inédite de 10 pages pour le catalogue des Nuits photographiques, et avons diffusé la première affiche d’une série collector, éditée à 100 exemplaires numérotés et signés.

Many interventions that sustain our work, and allow us to offer a book designed in every detail.

Autant d’interventions qui nourrissent notre travail et nous permettent aujourd’hui de proposer un livre pensé dans ses moindres détails.

https://vimeo.com/69423365

THE BOOK

CRUSADE will be a box of 3 books, 3 spaces for the expression stages of a photographic work that is built with strength over months, as a claimed chronology of the survival of a photographer who dedicates himself each day a little more to go beyond its images. Each book speaks with and for the images, whether through the paper, the binding or the printing process.
Crusade, The Horror and Furor write CRUSADE.
Each book exists by itself, and calls also the other, with a graphic and narrative force.

CRUSADE se présentera sous la forme d’un coffret de 3 livres; 3 espaces où s’expriment les étapes d’un travail photographique qui s’est construit avec force au fil des mois, comme une chronologie revendiquée de la survivance d’un photographe qui se dédie chaque jour un peu plus au dépassement de ses images. Chacun des livres s’exprime avec et pour ses images ; qu’il s’agisse du papier, de la reliure ou encore du procédé d’impression.
Crusade, Furor et The Horror écrivent ainsi CRUSADE.
Chaque livre existe seul mais appelle aussi l’autre, avec une force narrative et graphique.

Technical specifications of the box:
Size: 21x30 cm portrait

1/ Crusade : 52 pages
Paper & Print – 2x2 duotone (black + gray) on coated 150 gsm paper
Cover - self colored black paper 250 gsm, 1color foil printing on it
Binding sections sewn, cover drawn on

Description technique du coffret:
Format: 21x30cm portrait

1/ Crusade : 52 pages
Impression en bichromie (noir + gris) sur papier couché 150g/m²
Dos carré cousu, couverture souple noire sérigraphiée

2/ Furor: 3 signatures of 6 pages gatefold
Paper & Print – 3x0 (black + gray + pantone red) on uncoated 100 gsm paper
Cover - self colored black paper 200 gsm, 1 color foil printing on it
Binding folded and gathered, cover drawn on with flaps (no binding)

2/ Furor : 3 dépliants de 6 pages, insérés dans une couverture à rabats noire sérigraphiée
Impression en trichromie (noir + gris + pantone rouge) sur papier non couché 100g/m²

3/ The Horror : 56 pages
Paper & Print – 2x2 duotone (black + gray) on uncoated 150 gsm paper
Cover - self colored black paper 250 gsm, 1color foil printing on it
Binding sections sewn, cover drawn on

3/ The Horror : 56 pages
Impression en bichromie (noir + gris) sur papier non couché 150g/m²
Dos carré cousu, couverture souple noire sérigraphiée

The three books will be included in a black box
500 copies, numbered and signed. Public price: 50€
Everything will be done with care and precision by Ofset Yapimevi in Istanbul, with whom Marie Lan has developed a close working relationship.
The numbers 1 to 50 will be offered with prints
The numbers 50 and 150 will be offered with serigraphs

Les 3 livres seront insérés dans un coffret noir, lui-même sérigraphié
Tirage à 500 exemplaires, numérotés et signés. Prix public: 50€
Le tout sera réalisé avec soin et précision par Ofset Yapimevi, à Istanbul, avec qui Marie Lan a développé une relation de travail privilégiée.
Les numéros 1 à 50 seront proposés avec des tirages de têtes
Les numéros 50 à 150 seront proposés avec des sérigraphies

 

WHY FUND IT?

The funds will be used in part to pay the costs of printing and delivery of the 500 copies of the CRUSADE box of 3 books.
Another part will be dedicated to the production of an exhibition that we want to show in Europe and worldwide.
- Design of three books and its box = € 3,000
- Printing, processing and delivery of 500 copies = € 12,000
- Exhibition prints, framing and communication media = € 3,000
Total = € 18,000
We have already committed € 3,000, and therefore ask for your support in the amount of € 15,000

La collecte servira pour partie à payer les frais d’impression, de façonnage et de livraison des 500 exemplaires du coffret.
Une autre partie sera dédiée à la mise en place d’une exposition que nous souhaitons faire voyager en Europe et dans le monde entier.
- Conception des 3 livres et de leur coffret = 3 000 €
- Impression, façonnage et livraison des 500 exemplaires du coffret de 3 livres CRUSADE = 12 000 €
- Tirages d’exposition, encadrement et supports de communication = 3 000 €
Total = 18 000 €
Nous avons déjà engagé 3 000 €, et sollicitons donc votre soutien à hauteur de 15 000 €

By supporting this project, you support independent publishing and photography, and a single project. The funds we need today will allow us to produce the book, but also to continue our collaboration.

En soutenant notre projet, vous soutenez l'édition et la photographie indépendantes, et un projet unique. Les fonds dont nous avons besoin aujourd'hui nous permettrons de produire le livre, mais aussi de poursuivre notre collaboration.    

If you have any question, please contact us at:

Pour toute question, contactez nous:

editions.seriti@gmail.com

NO PICTURES CAN BE USED WITHOUT PERMISSION 
ALL PICTURES and text ©Olli BERY-Editions SERITI

story: Big Thanks to the 2 generous people who supported me! :)

story:
NOTE, IN THE VIDEO I SAY KICKSTARTER PAGE BUT HAVE DECIDED TO SWITCH THIS PROJECT OVER TO INDIEGOGO INSTEAD. ALL REWARDS FOR DONATIONS ARE STAYING THE SAME.

CHECK OUT SUMMER OF SHRED PROMO VIDEO AT THE BOTTOM.

For the 4th year in a row I am trying to make Summer of Shred bigger than the last and this year is shaping up to be the biggest.
Shot between the months of May to August I have traveled 1000s of miles and have been coast to coast shooting for this zine. When roaming that much I have seemed to collect more photographs than I originally have in previous issues. I knew that this year I didn't want to leave anything out.
With previous issues of the zine I have held back and edited what I put in the zine and just put in what I thought was the best but really ended up regretting not putting some pictures in.
With that being said, this year I am not holding anything out, every photograph that I have shot with my FujiFilm x100 will be put into the zine which makes it pretty much twice the size.

This is where you come in!

Because its twice the size its hard for me to pull the funds to push a project this big on my own.
I have lined up a ton of cool rewards for every backer and will be busting my butt to make sure we (because with out you it can't happen!) can put this project into motion.

So thats about it!
Summer of Shred 2014 is all put together and ready to be sent off to the printer, I just need the help to send it there!

Shred Til Death,
Jamie M. Moore

story:
My name Tomasz Goli. I am an independent, freelance photographer,  and graphic designer. Originally from Poland, now living and working in London, UK.

Photography is a different layer of reality. It shows exactly what I want to catch and preserve. The vision so other from what our eyes can spot.

All the tools which help people communicate with each other, such as photography, have huge impact on entire humanity. It is important to develop them, as they allow us to stay together, speaking one voice. Traveling permits me to look for new ways of communicating.

During my race towards becoming a professional photographer, I have traveled to various locations such as Spain, Italy, France and around Great Britain capturing the variety of what human kind created and how nature interacts with us.

By supporting COLORS OF REALITY, your funds enable me to acquire the necessary equipment such as: new lens for my camera Canon EF 70-200mm zoom lens, Canon EF 35mm f/1.4L USM Wide Angle Lens, tripod and start exhibiting my work in London. This will be the start for my company TGoli Design.

As a supporter you will be granted with perks such as: HD quality wallpaper for your screen, poster size print, I will retouch or create collage from your photos as well. Images can be chosen from my personal portfolio - www.tgolidesign.com.

As I mentioned before photography can change the way we perceive the world. I believe that photos can draw our attention to details and improve the way we communicate. I would like to invite you to be part of this by helping me to transform my shots into the COLORS OF REALITY.

Thank you all for your funds. Do not hesitate to contact me on tgolidesign@gmai.com
story_txt:
My name Tomasz Goli. I am an independent, freelance photographer,  and graphic designer. Originally from Poland, now living and working in London, UK. 
Photography is a different layer of reality. It shows exactly what I want to catch and preserve. The vision so other from what our eyes can spot.
All the tools which help people communicate with each other, such as photography, have huge impact on entire humanity. It is important to develop them, as they allow us to stay together, speaking one voice. Traveling permits me to look for new ways of communicating. 
During my race towards becoming a professional photographer, I have traveled to various locations such as Spain, Italy, France and around Great Britain capturing the variety of what human kind created and how nature interacts with us.
By supporting COLORS OF REALITY, your funds enable me to acquire the necessary equipment such as: new lens for my camera Canon EF 70-200mm zoom lens, Canon EF 35mm f/1.4L USM Wide Angle Lens, tripod and start exhibiting my work in London. This will be the start for my company TGoli Design.
As a supporter you will be granted with perks such as: HD quality wallpaper for your screen, poster size print, I will retouch or create collage from your photos as well. Images can be chosen from my personal portfolio - www.tgolidesign.com.
As I mentioned before photography can change the way we perceive the world. I believe that photos can draw our attention to details and improve the way we communicate. I would like to invite you to be part of this by helping me to transform my shots into the COLORS OF REALITY.
Thank you all for your funds. Do not hesitate to contact me on tgolidesign@gmai.com

story:
Wait!!! Just because the campaign is over doesn't mean you can't support the Kenya workshop!
Just donate directly on our website!

We are View Finder Workshop.
And we create opportunities for disadvantaged children to discover self-expression, self-confidence & self-worth through photography. We put cameras in the hands of children, letting them tell their own stories of who they are & how they see their world. The results are phenomenal.

Photographs taken by restaveks (child slaves) & other vulnerable children during our Haiti workshop, January 2013.


Where we are going next.
This November, we are partnering with The Supply, an organization that built a secondary school in the heart of the Lenana slum in Nairobi, Kenya. They are committed to developing the children’s awareness of who they are within their own community. Together, we are designing a tailor-made 5-day workshop for all the students in Form 1 (that’s 9th grade to you) to explore the themes of identity & human dignity.

At the end of the week, we will host a gallery show at their school to exhibit the children’s photographs & share their vision with the local community. All the camera & printing equipment we bring to Kenya will remain at the school in Lenana, so the children can continue their photography education long after the workshop is over.


All, for just twenty bucks.
The cost of the whole workshop is $20,000. That's 1,000 people giving only $20 each. Just $20! Which is the equivalent of just 4 Starbucks coffees or a pedicure or a large pizza with all the trimmings. Donate $20 today! And ask 5 of your friends to donate, too. But let’s be honest. If you're inspired to give more, we won’t turn you down.

 

What your money will buy.
   • Cameras & printing equipment*
   • Basic travel & living expenses for 4 volunteers for a week  
   • Production of a short documentary about the workshop

*Price List
                        $15 : camera case
                       $20 : rechargeable battery
                       $25 : memory card
                       $30 : one ink cartridge
                       $75 : one ream of paper
                     $150 : camera 
                     $175 : hard drive 
                    $200 : printer 
                 $1,500 : laptop


What you'll be getting.
A very big, heartfelt thank you from us. Some warm & fuzzy feelings. A great story to share with your friends. Oh, and some highly desirable perks too:
   • A beautiful digital book of the children’s photographs
   • A gorgeous print of one student’s work
   • A stunning coffee table book with images taken by the children
   • Even Producer title on the film about the workshop!


Thank you, thank you, thank you!
Big or small, your donation will make it possible for 40 children living in the slums of Nairobi to experience photography for the first time. And that is extraordinary.



Donate today!
BE 1 IN A THOUSAND!

www.ViewFinderWorkshop.org

 Like us on Facebook.
Follow us on Twitter.

story:
Short Summary

The photographs in this book are a selection from thousands of images posted in a Facebook group with the same title as the book: The B-sides of Architecture.

  • 32 photographers from 12 different countries

  • 96 colour pictures

  • 144 pages printed on finest quality matte paper

  • Deluxe size: 306x280mm

  • Offset printing (not digital!)

  • Graphic design by Mika Okawa

 

More information about this book, including a sneak preview:

https://the-b-sides-of-architecture.com/

 

What is it about?

The B-sides are architecture when it first wakes up in the morning, before washing its face, combing its hair and putting on its makeup. They’re the antithesis of the Instagram culture that has seen spectacular buildings put up almost for the sake of an insatiable desire for an easily-digestible image – one that will, above all else, be attractive and liked.

The photographs in this book show us that other side: architecture’s unconscious, if you like, but an unconscious that is hidden in plain sight.

32 photographers from 12 different countries contributed to this book. Some come from a professional background, others are dedicated amateurs, shooting with all kinds of cameras including such found in smartphones. You may therefore notice a variation in the technical quality. This was intentional, just like the miscellany of settings and places.

Our objective was to give you an overview as broad as possible of the subject and the ways how to approach it.

We hope you will find this material inspiring.

 

Help us get a higher reach

The basic funding is secured already. The book will be out by early December 2020.

  • You can help us get a higher printing volume
  • You get it for a better price than later in the shops

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask your friends to get the word out and help us spread the word.

story:
Look Into the Book Here

 

The Project

The life in the streets of the Indian megacities New Delhi, Kolkata, Ahmedabad and Bangalore fascinated me. In all parts of the society I could see the traces of westernization and on the other side I could feel the deep routedness of the citizens in the traditional Indian culture. The vivid urban chaos full of crazy contradictions is showing the permanent competition between the different value systems. Billboards, advertising campaigns, film- and election posters, fashion images are mixed together with omnipresent god idols and historical symbols in the cityscape.

The lust for all this attractions in everyday situations is permanently forcing changes in social life. Indian Culture is influenced by the spiritual idea of Karma and this effects, that every single action in life is very important and has consequences. By taking photographs I was driven by this catchable tension, looking for all the normally overseen details and not illustrating distant ideologies. My respectful view on this overwhelming, mesmerizing and also sometimes irritating world is also meant as a statement of tolerance for different ways of life and religions.

Link zu Deutschen Texten
 

Untitled, New Delhi, 2013, from the book Karma Driver
 

The Philosophy of images

My challenge of the encounter with the unfamiliar world of Indian megacities is to create an individual picture language, which not keep the unknown in the realm of the exotic, but which discovers the nearness in the strange. The image of India in the international media world is dominated by colorful clichés of happiness or dramatic journalistic visions of disasters. My vision is more literary, influenced by the magic realism of Indian writing, such as by Salman Rushdie. Only a many-layered imagery full of unexpected discoveries and surprises can express my various feelings during the adventure of Indian everyday life.

In the book Karma Driver I am combining two different styles of photography. Vertical fragmentary views on urban spaces and objects were put together on the double pages to collage-like picture constellations. The enigmatic visual dialogue is creating an aesthetic ambivalence between harmony and confrontation. The spectator has the freedom to find own interpretations for the culture clash of eastern and western values. Another layer in the sequencing of photographic images are horizontal street photographs, focussing in a straight and at once subtle way on the condition of human life in the cities pf contemporary India.
 

Double page in the book Karma Driver
 

The Book Karma Driver

I am very happy, that the famous agency Heine/Lenz/Zizka is supporting me again by creating the design of the book Karma Driver. We realized together my earlier book projects Drift (2007), China! Which China? (2008), Catch (2015) and I really trust in their great skills.

The book should not be an ordinary container for photographic images. It must be a special object and all used materials have to work together to make it unique. The specialist for printing and enthusiast for book making Richard Reisen will help me to find the perfect papers and the exact image processing to give the colors in the photographs from India a bright life.

The 93 color photographs in the book will be framed by two very different texts. The introduction will be by the German Indologist Heinrich Zimmer. His philosophical statement from 1930 about Eternal India is at the same time an intense reflection of the role of images in the context of cultural identity. The essay My Hindi-Medium Father by the young Indian author Nimisha Misra at the end of the publication is a very personal and intelligent view on the influences of westernization to private life in contemporary India.

It’s fantastic, that Karma Driver will be published by Fotohof Salzburg,
an internationally very well known center for photography.

The publication is planned in May 2018
and will be launched at the Fotobookfestival Kassel (31.5.-3.6.2018).

The Book
93 color photographs by Wolfgang Zurborn
Texts by Heinrich Zimmer and Nimisha Misra
Publishing house: Fotohof Salzburg
Design: Heine/Lenz/Zizka, Berlin/Frankfurt
Production: Richard Reisen
Soft cover, 18x24 cm
Edition: 800 copies
 

Untitled, Ahmedabad, 2015, from the book Karma Driver
 

The Photographer

I was born 1956. Studies: Bavarian School of Photography, Munich and University of Applied Sciences, Dortmund. 1985 Otto-Steinert-Prize by German Society of Photography. 2008 German Photo Book Award for the publication Drift.

I had numerous solo shows of my works worldwide. Haus der Photographie, Deichtorhallen Hamburg presented my early b&w-photographs from the 80s and the series Drift and China! Which China? in 2009.

I participated in important group shows including the exhibition of 20th century German photography curated by Klaus Honnef On the Body and Other Things in Prague, Moscow and Berlin 2003/2004. Photographs of my book Catch were exhibited in the exhibition Imagine Reality  during RAY 2015 in Frankfurt and will be shown during the Triennal of Photography in Hamburg 2018 at Deichtorhallen in a presentation of international street photography of the last 70 years with the title: Street. Life. Photography. Seven Decades of Street Photography

In addition to making and exhibiting my own artwork, I am continually interested in communicating the richness of contemporary photography. Together with Tina Schelhorn I am directing Gallery Lichtblick in Cologne for more then 30 years presenting over 200 exhibitions of international photography. In 2010 I founded the Lichtblick School in Cologne. Since 1998 I am on the board of directors DFA (German Photographic Academy).

I am teaching photography in German and European schools and universities. With German House of Research and Innovation I was running 2013/14 master classes with young Indian photographers. The fantastic results were shown 2014/15 during an exhibition tour through five Indian cities and published at Verlag Kettler under the title The India Vision Quest.

www.wolfgangzurborn.de
 

Double page in the book Karma Driver
 

What I Need & What You Get

The goal of this crowdfunding campaign is to raise 8000.- Euro
for the production of the book Karma Driver.

The detailed costs will be:
6200.- Euro for the printing at Graphius - Deckers Snoeck nv in Gent  
1950.- Euro for Image processing and lithography
600.- Euro for a hardproof
900.- Euro for the print approval
Heine/Lenz/Zizka is supporting the project by making the layout of the book for free.

You can make this project possible by preordering the book, postcards and prints. Any financial support is very appreciated and it would be also great, if you could link and spread this campaign to your friends.

All backers will be mentioned in the book.
Shortly after the production of Karma Driver all books and book related rewards will be sent to you.

In June 2018 will be a presentation of the book including an exhibition and party at Gallery Lichtblick, Steinbergerstr. 21, in Cologne. All supporters are very welcome to celebrate together the realization of the project. With this event I also want to express my deep gratitude for the great help, which made everything possible.


Untitled, Kolkata, 2015, from the book Karma Driver

story:
(... für deutschen Text bitte scrollen)

NORTHERN SPRING CLASSICS

Ronde van Vlaanderen / Paris-Roubaix / La Flèche Wallonne / Liège-Bastogne-Liège


I love bike racing!
Strictly speaking, I’m a road cyclist who photographs, and has for years had an amazing passion:

"There's the gap. The riders will appear right there. Spectators are gathering to the left and right of it. Everything is in order. The waiting and the anticipation mingle. High expectation is burning. The suspense becomes the event's own pulse. Then the riders appear.
The passage of the peloton abruptly eradicates any arc of suspense and redeems all expectations. ... Facing the peloton, any and every elation transforms into pure joy. It is a moment of sheer enthusiasm."

Street races are something exceptional! And so early in the year, where more do enthusiasm and tradition come together than in Flanders and Wallonia? Every one of the day races embodies both the athletic challenge and the whole historical and cultural dimension of bicycle racing. All four have a colourful history and are impressively entrenched in their regions. These classics represent preeminent sport cycling – and everyone along the route knows this. In this book, I would like to share this great passion with you!

Financial Support
For five years I’ve been following this project and today the book is nearing completion. The first display copies will be finished for the exhibit at the international photo scene in Cologne (September 19-21). But only with your support can a larger edition be printed, which will also be able to reach international book markets. The amount of the edition’s copies depends on you. You decide! Your donation goes only into the printing.

Real-life and Viral Support
Any initiative is welcome! Help me to get this project out there. Send the campaign link to your friends and colleagues, i.e. on the social network of your choice. I’m psyched about any photography and cycling friend who shares my passion.



For All of You
If you love photography and bike racing as much as me, I invite you to not just become an associate publisher of the CONNECTED book, but also a proprietor of the premium fine-art prints from my photo editions. The age-resistant pigment print on Hahnemühle paper speaks for itself and is the nearly perfect transporter of the “soul” of my cycling!
As a supporter, you are needless to say invited to the exhibits and events and will receive the latest news.


Mathias Schneider
This photo book is my initiative in both idea and image. I am convinced that the photo book medium is the ideal choice to capture and tell about the many facets of bike racing.
Every spring since 2010 I was underway on my motorcycle in Flanders and Wallonia. I accompanied the professionals in four races for four years. A long chain of impressions arose out of this journey, which later led to different photographic bookings, i.e. RAPHA and Tour Magazin.
Through the years I followed only one goal: to give my road cycling an image. The photo book medium makes it possible.

About me:
Born in 1958 in Royal Oak, Michigan, USA
After stays in Chicago, San Francisco and Düsseldorf, I studied sculpture at the College of Art and Design in Cologne. Today, my work concentrates on photography and design.



Leidenschaft verbindet


Ich liebe Radsport!

Genau genommen bin ich ein Rennrad fahrender Fotograf, der seit Jahren eine große Leidenschaft hat:

"Da ist die Gasse. Durch diese werden die Fahrer kommen. Rechts und links sammeln sich die Zuschauer. Alles ist organisiert. Warten und Vorfreude vermischen sich. Überall brennt große Erwartung. Die Spannung ist der Puls des Ereignisses. Dann kommen die Fahrer.
Die Passage des Feldes beendet schlagartig jede Spannungskurve und erlöst alle Erwartung. ... Angesichts des Fahrerfeldes wandelt sich jedes Hochgefühl in pure Freude. Es ist ein enthusiastischer Moment."

Straßenrennen sind etwas Besonderes! Und wo kommen so früh im Jahr Enthusiasmus und Tradition mehr zusammen als in Flandern und der Wallonie? Jedes einzelne der hier ausgetragenen, großen Eintagesrennen verkörpert neben der sportlichen Herausforderung die ganze historische und kulturelle Dimension von Radsport. Alle vier haben eine bewegte Historie und zeigen eine beeindruckende Verankerung in ihrer Region. Diese Klassiker repräsentieren herausragenden Radsport par excellence – und alle an der Strecke wissen das.
Diese große Leidenschaft möchte ich mit diesem Buch teilen! 

Finanzielle Unterstützung

Fünf Jahre schon folge ich diesem Projekt und heute steht das Buch vor seiner Realisierung. Zur Ausstellung im Rahmen der Internationalen Photoszene in Köln (19. - 21. September) werden die ersten Ansichtsexemplare des Buches fertig sein! Aber erst mit Eurer Unterstützung wird eine viel größere Auflage möglich sein, die dann auch den internationalen Buchhandel erreicht. Von Eurem Engagement ist die Höhe dieser Auflage abhängig, Ihr entscheidet! Also werdet Förderer des Projektes! Eure Spende fließt zu 100 Prozent allein in den Druck.

Reale und virale Unterstützung
Jede Initiative wird mir helfen! Helft mir dieses Projekt bekannt zu machen. Sendet den Kampagnen-Link an Eure Freunde und Bekannten z. B. in den sozialen Netzwerken. Ich freue mich über jeden Fotografie- und Radsportfreund, der meine Leidenschaft teilt!


Für Euch
Wenn Ihr also die Fotografie und den Radsport ebenso liebt wie ich, lade ich Euch ein, nicht nur förderndes Mitglied des Buches CONNECTED zu werden, sondern auch Eigentümer eines der hochwertigen Fineart-Prints meiner Foto-Editionen. Denn der alterungsbeständige Pigment-Druck auf Hahnemühle-Papier spricht für sich und ist geradezu perfekter Transporteur der "Seele" meines Radsports!

Als Unterstützer seid Ihr natürlich zu Ausstellungen und Veranstaltungen immer eingeladen und bleibt regelmäßig über Neuigkeiten informiert.


Mathias Schneider
Dieses Fotobuch ist in Idee und Bild meine Initiative. Ich bin davon überzeugt, dass das Medium Fotobuch die ideale Wahl ist, um die vielen Facetten des Radsports einfangen bzw. erzählen zu können.

Seit 2010 war ich jedes Frühjahr per Motorrad in Flandern und der Wallonie unterwegs. Ich begleitete die Profis in vier Rennen vier Jahre lang. Eine lange Kette der Eindrücke entstand, die später zu verschiedenen fotografischen Engagements führte, z. B. RAPHA und Tour-Magazin.
Die Jahre hindurch verfolgte ich nur ein Ziel: meinem Radsport ein Bild zu geben. Das Medium Fotobuch macht es mir möglich. 

Zu meiner Person:
1958 in Royal Oak, Michigan/USA geboren.
Nach Stationen in Chicago, San Francisco und Düsseldorf habe ich freie Bildhauerei an der Werkkunstschule für Kunst und Design in Köln studiert. Heute konzentriert sich meine Arbeit auf Photographie und Design.
story_txt:
(... für deutschen Text bitte scrollen)NORTHERN SPRING CLASSICSRonde van Vlaanderen / Paris-Roubaix / La Flèche Wallonne / Liège-Bastogne-LiègeI love bike racing!Strictly speaking, I’m a road cyclist who photographs, and has for years had an amazing passion:"There's the gap. The riders will appear right there. Spectators are gathering to the left and right of it. Everything is in order. The waiting and the anticipation mingle. High expectation is burning. The suspense becomes the event's own pulse. Then the riders appear.The passage of the peloton abruptly eradicates any arc of suspense and redeems all expectations. ... Facing the peloton, any and every elation transforms into pure joy. It is a moment of sheer enthusiasm."Street races are something exceptional! And so early in the year, where more do enthusiasm and tradition come together than in Flanders and Wallonia? Every one of the day races embodies both the athletic challenge and the whole historical and cultural dimension of bicycle racing. All four have a colourful history and are impressively entrenched in their regions. These classics represent preeminent sport cycling – and everyone along the route knows this. In this book, I would like to share this great passion with you!Financial SupportFor five years I’ve been following this project and today the book is nearing completion. The first display copies will be finished for the exhibit at the international photo scene in Cologne (September 19-21). But only with your support can a larger edition be printed, which will also be able to reach international book markets. The amount of the edition’s copies depends on you. You decide! Your donation goes only into the printing.Real-life and Viral SupportAny initiative is welcome! Help me to get this project out there. Send the campaign link to your friends and colleagues, i.e. on the social network of your choice. I’m psyched about any photography and cycling friend who shares my passion.For All of YouIf you love photography and bike racing as much as me, I invite you to not just become an associate publisher of the CONNECTED book, but also a proprietor of the premium fine-art prints from my photo editions. The age-resistant pigment print on Hahnemühle paper speaks for itself and is the nearly perfect transporter of the “soul” of my cycling!As a supporter, you are needless to say invited to the exhibits and events and will receive the latest news.Mathias SchneiderThis photo book is my initiative in both idea and image. I am convinced that the photo book medium is the ideal choice to capture and tell about the many facets of bike racing.Every spring since 2010 I was underway on my motorcycle in Flanders and Wallonia. I accompanied the professionals in four races for four years. A long chain of impressions arose out of this journey, which later led to different photographic bookings, i.e. RAPHA and Tour Magazin.Through the years I followed only one goal: to give my road cycling an image. The photo book medium makes it possible.About me:Born in 1958 in Royal Oak, Michigan, USAAfter stays in Chicago, San Francisco and Düsseldorf, I studied sculpture at the College of Art and Design in Cologne. Today, my work concentrates on photography and design.
Leidenschaft verbindetIch liebe Radsport!
Genau genommen bin ich ein Rennrad fahrender Fotograf, der seit Jahren eine große Leidenschaft hat:"Da ist die Gasse. Durch diese werden die Fahrer kommen. Rechts und links sammeln sich die Zuschauer. Alles ist organisiert. Warten und Vorfreude vermischen sich. Überall brennt große Erwartung. Die Spannung ist der Puls des Ereignisses. Dann kommen die Fahrer.Die Passage des Feldes beendet schlagartig jede Spannungskurve und erlöst alle Erwartung. ... Angesichts des Fahrerfeldes wandelt sich jedes Hochgefühl in pure Freude. Es ist ein enthusiastischer Moment."Straßenrennen sind etwas Besonderes! Und wo kommen so früh im Jahr Enthusiasmus und Tradition mehr zusammen als in Flandern und der
Wallonie? Jedes einzelne der hier ausgetragenen, großen Eintagesrennen verkörpert neben der sportlichen Herausforderung die ganze historische und kulturelle Dimension von Radsport. Alle vier haben eine bewegte Historie und zeigen eine beeindruckende Verankerung in ihrer Region. Diese Klassiker repräsentieren herausragenden Radsport par excellence – und alle an der Strecke wissen das. Diese große Leidenschaft möchte ich mit diesem Buch teilen! Finanzielle Unterstützung
Fünf Jahre schon folge ich diesem Projekt und heute steht das Buch vor seiner Realisierung. Zur Ausstellung im Rahmen der Internationalen Photoszene in Köln (19. - 21. September) werden die ersten Ansichtsexemplare des Buches fertig sein! Aber erst mit Eurer Unterstützung wird eine viel größere Auflage möglich sein, die dann auch den internationalen Buchhandel erreicht. Von Eurem Engagement ist die Höhe dieser Auflage abhängig, Ihr entscheidet! Also werdet Förderer des Projektes! Eure Spende fließt zu 100 Prozent allein in den Druck.Reale und virale UnterstützungJede Initiative wird mir helfen! Helft mir dieses Projekt
bekannt zu machen. Sendet den Kampagnen-Link an Eure Freunde und
Bekannten z. B. in den sozialen Netzwerken. Ich freue mich über jeden Fotografie- und Radsportfreund,
der meine Leidenschaft teilt!
Für EuchWenn Ihr also die Fotografie und den Radsport ebenso liebt wie ich, lade ich
Euch ein, nicht nur förderndes Mitglied des Buches CONNECTED zu werden, sondern auch Eigentümer eines der hochwertigen Fineart-Prints meiner Foto-Editionen. Denn der alterungsbeständige Pigment-Druck auf Hahnemühle-Papier spricht für sich und ist geradezu perfekter Transporteur der "Seele" meines Radsports!Als Unterstützer seid Ihr natürlich zu Ausstellungen und
Veranstaltungen immer eingeladen und bleibt regelmäßig über Neuigkeiten informiert. 
Mathias SchneiderDieses Fotobuch ist in Idee und Bild meine Initiative. Ich
bin davon überzeugt, dass das Medium Fotobuch die ideale Wahl ist,
um die vielen Facetten des Radsports einfangen bzw. erzählen zu können.Seit 2010 war ich jedes Frühjahr per Motorrad in Flandern und der Wallonie unterwegs. Ich begleitete die Profis in vier Rennen vier Jahre lang. Eine lange Kette der Eindrücke entstand, die später zu verschiedenen fotografischen Engagements führte, z. B. RAPHA und Tour-Magazin. Die Jahre hindurch verfolgte ich nur ein Ziel: meinem Radsport ein Bild zu geben. Das Medium Fotobuch macht es mir möglich. Zu meiner Person:1958 in Royal Oak, Michigan/USA geboren. Nach Stationen in Chicago, San Francisco und Düsseldorf habe ich freie Bildhauerei an der Werkkunstschule für Kunst und Design in Köln studiert. Heute konzentriert sich meine Arbeit auf Photographie und Design.

story:
Lovely Ladies

for

Men's Issues

2018 Calendar

In modern society, we often hear about issues affecting women, with news outlets and social media informing us that women are oppressed in the first world. The truth of the matter is, women today in the first world are treated far better than anywhere else in the world and in all of history.

The first thing you need to understand is that we do not hate women. We believe in equality for both genders, and endorse the idea that helping men doesn't take away support from women. This isn't about hate, this is about love of all people. Except when it comes down to it, the greatest victims are those who are unable to have a voice, who are blamed for all the ills of the world. Men are expected to sacrifice themselves for the greater good, even if that means no one will be there for them when they are in need of help.

Men suffer at a greater rate than women in the western world, but you never hear about it. Many organizations out there do what they can to silence the voices of those who just want a discussion, whether it's protesting a public speaking event, or shutting down the screening of a movie discussing important issues.

This calendar attempts to bring to light many problems that are easily ignored. The three of us (Modern Medusa, Reading Wren, and mad_cat) have seen men overlooked by society. This is why we dedicate our lives to helping in any way we can. The first step is to raise awareness, and that starts with releasing a calendar that will not only feature many women who want to help men, but also discuss key issues that many try to silence or ignore.

We only need $500 to produce calendars with pictures of beautiful ladies and facts about men's issues! Once we have the calendars, we will continue to sell each one for $20 on our website. With every sale we make, a portion of the proceeds will go to Veterans Mentoring Veterans, an awesome charity that trains veterans in high-demand careers!

It is our hope that we reach well-beyond our asking amount, as that allows us to expand our products, and donate even more to help veterans!

Confirmed Models

(so far)

Anna Cherry (January)
Rachel Souza (February)
Shagrin Anne Barrett (March)
Prim Reaper (April)
Unvarnished Void (May)
RioVenture (June)
Reading Wren (July)
Sassy Shelly (August)
Stuttering Soliloquy (September)
Modern Medusa (October)
Based Mama (November)
Mercedes Carrera (December)

Tiered Items

$1 - We want to remember each and every one of you who donate to us. Your name will be printed at the end of our 6-month 2017 calendar, citing you as being part of our success in putting it all together. When you donate, we ask that you inform us if you want to be mentioned, and in what way (username, pseudo name, etc). We will respect your privacy.

$5 - This is a special calendar for the remainder of 2017, featuring some of our models and facts about men's issues. This calendar will feature months July to December, and will be in PDF format sent via email.

You will also get our $1 tiered item with your name listed in our calendar.

$7 - Thanks to donators helping us reach $900, we now offer a photobook. This book will allow us to feature pictures of the girls that was submitted to us that were featured in the calendar. Each book will be 6x6, soft cover, with each page dedicated to a different girl and all her pictures.

You will also get our $1 tiered item with your name listed in our calendar.

$10 - Thanks to donators helping us reach $700 milestone, we now offer a wall calendar that features all 12 months and all 12 models for 2018. This will normally go for $15, but for this campaign you will get it for $10.

You will also get our $1 tiered item with your name listed in our calendar.
You will also get our $5 tiered item with our 6-month 2017 calendar.

$12 - Once again, thanks to donators for helping us reach $1200, we now offer a wall poster of Mercedes Carrera. Mercedes is known for many things, including her humanitarian work for Veterans.

You will also get our $1 tiered item with your name listed in our calendar.
You will also get our $5 tiered item with our 6-month 2017 calendar.

$15 - This is the calendar we are raising money for! It will go for $20 on our website, but for this campaign you'll be getting a special deal. This will be for the whole 2018 year, featuring our Lovely Ladies with each month dedicated to important issues that men face.

You will also get our $1 tiered item with your name listed in our calendar.
You will also get our $5 tiered item with our 6-month 2017 calendar.

$25 - This is a special reward from our Lovely Ladies: Modern Medusa, Reading Wren, & Shagrin. You will have your choice of a signed glossy 4.5 x 5.5 photo of themselves, sent to your home.

You will also get our $1 tiered item with your name listed in our calendar.
You will also get our $5 tiered item with our 6-month 2017 calendar.

$45 - Receive 2 signed photos of our Lovely Ladies of your choice. Value of $55.

You will also get our $1 tiered item with your name listed in our calendar.
You will also get our $5 tiered item with our 6-month 2017 calendar.

$75 - This is our Best Bang For Your Buck option! Not only do you get all other tiers, but you will also receive all three signed photos of our Lovely Ladies. This reward has a value of $115.

You will also get our $1 tiered item with your name listed in our calendar.
You will also get our $5 tiered item with our 6-month 2017 calendar.
You will also get our $10 tiered item of our 2018 Wall Calendar.
You will also get our $15 tiered item with our 2018 calendar.
You will also get all signed images featured in the $25 tier.

NOTE: We can't edit the perk to reflect this new change, but you are going to get the wall calendar.

$100 - Thanks to the donations, we offer the Ultimate Perk. This has everything so far in our campaign. This reward has a value of $140.

You will also get our $1 tiered item with your name listed in our calendar.
You will also get our $5 tiered item with our 6-month 2017 calendar.
You will also get our $7 tiered item of our Photo Book.
You will also get our $10 tiered item of our 2018 Wall Calendar.
You will also get our $12 tiered item of a poster of Mercedes Carrera.
You will also get our $15 tiered item with our 2018 calendar.
You will also get all signed images featured in the $25 tier.

$1000 - Reading Wren and Modern Medusa have offered to do private one-on-one call on Skype! You are free to discuss whatever you wish, within reason. Both will be very delighted to speak with you! Total time: 30 minutes. Limit 10.

You will also get our $1 tiered item with your name listed in our calendar.
You will also get our $5 tiered item with our 6-month 2017 calendar.
You will also get our $15 tiered item with our 2018 calendar.
You will also get all signed images featured in the $25 tier.

**WARNING**

This is not a solicitation of sex. This is a conversation between you and one of our Lovely Ladies. Both are very open-minded to the experience of speaking with someone, but if a request is made of them that they are not comfortable with, they will give you a simple warning and kindly tell you no. If the offensive behavior continues, both Lovely Ladies are free to end the stream at any time. There will be no refunds.

That said, they are both very patient, and want to have fun conversations. Please show them respect.

Milestones

If we make...

(Reached) $700 - We will offer a special wall calendar of the 2018 year, featuring all of our models. This will be a new tiered item.

(Reached) $900 - We will offer a photobook that features all the photos of our models in our calendar that were submitted to us. This will be a new tiered item.

(Reached) $1200 - Thanks to her dedication to helping veterans, we will do a special poster of Mercedes Carrera honoring vets.

$3000 - Lovely Ladies Summit. Due to the success of this campaign, we want to go bigger and better in educating the world of Men's Issues. We want to hold a special summit that is one part conference and one part meet-up. The money will go to bringing the models to North Carolina and hosting an event.

$3500 - If we do the Summit, we want to do a documentry for the summit. This would include behind-the-scenes of the special photoshoot, as well as interviews with models, those putting the calendar together, guest speakers, and those in attendence. More than that, we want to start doing special videos in the future of going to college campuses or public locations to do interviews on the street and ask about Men's Issues. This would help pay for a camera and mic, as well as other equipment to make this happen.

Anything beyond that will allow us to print more calendars and other products!

FAQ

How big will the calendar be?

The calendar, when open, will be 8.5 x 11.

I'm outside the US, why am I being charged more?

This is an extra charge for shipping. Since we are based in the United States, shipping overseas requires additional fees. This is only for the tiers that have physical items.

How are you supporting Men's Issues with pictures of women?

First off, there are many women within the Men's Movement that want to see men given a voice. They have fathers, brothers, sons, lovers, and friends who are men, and are tired of them getting a raw deal in society and being punished simply for being born male.

Secondly, whether it's men or women, straight or gay, we know people love the look of a beautiful woman. We know that this will be one of the main reasons someone buys our calendar, which is why we want to include facts about men's issues with each picture. Thus, when someone hangs this calendar up; others will see it, and be exposed to facts that are otherwise silenced in our society today.

Do these women know you're using their images?

Yes, they know. We asked each one personally if they want to appear in this calendar. They are also aware that this for Men's Issues, and all of them wanted to be part of this for that reason.

You are for Men's Rights and have a calendar full of women wearing almost nothing, do you hate women?

No, we don't hate women. We in fact love women... that's why we are doing this. Being for Men's Rights doesn't mean we are against women having rights. This isn't a zero-sum game for us, and we believe both can be treated equally under the law and within society itself. That is our ultimate goal.

Furthermore, sexuality is very beautiful and what makes us human. Many of us are quite sexual, and enjoy the display of beautiful women in sexy poses. Whether one's sexuality is masculine or feminine, no one should feel ashamed for what they desire.

Why can't I just give my money to the charity itself?

You are welcome and encouraged to do so. It is an amazing charity that does great things for  veterans who need help. It is our hope however, that by giving people something they want, we can raise more money to get more products, with a portion of each sale going to charity.

Plus, our calendar has information listed on it that would be good for anyone out there that might not know about these problems that men face. So in supporting this campaign, we can raise awareness and help out a great cause... all at the same time!

So are you capitalizing on the Men's Movement, and taking advantage of Men's Issues for profit?

The money that is earned from this campaign will go into buying products for us to sell. The money earned from sales will go to charity and to those who put this calendar together (including our Lovely Ladies). Our goal is not to make money from this. Our primary goal is to get the message out there about the issues men have, while also helping veterans.

I'm interested in appearing in the calendar, what do I need to do?

If you would like to be in our 2018 calendar, we are accepting submissions from all women willing to get involved. It is best to find us on social media and contact us from there. We will take a look at all the submissions given and pick from those to be featured in our 2018 calendar. Find us on twitter, or message us here:

mad_cat
Reading Wren
Modern Medusa

You can also find us on our website: http://www.llofmm.com

I don't have any money, but still want to help. What can I do?

Beyond donations, the best thing that anyone can do is to go on social media everyday and share our campaign. All of us on this project are doing what we can to spread the word, but we need all the help we can get. The more people share it, the more attention we will gain. The more attention we gain, the more donations we'll obtain!

It's important with social media to create your own post. Whether on Twitter or Facebook, hitting the Like button or retweeting something doesn't gain as much attention as making your own post and linking others or using a hashtag (#LLMM, #GenderEquality, and #HumanRights are a few popular ones!).

Where will the calendars (and other products) be sold after the campaign?

Once the campaign is complete, and we have printed all the calendars (and other merchandise), they will be available for sale on our website: Lovely Ladies of the Men's Movement. Our website is also a community to address serious men's issues, with an active blog and a forum that you can sign up for. You can also view some images of our Lovely Ladies there.

It is our hope that our website grows and becomes a place where people can get information about the Men's Movement, and also be able to share any problems they have.

What is the Lovely Ladies Summit?

The Lovely Ladies Summit is our way of taking our cause to the next level. We are blown away by the success of this campaign, and we want to try to do even more. It is our goal to bring as many Lovely Ladies to North Carolina in August.

We want to do a series of shoots with the girls, and a special video with interviews and behind-the-scenes footage. There is even a talk of a volleyball game. We also want to have a day of talks, where we join together with our fans and we discuss Men's Issues. This will also be a way for people to meet the models and the designers of the campaign.

We are open to Event Suggestions and guest speakers. This is our way of having a Men's Conference and a Meet & Greet with Lovely Ladies of the Men's Movement. We also want to do a special early sale of our products before they go on our website, and maybe even some event specific merchandise.

Anyone who has donated to this will get reserved spot for the event. While this will be a public event for anyone to show up, we may have venue limited seating, and in that case, we will have VIP for donators.

A BIG THANK YOU!

Whatever you're able to do to support our campaign, we appreciate each and every click, share, and donation. With your contribution, we'll be able to make this happen. Thank you to all the Lovely Ladies, and Lads, who supports us in making this calendar for Men's Issues!

This is only for the tiers that have physical items.How are you supporting Men's Issues with pictures of women?First off, there are many women within the Men's Movement that want to see men given a voice. They have fathers, brothers, sons, lovers, and friends who are men, and are tired of them getting a raw deal in society and being punished simply for being born male.Secondly, whether it's men or women, straight or gay, we know people love the look of a beautiful woman. We know that this will be one of the main reasons someone buys our calendar, which is why we want to include facts about men's issues with each picture. Thus, when someone hangs this calendar up; others will see it, and be exposed to facts that are otherwise silenced in our society today.Do these women know you're using their images?Yes, they know. We asked each one personally if they want to appear in this calendar. They are also aware that this for Men's Issues, and all of them wanted to be part of this for that reason.You are for Men's Rights and have a calendar full of women wearing almost nothing, do you hate women?No, we don't hate women. We in fact love women... that's why we are doing this. Being for Men's Rights doesn't mean we are against women having rights. This isn't a zero-sum game for us, and we believe both can be treated equally under the law and within society itself. That is our ultimate goal.Furthermore, sexuality is very beautiful and what makes us human. Many of us are quite sexual, and enjoy the display of beautiful women in sexy poses. Whether one's sexuality is masculine or feminine, no one should feel ashamed for what they desire.Why can't I just give my money to the charity itself?You are welcome and encouraged to do so. It is an amazing charity that does great things for  veterans who need help. It is our hope however, that by giving people something they want, we can raise more money to get more products, with a portion of each sale going to charity.Plus, our calendar has information listed on it that would be good for anyone out there that might not know about these problems that men face. So in supporting this campaign, we can raise awareness and help out a great cause... all at the same time!So are you capitalizing on the Men's Movement, and taking advantage of Men's Issues for profit?The money that is earned from this campaign will go into buying products for us to sell. The money earned from sales will go to charity and to those who put this calendar together (including our Lovely Ladies). Our goal is not to make money from this. Our primary goal is to get the message out there about the issues men have, while also helping veterans.I'm interested in appearing in the calendar, what do I need to do?If you would like to be in our 2018 calendar, we are accepting submissions from all women willing to get involved. It is best to find us on social media and contact us from there. We will take a look at all the submissions given and pick from those to be featured in our 2018 calendar. Find us on twitter, or message us here:mad_catReading WrenModern MedusaYou can also find us on our website: http://www.llofmm.comI don't have any money, but still want to help. What can I do?Beyond donations, the best thing that anyone can do is to go on social media everyday and share our campaign. All of us on this project are doing what we can to spread the word, but we need all the help we can get. The more people share it, the more attention we will gain. The more attention we gain, the more donations we'll obtain!It's important with social media to create your own post. Whether on Twitter or Facebook, hitting the Like button or retweeting something doesn't gain as much attention as making your own post and linking others or using a hashtag (#LLMM, #GenderEquality, and #HumanRights are a few popular ones!).Where will the calendars (and other products) be sold after the campaign?Once the campaign is complete, and we have printed all the calendars (and other merchandise), they will be available for sale on our website: Lovely Ladies of the Men's Movement. Our website is also a community to address serious men's issues, with an active blog and a forum that you can sign up for. You can also view some images of our Lovely Ladies there.It is our hope that our website grows and becomes a place where people can get information about the Men's Movement, and also be able to share any problems they have.What is the Lovely Ladies Summit?The Lovely Ladies Summit is our way of taking our cause to the next level. We are blown away by the success of this campaign, and we want to try to do even more. It is our goal to bring as many Lovely Ladies to North Carolina in August.We want to do a series of shoots with the girls, and a special video with interviews and behind-the-scenes footage. There is even a talk of a volleyball game. We also want to have a day of talks, where we join together with our fans and we discuss Men's Issues. This will also be a way for people to meet the models and the designers of the campaign.We are open to Event Suggestions and guest speakers. This is our way of having a Men's Conference and a Meet & Greet with Lovely Ladies of the Men's Movement. We also want to do a special early sale of our products before they go on our website, and maybe even some event specific merchandise.Anyone who has donated to this will get reserved spot for the event. While this will be a public event for anyone to show up, we may have venue limited seating, and in that case, we will have VIP for donators.A BIG THANK YOU!Whatever you're able to do to support our campaign, we appreciate each and every click, share, and donation. With your contribution, we'll be able to make this happen. Thank you to all the Lovely Ladies, and Lads, who supports us in making this calendar for Men's Issues!

story:
Click here to see my photography!

My Story

My name is Elijah Kihlstadius. I'm 19 years old, and I want to make a difference in this world. My story starts many years back, really. Growing up, is was in a very emotionally and verbally abusive environment. I was always the odd kid out, the odd ball, and the misfit. Unfortunately that environment changed me for the worse, as I grew up hating myself and hating everyone around me as well.


As I grew into my teen years, simple self hate and low self esteem stemmed into real serious problems. At first, it was simple self neglect and social avoidance. Then growing into my later teen years, I began to develop an poor eating habits, depression, and extreme avoidance of everyone around me.


In May of this year I was diagnosed with extreme depression. I was told that I should not be able to function. I was told that people in my mental state should not be able to work or go to school. I was told that people, like me, should be immediately admitted into a hospital for intensive treatment and therapy. And yet, here I am. Still trying to achieve my goals and show the world that God is not limited by my weaknesses.


“But he said to me, 'My grace is sufficient for you, for my power is made perfect in weakness.' Therefore I will boast all the more gladly about my weaknesses, so that Christ's power may rest on me. That is why, for Christ's sake, I delight in weaknesses, in insults, in hardships, in persecutions, in difficulties. For when I am weak, then I am strong.” - 2 Corinthians 12:9-10


In addition to being diagnosed with depression, I have also been fighting an eating disorder. Technically classified as E.D.N.O.S. (Eating Disorder Not Otherwise Specified), my disorder has caused me to maintain an unhealthy weight, and made it difficult for me to have a healthy immune system due to the lack of nutrients going into my body.


This is me. I am learning to accept the things I cannot change, and I am fighting to change the things that I can.

The Opportunity

I've been accepted to the Creative DTS (Discipleship Training School) at the Youth With A Mission base in Wiler, Switzerland. Additionally, they have asked me to teach the photography portion of the training there at the base. I could go into further details, but I want to refrain from possibly boring you with mundane things that aren't particularly pertinent to this letter.


I would be leaving mid September 2011 and returning early June 2012. My time there would be split up between a seven month training and lecture phase and two months of hard core global outreach, with four weeks of skill specific training, in my case photography, interspersed amongst the seven month lecture phase.

The Impact

I believe that before I can make a difference in other people lives, I need to first change myself. This opportunity to go to Switzerland will give me the chance to not only build a solid foundation for myself and my future, but more importantly this will give me the chance to heal. Away from the pain and darkness, I can begin to heal and put my life back together from the inside out.


What I Need

Right now I have saved almost $3,000 on my own, but I still need $6,000 to meet the total cost of my lecture phase.


Other Ways You Can Help

You can share this page on your Facebook, Twitter, or other social media profile! Check out the sharing tools and spread the word!
