story:
*** A big thank you to everyone that has supported me with this campaign***

Work to produce the book is already underway but in the meantime you can still order the book directly through my website here:

http://www.joewrightphotography.com/the-floods-book/

The project

Storytelling is one of mankind's defining features in our ability to communicate and no more so than through images. For me, images - photographs - are best printed, in either print or book form. As such the intent of publishing a book of a series of photographs with an option of accompanying prints is a natural conclusion to close of a chapter of images I have produced, to allow that story to be told.


The photographs

The images themselves were taken during some of the wettest years Britain had suffered in living memory; 2012-2014. They capture the unexpected beauty of a flooded woodland edgeland.

                        

Excerpts from the books foreword

“These are the ordinary woods, we all know woodlands like these; often over-looked, unnoticed or ignored by most. Places to be passed as we go about our lives, patches in the corner of fields, by the roadside, on the fringes of urbanisation, all remnants of a once heavily wooded countryside – forming parts of the ‘edgelands’.”

“...In all cases, what appears to be no more than invaluable woodland has an unexpected beauty of its own, sometimes best enjoyed by walking alone; in solitude.”

“It is through enjoying solitude in woodlands, or indeed the countryside as a whole, that we come to experience nature and understand its being and our relationship to it; for we are nature”

                        


I am honoured to say that work from this series has been commended as part of the UK Outdoor Photography magazine 2015 awards and has also been shortlisted as part of the acclaimed international contemporary photography awards; Fotofilmic '15

The project ethos

The premise is not to create a mass produced piece of work, partly driven by my desire to finish the production of each book by hand. This fits with my ethos of direct physical involvement with each and every image; from making the photographs, developing the film, preparation for print and hand finishing each book.

Quality and presentation of the work will be at the forefront of the project and I believe those objectives will be obtained both through my own passion for quality but also through selecting to work with arguably one of the leading fine art photography book producers as a mentor; Eddie Ephraums. With 30 years experience in the trade and himself a talented photographer; Eddie’s knowledge of fine art book production is second to none.

                       


The book

Note: The images shown on this site of the book are from the first set of prototypes I made to develop the concept. As such the final specification of the book may change subtly during final production stages.

I will be using a hand finished book binding technique for the book; based on a traditional stab binding/stitching process. I have designed and prototyped the book from scratch to ensure it handles and reads to complement the photographic subject matter, the aim being to invoke senses beyond just sight.

The constituent components of the book will be printed and manufactured commercially under the guidance of Eddie and, myself to sign off proofs and materials. I will then assemble, hand finish and bind them all myself. Whilst this is arguably more work for me and somewhat reduces the amount of books that can be produced, it fits with my ethos of producing as much of the work by my own hand and I believe is complementary to the body of work itself.

                       


The book will be available in two versions - a Standard Edition and a Collector’s Edition.

Standard Edition:

  • This edition will be limited to a 65 copy first edition print run and, will be signed and numbered by me. 
  • Note: Just 30 of these will be made available through this campaign, further sales will be handled thereafter through my website and other outlets with an initial expected retail price of £45.00 plus postage and packing.
  • 210 mm x 300 mm, ~80 pages.
  • Tactile soft cover with stitched binding technique using contrasting thread.

                                        


Collector’s Edition:

  • Featuring the same book content as the Standard Edition. 
  • This edition will be limited to just 35 copies; ever and, will be signed and numbered by me. 
  • Note: Just 15 of these will be made available through this campaign, further sales will be handled thereafter through my website and other outlets with an initial expected retail price of £95.00 plus postage and packing.
  • This edition includes a unique cloth bound case with each case inset with a different image featured in the series, making each Collector's Edition a one-off. 
  • This edition will also come with a limited edition print, of which you will be able to make a choice of an image from a small selection of photographs from the series itself (these choices form the basis of the pre-order options - ‘perks’ - with details provided further down the page).

                                  


Please note: the image shown on the case is for illustrative purposes. Each and every copy of the Collector's Edition will feature a singularly unique image from the overall series of photographs; making each copy of the Collector's Edition unique!

The fine art prints

All fine art prints are made using archival quality materials; fine art papers and ink set. I will be printing these myself, this way you can be assured of receiving a final print that meets the exceptionally high standards I set myself.

I have limited each image in the overall photographic series to a total edition size of 15 prints per image; that total is inclusive of all printed sizes. 

For the 5 image options being made available with the Collector’s Edition book (see below). Only 7 of 15 from each image edition will be made available to purchase with the Collector’s Edition book. Choice of image print option is based on a first come first served basis.


How to back the project

Backing the project is as simple as choosing to pledge a nominated amount of funds, with an option to take a ‘perk’ or not; both routes are showing your support to help me fund the production of the final amounts of materials to create the books.

The concept of perks allows me to reward your support through providing products or services in return. The perks I will be providing are based on three aspects:

  • A single Standard Edition book choice.
  • Five choices based around the Collector’s Edition book, each choice is based on one of the fine art print options (See image options in the following section).
  • An opportunity to experience photographing with an 8x10 large format field camera on a 1-to-1 workshop with me (further details in a later section).

You are more than welcome to make any combination of or, choose multiples of one or more of each of the perk choices or, as outlined to simply pledge without taking a perk.

Perks are chosen at the point you pledge using one of the perk boxes down the right hand side of this page. For multiple perks and/or repeat perks, this is perfectly possible but unfortunately the Indiegogo campaign platform requires you to choose each perk as individual pledges.

For this campaign only, prices include postage and packaging costs within the UK. Unfortunately I will have to charge a supplement for overseas postage, see bottom of the page for more details.

Perk 1 - Standard Edition book - £35.00

  • A pre-order for a single copy of the Standard Edition book.
  • Discounted for the campaign, thereafter with an initial retail price of £45.00.

                                    


Perks 2-6 - Collector’s Edition options

If you are looking for something unique then look no further!

As follows:

Perk 2 – Collector’s Edition book and fine art print option 1 - £85.00

  • Pre-order for a single copy of the Collector’s Edition book which includes a fine art print; option 1 (shown below).
  • Discounted for the campaign, thereafter with an initial retail price of £95.00.


Perk 3 – Collector’s Edition book and fine art print option 2 - £85.00

  • Pre-order for a single copy of the Collector’s Edition book which includes a fine art print; option 2 (shown below).
  • Discounted for the campaign, thereafter with an initial retail price of £95.00.


Perk 4 – Collector’s Edition book and fine art print option 3 - £85.00

  • Pre-order for a single copy of the Collector’s Edition book which includes a fine art print; option 3 (shown below).
  • Discounted for the campaign, thereafter with an initial retail price of £95.00.


Perk 5 – Collector’s Edition book and fine art print option 4 - £85.00

  • Pre-order for a single copy of the Collector’s Edition book which includes a fine art print; option 4 (shown below).
  • Discounted for the campaign, thereafter with an initial retail price of £95.00.


Perk 6 – Collector’s Edition book and fine art print option 5 - £85.00

  • Pre-order for a single copy of the Collector’s Edition book which includes a fine art print; option 5 (shown below).
  • Discounted for the campaign, thereafter with an initial retail price of £95.00.


Perks 7-10 - Large format camera workshop options

This may be your only opportunity and indeed the only option to experience using both 4x5 and 8x10 large format cameras in a workshop format in the UK!

As follows:

Perk 7 – One day 1-1 8x10 workshop - £295.00

  • A one day workshop to be held in 2015 with me for you to use both 4x5 and 8x10 large format cameras
  • To be held at one of the locations where the series of photographs was made – North Wiltshire / South Gloucestershire, UK.
  • Up to x2 8x10 and x4 4x5 sheets of Kodak Portra 400 colour negative film.


Perk 8 – A shared ‘on location’ 8x10 workshop - £350.00

  • A one day workshop for up to two people to use both 4x5 and 8x10 large format cameras.
  • To be held at one of the locations where the series of photographs was made – North Wiltshire / South Gloucestershire, UK.
  • Up to x2 8x10 and x4 4x5 sheets of Kodak Portra 400 colour negative film, shared.


Perk 9 – A bespoke weekend 1-1 8x10 workshop - £495.00

All the enjoyment of perk 7 but extended over a weekend at any location in the UK mainland.

  • A weekend 1-1 workshop to be held in 2015 with me for you to use both 4x5 and 8x10 large format cameras
  • To be held at a mutually agreed location within the UK mainland.
  • Up to x4 8x10 and x4 4x5 sheets of Kodak Portra 400 colour negative film.


Perk 10 – A bespoke weekend group 8x10 workshop - £660.00

  • A weekend workshop for up to three people to use both 4x5 and 8x10 large format cameras.
  • To be held at a mutually agreed location within the UK mainland.
  • You will receive the original negatives from your images as well as very high resolution digital scans of those images and, an A3 paper size based print of one of the images you take on 300gsm matt fine art paper.
  • Up to x6 8x10 and x6 4x5 sheets of Kodak Portra 400 colour negative film, shared.


Additional notes that apply to all workshops:

  • Please contact me if you would like to discuss other workshop format options.
  • You will receive the original negatives from your images as well as very high resolution digital scans of those images and, an A3 paper size based print of one of the images you take on 300gsm matt fine art paper.
  • The negatives, digital files and prints will be provided to you within a month of the workshop completion date.
  • You are responsible for your own travel, accommodation, food and other sundry expenses (I will provide some pre-workshop information including some accommodation options for the ‘on location’ workshop).
  • Additional film can be used at cost price for the film, developing and scanning.
  • Two 4x5 cameras, one 8x10 camera and a selection of appropriate focal length lenses will be available to use through the workshop.
  • The workshop does not come with a copy of the book, this is to allow people just interested in the large format experience to book.


The team

Joe Wright

(Photographer and author of The Floods)

                                                                 

Having spent much of my formative years living, learning and working in the countryside it was inevitable that when I picked up a camera it would be directed towards landscapes. I am passionate about using images to tell stories of the often overlooked typically quieter ordinary places of the British countryside.

I also regularly contribute and feature in national and international photography related articles and features, both printed and online.

Joe's website - http://www.joewrightphotography.com


Eddie Ephraums

(Technical and artistic mentor)

Photographer, writer, photobook maker and mentor. Eddie runs Envisage Books, providing creative and practical support for photographers wishing to convey their unique vision through bespoke small edition books.

As well as running his London-based Envisage photobook mentoring scheme, Eddie also co-runs the Open Studio Photo Workshop Centre in the wilds of NW Scotland, leading workshops with top UK photographers.

Over the years, Eddie has written for many eminent photography magazines, including the BJP and Black & White Photography, for whom he is a monthly columnist, sharing his particular vision on monochrome, with special emphasis on photobook making. He’s also been a judge of many prestigious competitions, including B&W Photographer of the Year and Landscape Photographer of the Year.

Eddie's website - Envisage Books


In summary

In summary the project is based around a few simple objectives:

  • To bring to life a completed series of photographs through the publication of an edition based book; available in two formats.
  • Provide an opportunity to obtain Limited Edition prints of the photographs.
  • Offer the book and prints at an introductory below retail price.
  • A unique opportunity to experience working with an 8x10 large format film camera “on the location” through a one day 1-to-1 workshop with me (with an alternative bespoke option available).

Terms

Note: p&p is included within the price for the UK only – a separate additional p&p supplement applies for non-UK based locations. As follows:

Standard Edition book

  • Western europe - £6.00
  • Rest of the world - £10.00

Collector's Edition book (Quite a bit heavier)

  • Western europe - £15.00
  • Rest of the world - £20.00

Here's how to buy if purchasing from overseas. Indiegogo don't make this easy unfortunately! Please read carefully.

DO NOT select a perk, instead, pledge the total amount required to buy the book plus the required postage amount. When you submit the pledge you will be able to choose a perk and pledge an additional amount which allows you to add the postage amount.

For example, to buy the Standard Edition book and ship to the USA: £35.00 + £10.00 = pledge amount of £45.00. So, pledge £45.00, choose the Standard Edition book perk and then add the £10.00 for postage in the 'additional' pledge amount box.

Note: Until the book goes into production all specifications are subject to last minute change.

It leaves me to just say for now that the book will go ahead regardless of the campaign funding target being reached! So, all being well that covers everything you need to go ahead and support my project; otherwise feel free to contact me directly either through this campaign page or through my website

Contact Joe through his website

     of an image from a small selection of photographs from the series itself (these
     choices form the basis of the pre-order options - ‘perks’ - with details provided further down the
     page).


                                  
Please note: the image shown on the case is for illustrative purposes. Each and every copy of the Collector's Edition will feature a singularly unique image from the overall series of photographs; making each copy of the Collector's Edition unique!

The fine art prints
All fine art prints are made using archival quality
materials; fine art papers and ink set. I will be printing these myself, this
way you can be assured of receiving a final print that meets the exceptionally
high standards I set myself.
I have limited each image in the overall photographic
series to a total edition size of 15 prints per image; that total is inclusive
of all printed sizes. For the 5 image options being made available with the Collector’s
Edition book (see below). Only 7 of 15 from each image edition will be made available to purchase with the Collector’s Edition book. Choice of image print option is based on a first come
first served basis.
How to back the project
Backing the project is as simple as choosing to
pledge a nominated amount of funds, with an option to take a ‘perk’ or not;
both routes are showing your support to help me fund the production of the
final amounts of materials to create the books.
The concept of perks allows me to reward your
support through providing products or services in return. The perks I will be
providing are based on three aspects:

A single Standard Edition
     book choice.
Five choices based around the
     Collector’s Edition book, each choice is based on one of the fine art
     print options (See image options in the following section).
An opportunity to experience
     photographing with an 8x10 large format field camera on a 1-to-1 workshop
     with me (further details in a later section).

You are more than welcome to make any combination
of or, choose multiples of one or more of each of the perk choices or, as
outlined to simply pledge without taking a perk.
Perks are chosen at the point you pledge using one
of the perk boxes down the right hand side of this page. For multiple perks
and/or repeat perks, this is perfectly possible but unfortunately the Indiegogo
campaign platform requires you to choose each perk as individual pledges.For this campaign only, prices include postage and packaging costs within the UK. Unfortunately I will have to charge a supplement for overseas postage, see bottom of the page for more details.
Perk 1 - Standard Edition book -
£35.00

A pre-order for a single
     copy of the Standard Edition book.
Discounted for the campaign, thereafter with an initial retail price of £45.00.

                                    Perks 2-6 - Collector’s Edition
options
If you
are looking for something unique then look no further!As follows:Perk 2 – Collector’s Edition book and fine art print option 1 - £85.00

Pre-order for a single copy
     of the Collector’s Edition book which includes a fine art print;
     option 1 (shown below).
Discounted for the campaign, thereafter with an initial retail price of £95.00.
Perk 3 – Collector’s Edition book
and fine art print option 2 - £85.00

Pre-order for a single copy
     of the Collector’s Edition book which includes a fine art print;
     option 2 (shown below).
Discounted for the campaign, thereafter with an initial retail price of £95.00.

Perk 4 – Collector’s Edition book
and fine art print option 3 - £85.00

Pre-order for a single copy
     of the Collector’s Edition book which includes a fine art print;
     option 3 (shown below).
Discounted for the campaign, thereafter with an initial retail price of £95.00.


Perk 5 – Collector’s Edition book
and fine art print option 4 - £85.00

Pre-order for a single copy
     of the Collector’s Edition book which includes a fine art print;
     option 4 (shown below).
Discounted for the campaign, thereafter with an initial retail price of £95.00.


Perk 6 – Collector’s Edition book
and fine art print option 5 - £85.00

Pre-order for a single copy
     of the Collector’s Edition book which includes a fine art print;
     option 5 (shown below).
Discounted for the campaign, thereafter with an initial retail price of £95.00.


Perks 7-10 - Large format camera workshop options
This may be your only opportunity and indeed the only option to experience using both 4x5 and 8x10 large format cameras in a workshop format in the UK!
As follows:Perk 7 – One day 1-1 8x10
workshop - £295.00

A one day workshop to be
     held in 2015 with me for you to use both 4x5 and 8x10 large format
     cameras
To be held at one of the locations where the     series of photographs was made – North Wiltshire / South Gloucestershire,     UK.
Up to x2 8x10 and x4 4x5 sheets of Kodak     Portra 400 colour negative film.


Perk 8 – A shared ‘on location’ 8x10
workshop - £350.00

A one day workshop for up to two people
     to use both 4x5 and 8x10 large format cameras.
To be held at one of the locations where the
     series of photographs was made – North Wiltshire / South Gloucestershire,
     UK.
Up to x2 8x10 and x4 4x5 sheets of Kodak
     Portra 400 colour negative film, shared.
Perk 9 – A bespoke weekend 1-1 8x10 workshop - £495.00All the enjoyment of perk 7 but extended over a weekend at any location in the UK mainland.
A weekend     1-1 workshop to be held in 2015 with me for you to use both 4x5 and     8x10 large format cameras
To be held at a mutually agreed location within     the UK mainland.
Up to x4 8x10 and x4 4x5     sheets of Kodak Portra 400 colour negative film.


Perk 10 – A bespoke
weekend group 8x10 workshop - £660.00

A weekend workshop for up to three people
     to use both 4x5 and 8x10 large format cameras.
To be held at a mutually agreed location within
     the UK mainland.
You will receive the original negatives from
     your images as well as very high resolution digital scans of those images
     and, an A3 paper size based print of one of the images you take on 300gsm
     matt fine art paper.
Up to x6 8x10 and x6 4x5 sheets of Kodak Portra 400
colour negative film, shared.

Additional notes that apply to
all workshops:

Please contact me if you would like to discuss other workshop format options.
You will receive the original negatives from     your images as well as very high resolution digital scans of those images     and, an A3 paper size based print of one of the images you take on 300gsm     matt fine art paper.
The negatives, digital files and prints will     be provided to you within a month of the workshop completion date.
You are responsible for your own travel,
     accommodation, food and other sundry expenses (I will provide some pre-workshop
     information including some accommodation options for the ‘on location’
     workshop).
Additional film can be used at cost price for
     the film, developing and scanning.
Two 4x5 cameras, one 8x10 camera and a selection of appropriate focal length lenses will be
     available to use through the workshop.
The workshop does not come with a copy of the
     book, this is to allow people just interested in the large format
     experience to book.

The teamJoe Wright(Photographer and author of The Floods)                                                                 Having spent much of my formative years living, learning and working in the countryside it was inevitable that when I picked up a camera it would be directed towards landscapes. I am passionate about using images to tell stories of the often overlooked typically quieter ordinary places of the British countryside.I also regularly contribute and feature in national and international photography related articles and features, both printed and online.Joe's website - http://www.joewrightphotography.comEddie Ephraums(Technical and artistic mentor)Photographer, writer, photobook maker and mentor. Eddie runs Envisage Books, providing creative and practical support for photographers wishing to convey their unique vision through bespoke small edition books.As well as running his London-based Envisage photobook mentoring scheme, Eddie also co-runs the Open Studio Photo Workshop Centre in the wilds of NW Scotland, leading workshops with top UK photographers.Over the years, Eddie has written for many eminent photography magazines, including the BJP and Black & White Photography, for whom he is a monthly columnist, sharing his particular vision on monochrome, with special emphasis on photobook making. He’s also been a judge of many prestigious competitions, including B&W Photographer of the Year and Landscape Photographer of the Year.Eddie's website - Envisage BooksIn summaryIn summary the project is based around a few simple
objectives:

To bring to life a completed
     series of photographs through the publication of an edition based
     book; available in two formats.
Provide an opportunity to
     obtain Limited Edition prints of the photographs.
Offer the book and prints at
     an introductory below retail price.
A unique opportunity to
     experience working with an 8x10 large format film camera “on the location”
     through a one day 1-to-1 workshop with me (with an alternative bespoke
     option available).

TermsNote: p&p is included within the price for the UK only – a separate additional p&p supplement applies for non-UK based locations. As follows:Standard Edition book

Western europe - £6.00


Rest of the world - £10.00

Collector's Edition book (Quite a bit heavier)
Western europe - £15.00
Rest of the world - £20.00
Here's how to buy if purchasing from overseas. Indiegogo don't make this easy unfortunately! Please read carefully.DO NOT select a perk, instead, pledge the total amount required to buy the book plus the required postage amount. When you submit the pledge you will be able to choose a perk and pledge an additional amount which allows you to add the postage amount.For example, to buy the Standard Edition book and ship to the USA: £35.00 + £10.00 = pledge amount of £45.00. So, pledge £45.00, choose the Standard Edition book perk and then add the £10.00 for postage in the 'additional' pledge amount box.Note: Until the book goes into production all specifications are subject to last minute change.It leaves me to just say for now that the book will go ahead regardless of the campaign funding target being reached! So, all being well that covers everything you need to go
ahead and support my project; otherwise feel
free to contact me directly either through this campaign page or through my
website
Contact Joe through his website

story:
Short Summary

Hello :)

My name is Monica, I'm a 23 years old girl and I live in Spain.

My dream is to become a fashion photographer! that's why I studied photography for 2 years and I've dedicated it all to grow up in the photography industry.

Even so, I've realized I still need to learn a lot about fashion photography, since I studied photography in general, so I decided to keep on my studies to be able to grow up as a better photographer and to take a Fashion Photography course in Barcelona to achieve my dream and keep my passion. Here's where I need your help... that academic course costs 5.000€, and though I've been looking for a job like crazy the whole year to pay for it, I barely earned a little part because of the unemployment situation in my country.

I won't stop fighting, of course not :) but if someone there gives me a hand,  i would be incredibly grateful and happy! I will do my best!

What I Need & What You Get

As I said, I need 5,000€ to pay my studies about Fashion Photography. That academic course takes place in an Arts University in Barcelona, called IDEP.

I've been working hard to get great photographies for my portfolio, and even though I need to improve a lot (and I will!), each of my pictures is an important part of me, and to every person that helps me I'm sending some of my work to say thank you♥

You will get photography prints and stuff. You can see it on the right ^^

What if I don't reach my entire goal?

Even if I don't reach my entire goal, every little help is really important for me, because everything will be destinated to pay my studies.

Every little help will create my future ^^

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate then helping spread the word of the goal I am attempting to accomplish, along with a link to my campaign would be awesome! I am happy to know that people care enough to help me out in any way that they can! 

A HUGE THANK YOU♥

story:
My Story

I have been working as a photographer for the last six years. I studied photography at LCC, part of University of the Arts London and graduated with a distinction in 2009. The majority of my work has been commission based, primarily in the fields of environmental portraiture and live events such as festivals, concerts, theatre productions and even a dabble in movie stills.


Something I have been lacking, however, is personal projects. Because of this, I feel that I've restricted myself creatively, which is a vital piece of the puzzle as a photographer. For several months I have been itching to launch myself into a project whole-heartedly, and that's what this is about.


For the last two years I have spent much of my time working as a bicycle messenger. I have met some great, interesting people who spend every day risking their lives dodging vehicles and pedestrians to get urgent packages across the city through wind, rain and snow. Even considering the constant danger of the job, it still often pays below minimum wage. These people don't do it for the money. For these people, it's about the thrill of being outside, cycling with such adrenaline, and a sense of freedom that barely any other job can provide. It is these very people I wish to document.


I'm looking to conduct a portrait series of these couriers. I want to capture the detail of these people, the clothes that they wear, their weathered faces, their tattoos, scars, even their bikes. I want to do this through medium-format colour film. I want to do it properly. I'm hoping that from this, I will be able to have the work printed larger than life and exhibited in a gallery space in London as well as release a full photo book of the portraits. I also intend on submitting it to several photo competitions like the Taylor Wessing Photographic Portrait Prize.


This is where I need your help!


The Impact

I'm hoping that through this project, people will be able to acknowledge bicycle messengers as a persons, a community, and enable us to bring people together to appreciate photography. I find bicycle messengers to be very visually interesting people, I can't help but want to photograph them, and want to bring this to the attention of the masses. I want people to be able to see every detail of the bicycle messenger, large and in-depth.

If I manage to complete this project, a certain percentage of profit from the sale of any photo books will go to towards the London Courier Emergency Fund, helping provide support and financial help to those bicycle couriers who have suffered an injury whilst at work.

What I Need & What You Get

To make this project possible, I'm going to be taking a step away from everything else and focus entirely on photographing this series. I'm hoping I can invest in the right equipment, not settling for a 2:3 ratio image, but rather a classic 6:7 medium format to capture the subjects in the right way and absorb all the detail they have to offer in the images.


I will be looking to raise funds to cover the costs of equipment, film, processing and development, printing and framing of the exhibition pieces as well as the potential printing of an accompanying photo book.


I will be funding this project as much as I can myself, but hope that you will be able to assist me to make this happen. I believe that at least $5000 (about £3000) is a realistic goal to help achieve what I believe possible. The more I can raise, the more likely it will develop into a project that can be displayed in a better gallery, with larger prints with a professional finish and the materialisation of a hardcover book.

In return, I am happy to offer many thanks, as well as prints of the images, invites to the private view of the exhibition, signed copies of the final book and more.

PLEASE NOTE: THIS SITE WORKS IN US DOLLARS - HERE IS AN APPROX. CONVERSION:

$10 ~ £6   //   $25 ~ £15   //   $50 ~ £30   //   $100 ~ £60   //   $250 ~ £150   //   $1000 ~ £600

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help by contributing financially, any other help would be much appreciated. Please promote this project online and with friends, share it on Twitter, Facebook, your blog or any means possible. Thank you.


// arronphoto.com

// facebook.com/messengerportraits

story:
Dear friends,

I hope this video doesn't make me look like I am too full of myself. I thought it was important I show you the scope of what I have done and am capable of doing. This is of course only a small sampling but there is already more than anyone really wants to see and this video is way longer than the recommended length.

My photos are labor intensive and expensive to produce and even with the new added advantages of Photoshop, they are not snapshots of some remarkable object or extraordinary vista you've come upon and want to record. My photos begin in my imagination and whatever I see there I try to realize in the real world so I can share them with whoever is interested. I have always dreamed beyond my pocketbook and “defied the elephants” more often than not.

There is very little I have ever done that was not achieved amidst a chorus of nay sayers. I know they were all well intentioned and only being sensible and looking out for my own good... trying to spare me more failure. However if I had listened to their advice I would never have done whatever I did that brought me to your attention.

This is my new exploration. I believe there are people out there that do not think a man is over with at my age. Most teenagers could not put in as many hours as I do. I am betting on there being people who know that this is the most productive and informed time of life for a person such as myself. I still have so many pretty good ideas in one day I have been criticized for having too many.

But there is an added advantage.... I have acquired... accumulated over the years.... the knowledge how to achieve my vision whatever it might be. The first photos I took... never having been to any photography school were of a sea nymph swimming in his underwater fantasy world and it was shot in my front room. There were nothing but naysayers then. They all laughed when I sat down at the piano ...but when I played!!!!

And so despite the doubters that still surround me with warning after warning, I am asking for your help to rise again above their protests and to prove to some small part of the world that neither age, nor fear of failure and being stored away in some home for the poor and elderly, nor any amount of good sense and despite how humble my circumstances ….dreams can still be made into realities.

What sensible person would have thought they could make a man appear to be swimming through an underwater MGM set in their living room...before computers...before anyone even considered something like photoshop?

One more thought.. Naturally I am not implying I am in the same league however Frank Lloyd Wright did some of his greatest work in his late 80s... and Betty White is still hot in Cleveland and being nominated for and winning Emmy awards.

Thank you,

Jim Bidgood

Please see the Gallery for images of all Perks!!!

If you would like to learn more about Mister Bidgood

Check out

http://www.barteverly.com/pages/film_velvet.html

or

Brian Clamp's gallery

http://clampart.com/

or take a peak at the

Taschen Book JAMES BIDGOOD

or Google

James Bidgood  Artist

or

James Bidgood Photographer

or take a look at

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Bidgood_(filmmaker)

The persons speaking on Mister Bidgood's behalf at the end of the video are:

Brian Paul Clamp, Director

ClampArt

Ira Sachs, filmmaker and Boris Torres, painter

 Hunter O'Hanian, Museum Director  

Leslie-Lohman Museum of Gay and Lesbian Art

Jonathan D. Katz

Director, Doctoral Program in Visual Studies, University at Buffalo

President of the Leslie Lohman Museum of Gay and Lesbian Art.

The background music is an interpretation of TWO SOULS ADRIFT from the musical THE ALMOST MAGNIFICENT SEVEN written by James Bidgood.


Video by Bart Everly
Additional photography by Gabe Hoot and Jon Winkleman

story:
UPDATE OCTOBER 30, 2015:

For those that have been asking, if you are local to Calgary and do not wish to pay shipping for the book, please use the donation option in the amount ofb$75 and send me a message via Facebook, email, or the comments section in IndieGoGo to let me know that it is for a book. Thank you!!

For those that have already purchased and paid shipping, I do not have a refund option for the shipping on the back end here, but if you pick up the book from me I would be happy to compensate you with a pack of postcards.



Allow Me to Shed Some Light

It all started with an experiment in lighting: isolating a figure in space, lit starkly from above and directly below. I’d never dreamed of seeing the human body and spirit so vulnerable, so powerful and so erotic. There was simply no going back. In the nearly three and half years since those first exploratory sessions, over 100 models in 78 sessions have stepped into the Lumination spotlight.

I have never worked harder, never lost more sleep, and never had so much support in any project that I have ever attempted. The Lumination Project features dancers, fashion models, athletes laying bare their raw power, passions, and vulnerabilities…

And now my sincerest hope is to share that energy and experience with you.

I am Calgary-based Photographer Tim Nguyen, owner of Citrus Photography, and I have been photographing everything I come in contact with for nearly half of my life. From fashion to industrial machinery to insects to nudes, every experience has lead me here, culminating in this body of work. The Lumination Project is ready for the printed page.


We Want You to See a Real Page Turner

With your help, Citrus Photography will print as many copies of this book as possible. We are determined to create hard copies so the details in the photographs, the subtleties of the light and the hours of craft required to create this work shine. The experience just isn’t the same on a phone or tablet. That is why we need your support.

Ethereal subject matter, the smell of paper and ink, the weight of a book in your hands; help us bring these blissful feelings to photography lovers everywhere.


Photo courtesy: Isabella Behnia

How Your Contributions Will Help

You will be directly responsible for seeing this project realized in print – infinitely increasing the exposure of the Lumination Project to local shops, galleries and art-loving homes. But we don’t want Lumination to stop there! We have long-term plans for copies to be sent to major publications in hopes of being picked up nationally and internationally.

For all that to happen, the skinny is this: digital book printing is very expensive, and we need funding to produce the book. We’ve got the pagination done, and it’s a vision to behold: a gorgeous, 108-page, 11” x 13” hardcover coffee table book. This book will be a perfect collector’s item for lovers of fine art photography, nudes, local art and those with too much space on their coffee tables.

At the time of putting this campaign public, the best quote received to print the book was just over $70 per copy. The more books we can put in a production run, the lower the costs, which means even more Lumination books around the world! We’re ready to print when you are.

Risks & Challenges

Your funding is going towards offsetting a huge loan that we have taken to ensure that these books are printed regardless of contributions. We want to take the printed product to galleries, coffee shops, local book retailers and many others to share this beautiful work as widely as possible.

What we need is for you to help spread the word. The Lumination Book has finally arrived! And (all things permitting) be in your hands for Christmas!

If our funding goals are not met, the pre-orders made through this campaign will be fulfilled regardless, but there will be even greater challenges ahead to bring our visibility to the next level.

Over the next few weeks as this campaign rolls on and funding increases, we will be releasing digital wallpapers and drawing for a signed print through the Citrus Photography facebook page.

Call to Action!

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help.

Please share this campaign on your social media pages. Send this URL to your photography-loving friends and families! The more you share, the more the love will be returned to us here, and the debt of gratitude we will have to you will be immeasurable. 


THE PERKS !

$5

Thank you SO MUCH

Contributions made at this level are the foundation for making the cost of printing possible. Thanks will be given to you publicly on the Citrus Photography Facebook page, as well as on CitrusPhotography.ca. Every dollar counts!

$20

Lumination: "Dance" Postcards

A set of 6 beautifully crafted postcards featuring the flow and momentum of dancers in the Lumination light. Send something powerful through the mail, hold onto as a Lumination keepsake. Exact photos *may* change.

$20

Lumination: "Characters" Postcards

A set of 6 beautifully crafted postcards featuring "characters" that capture the theatricality and emotive nature of the project. Send something striking through the mail, hold onto as a Lumination keepsake.Exact photos *may* change.

$20

Lumination: "The Men" Postcards

A set of 6 beautifully crafted postcards featuring chiseled features, striking jawlines, and epic facial hair from the strongest works by the male models. Exact photos *may* change.


$20

Lumination: "Strength" Postcards

A set of 6 beautifully crafted postcards featuring eye-popping musculature of the human body through movement, balance, and dedication. Exact photos *may* change.

$20

Lumination: "Dark" Postcards

A set of 6 beautifully crafted postcards featuring some of the most darkly erotic works from the Lumination project. Contains Nudity. Send something daring through the mail, or perhaps keep these ones for yourself... Exact photos *may* change.

$20

Lumination: "Faceless Figures" Postcards

A set of 6 beautifully crafted postcards featuring nudes without faces, capturing the etherial and anonymous nature of the human form. Send something striking through the mail, hold onto as a Lumination keepsake. Exact photos *may* change.

$20

Lumination: "Nudes" Postcards

A set of 6 beautifully crafted postcards featuring some of the most elegant and striking nudes from the Lumination project. Obviously, these contain nudity! Exact photos *may* change.


$25

Limited Edition Signed Print

Signed and Numbered 8x10 Lumination Print

Limited Editions for this campaign ONLY! These will not be reprinted!.

Please specify which print NUMBER you would like upon ordering.

$35

Two Postcard Sets

A total of 12 limited edition postcards from the above perk sets. Please specify the names of both sets you would like.

$50

Three Postcard Sets

A total of 18 limited edition postcards from the above perk sets. Please specify the names of both sets you would like.


$75

The Lumination Book!

Own your very own gorgeous, 108-page, 11” x 13” hardcover coffee table book, guaranteed to spark cocktail party conversation and envy. This book will be a perfect collector’s item for lovers of fine art photography, nudes, local art and those with too much space on their coffee tables.

Made from the blood, sweat and tears (all sustainably sourced) of Tim Nguyen, plus the loving support of hundreds of models, stylists, hair and makeup artists and other collaborators.

NOTE: THE FIRST 50 COPIES ORDERED OF THE LUMINATION BOOK WILL BE SIGNED BY THE ARTIST!

Shipping costs additional

$90

Lumination Book and Postcards

A copy of The Lumination Book AND your choice of ONE postcard set. Please specify the postcard set BY NAME that you would like.

$110

Lumination Book & 2 card sets

The Lumination Book and TWO sets of postards. Please specify the postcard set BY NAME that you would like.

$150

Lumination Book and 7 Postcard Sets

A copy of the Lumination Coffee Table book and ALL SEVEN sets of postcards!


$300

Your Own Lumination Shoot!

Tim will plan the shoot with you and create an ethereal, Lumination masterpiece of your very own. No special skills or modeling experienced required – Lumination has a way of bringing out beauty and intrigue in everyone. This photoshoot will make EPIC profile pics and artwork to hang in your home! 

Must be booked before the end of July 2016. Available in Calgary, Alberta, Canada only.
story_txt:
UPDATE OCTOBER 30, 2015:For those that have been asking, if you are local to Calgary and do not wish to pay shipping for the book, please use the donation option in the amount ofb$75 and send me a message via Facebook, email, or the comments section in IndieGoGo to let me know that it is for a book. Thank you!!For those that have already purchased and paid shipping, I do not have a refund option for the shipping on the back end here, but if you pick up the book from me I would be happy to compensate you with a pack of postcards.Allow
Me to Shed Some Light
It all started with
an experiment in lighting: isolating a figure in space, lit starkly from above
and directly below. I’d never dreamed of seeing the human body and spirit so
vulnerable, so powerful and so erotic. There was simply no going back. In the
nearly three and half years since those first exploratory sessions, over 100
models in 78 sessions have stepped into the Lumination spotlight.
I have never worked
harder, never lost more sleep, and never had so much support in any project
that I have ever attempted. The Lumination Project features dancers, fashion
models, athletes laying bare their raw power, passions, and vulnerabilities…
And now my sincerest
hope is to share that energy and experience with you.
I am Calgary-based
Photographer Tim Nguyen, owner of Citrus Photography, and I have been
photographing everything I come in contact with for nearly half of my life.
From fashion to industrial machinery to insects to nudes, every experience has
lead me here, culminating in this body of work. The Lumination Project is ready
for the printed page.
